If you run into a monster in the field, you'll go into battle.
The goal in battle is to defeat all the enemies; once their HP reaches 0, you win.
You have two gauges. The top one is your HP; if every party member's HP reaches 0, you lose.
The timeline moves in real time; when a character's image reaches the bottom, it's their turn.
<#006e5a>The timeline won't stop, even when you're making selections.<CLNR> So be careful!
When it's your turn, select an action from the choices on the right.
Normal attacks don't cost any AP (Action Points), and you'll gain AP when you attack.
Skills *do* cost AP, but will give you access to powerful abilities.
You can move your characters to better position them, or to flee from battle.
Now, press <IM90> and use a normal attack!
Since you used a normal attack, you gained AP!
Your AP is shared among all allies in battle.
AP will also go up when they attack.
Other actions may also consume AP, so use your points wisely!
You can raise your Tactics Level by earning max AP, then consuming it all at once.
Raising your Tactics Level will provide a number of benefits during battle.
Press <IM20> to raise your Tactics Level!
When your Tactics Level goes up, so will your max AP, allowing you to save up even more.
Also, <#006e5a>some skills will become even stronger<CLNR>.
Press <IM06> to use your strengthened ability!
Press <IM09> to toggle between Aggressive Mode and Negative Mode.
In Aggressive Mode, other party members will consume AP to use their skills.
Press <IM08> to switch targets, and press <IM19> to change stances.
That's it for this tutorial! Take some time to experiment and learn how to fight!
If you forget the controls, you can check the Help screen in the Guide menu.
With your Tactics Level increased, <#006e5a>normal attacks can now hit twice<CLNR>!
Press <IM90> at the right moment to execute multiple attacks.
If you reach Tactics Level 3, you can strike an enemy <#006e5a>3 times in a row<CLNR>.
Okay, press <IM90> to hit the enemy multiple times!

View illustrations and listen to music from the game.

Hi, everyone! I'm Yuri Noguchi, and I play Ryza.^00^00If I had to describe Ryza in a word, it would be "independent." She skips out on her chores without a second thought, and she's a bit of a tomboy. But I really admire how she begins to really take the lead on things after she starts learning alchemy. She's always courageous no matter what's going on, and she always speaks her mind. It was so fun and refreshing to play that kind of character.^00^00There were lots of comical scenes with Lent and Tao where you get to see lots of Ryza's personality, so I hope people pay attention to that if they play through the game again. I'm so happy I got a chance to voice the lead character for the first time; I'm going to play through the game again and again! And I hope everyone else enjoys Atelier Ryza as much as I did!^00^00Anyway, that's about all I have to say for now. Yuri Noguchi, a.k.a. Ryza, signing off. Bye bye!

I'm Hitomi Owada and I play the role of Klaudia Valentz.^00^00Did you enjoy the game? I really enjoyed playing Klaudia and getting to see how she grew as a person throughout her interactions with the other characters. I haven't had a chance to play the game yet, so I'm really looking forward to see how the world actually looks as soon as I get a chance; I'll definitely play it sooner or later!^00^00I hope everyone can play through the game multiple times and enjoy every moment of it. Thank you very much.

Hi there! My name is Takuma Terashima. I play Lent!^00^00First off, I'd just like to thank everyone who bought the game. How'd you like the latest Atelier game?^00^00To be honest, I've never actually played any of the games in the Atelier series, but I've always admired them. I really like their atmosphere, and I think alchemists and alchemy are really cool. It's great that you don't just go out and battle, but also get to create new things; I've felt that way ever since I was really young. I actually remember when the very first Atelier game was released, but for some reason I never played it. But in the end, I was still able to be part of that world for the very first time. The game itself is just as wonderful as I imagined it would be.^00^00So now I feel like I'm ready to jump into this world head-first. The Atelier series has a longstanding popularity, but I'm sure there will be some people playing it for the first time along with those who have played every other game. So I'd just like to say thank you to everyone who took the time to play this. I feel like this title is pretty different from all the others, don't you think? Did you have fun? I know I had fun in my role; I could imagine myself growing up in this village and uncovering all its secrets. It feels so huge, but at the same time small and intimate. Of course, for the characters taking part in the story's events, everything that's happening is really important to them. So of course I enjoyed reading through the story and getting to act out my part. Everything about the project was just really wonderful.^00^00Of course, even though I was involved in the game, I like to think I can still look at it objectively as a player. After seeing some footage of the gameplay, I'm sure I'm really going to grow to love it, so I'm definitely planning to play through it myself. I'm really looking forward to it.^00^00I want to say that I hope everyone's looking forward to it, but of course if you're hearing this then you've already played it; so instead I'll just say thank you! The game offers so many different challenges, I hope that you had fun and that you're looking forward to the next game in the series! Thank you all so much.

Hi! I'm Yui Kondo and I play Tao! Congratulations on beating the game!^00^00Tao is actually the third role I've played in the Atelier universe. I also played Corneria in the Mysterious series and Maana in the Arland series. It's really exciting to be part of the first title in a new series. To be honest, I totally didn't expect to get the role of a young boy; it's so different from my previous roles! But it was a lot of fun to be involved that way.^00^00The story and atmosphere in this game feels so different from the other Atelier games I'm familiar with, but it was still really great. While I was rehearsing my lines, I kept reading ahead to other parts of the story because it was just so good. What do you all think? Did you enjoy it?^00^00"Yeah, totally!"^00^00Oh, I'm glad to hear that! I feel the same way!^00^00Anyway, Tao is one of the main party members, which is a role I haven't had since Corneria. I just love getting the chance to record battle voices, because that's a great way to show off unique aspects of each character. For example, during the story Tao can be really timid and a little negative, but in battle he gets to show his inner strength. I hope everyone power-leveled Tao to make him even stronger, so he can remain his timid, negative self while smashing through all the enemies!^00^00Please raise Tao up for me!^00^00But you know, the Tao that I met when I arrived for recording was really different from his initial character bio that they sent me. It's hard to say what changed exactly; he was still really interesting, but he was a little more...incisive? So there was a little more humor to him. But the Tao I ended up delivering is just a really good, sweet kid, so I hope people will fall in love with him.^00^00I'm ready and waiting for my next chance to act out another character like this! Sorry, this is more for the people standing outside the recording booth right now. That's right! I want to be part of another Atelier game! As many times as you'll let me!^00^00Okay, this is getting kind of long. Thank you so much for taking the time to hear me out. For now, let me just say goodbye...^00^00"Hey! I see some ruins over there I don't recognize. I'd better go and take a look. I hope we can meet again someday. No--I KNOW we'll meet again! Okay, see you later. Bye bye!

Hello there. My name is Hirofumi Nojima, and I play the role of Empel Vollmer.^00^00I know Empel may look young, but he's actually a seasoned veteran; I guess you could say he's the intelligent type. There are a few lines that let us know he's actually quite old, so it was pretty easy to get into the role. After all, I'm not so young myself anymore, so it's much easier for me to play older characters. But I did make an effort to keep my voice sounding younger, so he's fairly close to my natural voice.^00^00As you saw, the game has a big, sweeping fantasy story that I think anyone can enjoy. Personally, I enjoy chemistry so the whole concept of alchemy really appeals to me; I could totally understand how Empel was feeling.^00^00I think this is the kind of game you can enjoy over and over again, so I hope everyone will play through it one more time from the beginning. Many thanks, from me to you.

I'm Haruka Terui and I play Lila Decyrus.^00^00Congratulations on beating the game! How did you like it? It was a pretty amazing adventure, wasn't it? Even though I haven't played it yet, I know you got to visit all kinds of different places. I just finished recording all my lines, so I'm looking forward to visiting all those areas--I can't wait to take on the Philuscha and beat them all! I also really love the cityscapes in all the Atelier games; they're always so pretty, so I can't wait to see what kinds of places I'll get to walk around in this one. And I'm really looking forward to seeing how pretty the lake is!^00^00Oh, some of you may know this already, but I played another character in the Atelier series--I appeared in every one of the Dusk series of games. I started off playing the part of a homunculus, and ultimately I got to play Homura, who ends up joining your party. I played through that entire trilogy, and my favorite part was definitely the synthesizing.^00^00I really enjoyed searching for items and gathering them up, and I'm definitely looking forward to doing that again. Speaking of which, I think it's really neat how Lila's able to turn whatever she finds into food. That's a really cool aspect of her character. I want to play as her and see how she reacts to all the different items--picking up stuff that's edible, and tossing away anything that's not. I just want to go around picking up everything!^00^00Also, Lila mentions how you have to make weapons that fit each person, so I want to use synthesis to make the strongest party ever. I wonder how long that took for all you folks who already beat the game... There's lots of detours you can take and minigames you can play, so it usually takes me a really long time to even beat it once. I'm not sure how long it took me to beat the Dusk games, but I feel like it took me forever. Maybe...30 hours for each one? I'm the type that likes to enjoy a game slowly; I savor the experience, searching for stuff and picking everything up while I work toward the main goal! And even after you beat them, there's always extra stuff to do, right? I'm not sure if that's true for this one, but I'm looking forward to going on an adventure in this beautiful world.^00^00I always put myself in the shoes of whatever character I'm playing, and I'm sure the gradations in this game will be even prettier than ever. Gradations? Sorry, I meant graphics. You can cut that part out, right? Anyway, the graphics are always pretty, but it gets even better once you breathe life into the characters and world. So I can't wait to experience it!^00^00Anyway! So you've finished the game, and now you're here. Great job! Which character was your favorite? It was Lila? Oh, thank you! I'm glad to hear you say that. I think Lila is a great character, and I can't wait to see how she interacts with Empel for myself. Ryza's also really cute, though. Everyone's so cute and charming, I can't wait to go adventuring with them!^00^00Okay, I should wrap this up. I just finished recording, so I'm kind of tired and maybe a little scatterbrained. But thank you so much for listening! You're too kind for sticking with it this whole time. And thank you for playing the game! I hope you'll keep supporting the Atelier series. It's not really my place to say that, but thank you anyway!

I'm Hikaru Midorikawa--I play the role of Karl.^00^00Congrats on finishing the game! Did you have fun? Whether this is your first Atelier game or you're a lifelong fan, I'm glad you picked this one up. You didn't borrow this from a friend, right? In that case, thanks for buying the game!^00^00Personally, I'm a huge game fan, so of course I'm familiar with this series. I haven't played this one yet, but I like how relaxed the world feels. It's a huge honor for me to get to be part of it. I play the part of an ordinary dad who doesn't fight or anything, so he fits into this relaxed world pretty well. Thanks to that, I didn't have to be too worried about the condition of my vocal chords. At my age, it wouldn't be strange for me to have a daughter Ryza's age, so I just imagined what it would be like if I really were her dad. I didn't have too many lines to record, but I enjoyed immersing myself in this world.^00^00I'd like you all to keep buying--I hate to ask this again, but you didn't borrow this, right? You bought it? Good, thank you. So I hope you'll keep buying these games and tell all your friends how great they are, so the series can keep going. If possible, please give all your love to this title!^00^00That's it for Karl. Goodbye!

I'm Yuko Nagashima, and I play Mio.^00^00To be honest, I really wanted to join in on everyone's adventures and explorations. But this was the first time I've played a character like this, so I really enjoyed it. And I hope everyone else enjoyed it, too. Bye bye!

My name is Kenji Hamada, and I play the role of Lubart Valentz. Thank you so much for playing Atelier Ryza.^00^00In this game, I got to play the role of a father. When you have a young child who's getting ready to leave the nest, it's happy and sad at the same time. I was pretty independent myself when I was younger, but this time I had to think carefully about how a parent would feel about their child going through that.^00^00I kind of disappear around the middle of the story, so I wasn't sure if I should read through the rest of the story at that point. Part of me wanted to save it for when I play the game myself, but my character does show up again near the end, so I had no choice but to read through the whole thing. Anyway, if you're listening to this then you've already beaten the game. I guess we can't really talk about which parts were the most fun, but I hope people will write me some letters about it!^00^00Okay, thank you for listening.

I'm Takashi Matsuyama, and I play the role of Samuel Marslink.^00^00Samuel is the type of guy who's never been nice to people, so when people are nice to him, he doesn't know how to react. He's not a bad person exactly, but he has his own way of doing things. So he does say and do bad things to others, and hurts them both physically and emotionally. In a way, I think he's kind of similar to me. So I'd like to take this chance to apologize on his behalf--sorry! And I hope you enjoyed the game.

Hello, my name is Yohei Azakami and I play Bos Brunnan.^00It was an honor being part of this new Atelier game! To be honest, I've never played any of the games myself, but it seems like they always try and do something a little different. In this case, the story especially hit home for me. It's really...how can I put it? It's all about youth. I love how everyone has their own dreams and departs on an individual journey. Reading the script made me want to do the same thing!^00^00For Bos, when I saw the character design I immediately assumed he was a bad guy. The description referred to him as a kind of defiant son--I don't get that kind of role often, so I assumed he would be this really pathetic character. But as I read through it, he wasn't the high-pitched sycophant I was expecting; he was more like a schoolyard bully. And near the end of the story, he has a complete change of heart--just like the bully in that movie with the famous blue robotic cat. Most of you probably won't get that reference, but regardless I think my character grows the most out of everyone.^00^00During my performance, I tried to always see things from Bos's perspective, and he kept growing and maturing through meeting new people. So he obviously had lots of potential. One thing I realized while I was playing him is that most people don't really change just because of their environment; they change because of the people they're around. Bos fought with his friends a long time ago, so he ended up alone. Then he became friends with Lumbar, who he tended to push around. But finally he realized he was basically still alone, and decided to allow himself to change. In the end, I think he's a pretty honest and all-around good guy. So it's more about people than environment. I'm really happy I got a chance to play the role of Bos Brunnen. Thank you!

I'm Ryota Takeuchi. I play Moritz.^00^00Okay, so...Moritz does seem really bossy, but he cares so much about his son, and he ends up spoiling him. You could sum him up by saying he's a businessman who does everything for his son. I guess I'd also describe him as a serial entrepreneur. I'm from Kobe, and so being from the Kansai region, my friends always ask me to go shopping with them when they need new appliances, so I can help negotiate a better price. Although I'm actually pretty terrible at that, so I guess I'm not a normal Kansai person.^00^00Basically, I'm nothing like Moritz Brunnen, who's aggressive about pursuing business. But I'm really happy getting the chance to play a role that's completely opposite to me. The entire recording process was a lot of fun.^00^00I hope everyone was able to see how Moritz is both really aggressive but also a completely doting parent. Thank you, everyone.

Hello, everyone! I'm Fukushi Ochiai, and I play Lumbar.^00^00So, how did you all like the game? Actually, everyone in my family is a huge Atelier fan, so I bet they all beat the game and are listening to this right now.^00^00I'm really happy I got to be part of this title! The recording process was super fun. Thank you all so much. See ya!

I'm Masumi Asano, and I play the role of Agatha Harmon.^00^00Agatha is basically a professional warrior--they call her a "guardian" right? To me, she seemed really graceful and level-headed. But she still had moments where we got to see a more adorable side of her. While I was playing her, I tried to find ways to show her more feminine side in bits and pieces.^00^00I remember one line where she mentions how she used to wear skirts, which made me think about how old she was when she was still wearing them, and how she would have looked in them. I really wish we'd gotten to see that--I bet she was really cute!^00^00Anyway, I hope you all enjoyed the game. Thank you very much!

Hello! I'm Shiori Mikami and I play Kilo Shiness.^00^00Congratulations on beating the game! The Atelier series has such a long history, and I'm really happy I got to be part of it. Kilo is the type of person that doesn't really show her emotions, so I had to try hard to keep them suppressed for every single line. Now that I get to act like my natural self, it's kind of a relief!^00^00Oh, and the singing! I got to sing with Ms. Terui's character--Lila! Right, I got to sing with Lila. Ah, that's not a spoiler, is it? Is it okay to talk about? It is? Great! So when I first heard the sample, it sounded so fantastical. I don't get the chance to sing something like that too often, so I hope it all came out okay! Oh but there's a dimensional rift, you know? So I haven't actually sung it yet!^00^00But if you did hear it already somehow, I hope you all enjoyed it, and I hope you could feel all the soul we put into it! Anyway, I don't want to ruin your image of Kill too much, so I'll wrap this up. But I hope you'll play through the game over and over again! Thank you!
The Puni changed its appearance! This is...<STR1>!
Not enough Gathering Synthesis knowledge. Collect more Travel Bottles.
The current level will be reset. Are you sure?
This is the gathering place synthesizer! But it looks broken.
Looks like this home is abandoned, too.
Hm. It's a dead end. Not like I'm interested.
Oh? Looks like they have regular juice, too! I want to try it...but it looks expensive.
This is the bread we baked! It has the Stout brand on it.
This is the cheese Basilia made. Hmm... I want to eat it with some bread.
I-It's huge! This definitely will taste good.
Looks like the catch is good today. We'll be eating fish for a while.
Lila brought this, but how am I supposed to use it? Never mind that, who is she, really?
I built this stage for Klaudia! She refused to use it because it was embarrassing, but that's what I find cute about her, too.
I can finally eat pizza! Well, I actually haven't eaten it yet. I should ask Empel on how to make it.
Everyone doesn't know this, but this was all thanks to me. I should keep this up!
Hehehe. The hot spring that I made Lent dig up is gushing! I'll go take a dip when all the dudes are gone.
I don't know how it happened, but this place is now Tao's research lab. I'm surprised how he can concentrate on reading with all the sweet smells going around.
The great spirit elementals could be somewhere else, too. I should try to find them!
Ahh, this place is so nice and cool!
Is that the island all the way over there?
Even the food tastes better over here! Ahh, I'm getting hungry again...
I'm so glad I brought a swimsuit! And I found a nice place to change...
There's so many fish here! I bet we can catch all different kinds.
I'd better not take a nap here. I'd get burnt to a crisp!
This is the perfect spot to grill up some fish!
I don't think I've ever seen this plant back on the island...
I had no idea there was a cave here! This can be like our own secret area...
Is this the back of Mr. Brunnen's place? I didn't know it connected like this...
I'd feel bad using a bunch of their stuff. Maybe I'll wait till I get back...
Is this...Mr. Moritz's swimsuit! Let's just...forget we ever saw this.
Oh, where'd the notebook go that was here? It was so useful...
Time for another adventure! Let's try and discover something new!
I hope we can discover something new!
I'm a little nervous...but I think we'll have fun.
I do so enjoy going out with everyone like this.
This is the perfect chance to hone my skills.
I can't wait to see what's in store for us.
You're gonna lead the way, right Ryza? I'll be right behind you.
Let's see if we can find what we're looking for.
I'm looking forward to see what happens here...
Even if you think you're safe, you always have to stay alert.
We should be careful as we proceed.
Hmph. Go wherever you want, I can handle it.
Everything'll be fine as long as I'm around.
Stay alert, and let me lead the way.
We should avoid wandering around aimlessly if possible.
I never imagined I'd see a place like this...
Everywhere we go feels totally new...
There's so much to see here! It's completely different from the island.
What a strange forest. And yet...somehow comforting.
Alright! Let's get down to training!
This isn't that far from the island, but the vegetation is completely different. I wonder why...
They say this area looked completely different long ago. Let's hope we can find what we're looking for.
The monsters here seem to be very weak, but I expect they'll still attack us.
This place is pretty much my own backyard.
The monsters here shouldn't be too dangerous, but you never know in a forest. Stay alert.
This forest is so lovely. I feel very content.
This kind of scenery always makes me so hungry! I wish I'd packed a lunch...
I've actually been down this road quite a number of times, but never quite like this...
I wonder how far this road actually goes...
This area should be pretty safe, right?
This road essentially connects the past with the present and future.
Don't stray too far from the road. Monsters love to hide in areas with low visibility.
This is just some ordinary road. How boring...
We should be safe as long as we stay on the road. Everyone stay in formation.
The scenery here is very pleasant.
This place is so pretty! And I never would've seen it if I hadn't decided to leave the island...
So many bugs... Are they attracted to all the different smells here?
I've never seen fall colors like this before...
It looks pretty safe around here.
The air smells so sweet, I'm starting to crave some candy.
The sweet smell here must be coming from the tree sap.
Is something on fire? My vision seems kind of blurry...
This area seems kind of dangerous. It's not a place for normal villagers...
This place feels so fresh. I've only ever seen dark blue vistas up till now...
Wow, it's so white! I had no idea there was a place like this around here.
This place is really hot. I wonder why...
The air is heavy with the smell of sulfur. There must be a lot of volcanic activity in the area.
Don't get so fixated on the path in front of you that you leave yourself open to attack.
Damn! What's with this place? It's so hot!
We've worked hard to make it this far...but I'm not sure I like this place.
This place reminds me of my own hometown...
All these rocks jutting out everywhere look like they might be hot to the touch.
How did this place become so run-down?
This architecture seems to be a remnant of the Klint Kingdom...
Hmm... This place seems like it was once very advanced, but I see no signs of alchemy use.
I sense...some kind of presence here.
Th-This place feels like it might be haunted. G-Good thing you all have me here to protect you!
This place is visible from the village. But I never imagined I'd actually step foot here...
This place is overflowing with an ominous air...
Ooh, everything here is so cool and pleasant to the touch.
The way these crystals glitter is so lovely...
Are these crystals the same kind as we saw in the Fairystone Forest?
If the tides turn, we could end up underwater before we realize it..
The mines here were originally dug to gain access to magical stones.
Places like this are always infested with monsters. Stay alert.
Hey, this is a sacred place! We shouldn't be in here...!
The area up ahead is sacred land. We should leave as soon as our business here is done.
Monsters tend to flock to places like this. We need to be careful...
I hope we can find some rare items!
Hmm, I wonder where that wind is coming from...
*sniff sniff* Hey, I can smell the ocean!
This place kinda reminds me of the island. I expected it to be completely different...
Hmm... I have a feeling we'll find what we're looking for here.
I sense the presence of enemies. If we're lucky they'll leave us alone...
I don't know of anyone who's ever been here before. I won't be responsible for whatever happens...
What would people say if they knew we'd come all this way...
It's hard to explain, but I sense a presence...
This place seems so sturdy, I can't believe how broken down it is.
I wonder what this place used to be...
What happened that would cause this place to fall apart like this?
I've read rumors of an old Klint Kingdom church that used to look like this...
It's in ruins now, but I imagine this place was very beautiful once.
Enemies could show up at any second. Don't let down your guard.
I had no idea this place existed... I wonder if any of the village elders know about it.
What is this place? Are we sure we should be here?
I'm sure there are monsters lurking in here. Watch your back.
Wow, this place is totally overwhelming!
Amazing... I've never seen anything like this before.
Everything here looks like it's left over from some long-forgotten war...
This place is filled with ruins from wall to wall! None of my books ever mentioned a place like this...
Looking at the structures, I believe this path will lead us to some sort of entrance.
We need to watch out for falling rocks here.
I thought I was okay with heights, but this is a bit much...
Who could have built this place? Was it the same as whoever made the ruins in the village?
We have no easy escape route, so let's make sure we don't get surrounded.
The trees look like they grew around the magical stones...
There can't possibly be anyone living here...right?
This place is way bigger than anything we have on the island. Who made this...?
This tower's architecture is nothing like the Klint Kingdom. So who...?
I've spotted a few signs of alchemy use here. I'd like to take some time and do further research...
I sense powerful mana surrounding the area.
This place is really amazing... But are we sure we didn't bite off more than we can chew?
This must be the North Tower I've heard so many rumors about. It's no ordinary tower, that's for sure.
The area is filled with powerful mana. I wonder if it's being channeled somehow...
As an alchemist, it's my job to seek out new and rare materials. But I'm not sure I wanna do it here...
I feel like this place is suffocating me...
Hrmm... This place feels like it's rotting.
I do like seeing new places, but I'd rather not stay here too long...
Common sense doesn't apply to a place like this. We have to be very careful here.
I have no idea what to make of this place...
Who could imagine a place like this could exist...?
What is this place!? It doesn't make any sense at all...
We should finish our business here quickly.
That moon doesn't look right... I don't think we're in our own world anymore.
The color of the sky makes me...uneasy.
Every bone in my body is telling me we shouldn't be here...
Can we leave soon? This place makes me feel sick...
This is exactly the kind of place I've been searching for...
I've never seen a forest of this color. I think we should return...
Wh-What the hell is this place!? We've come too far to turn back now, but still...
I've seen a lot of things in my life, but never anything like this...
Everyone, lend me your strength. We need to save this place...
I've always wanted to go on faraway adventures, but I had no idea this was right under my feet all along!
So the island is man-made? Unbelievable...
I never would have thought there'd be something like this under the island...
This place seems sturdy enough, but I really hope the ceiling doesn't cave in...
This place is remarkable. It must have been built using especially advanced alchemy.
The air feels surprisingly fresh for being underground.
If you'd told me something like this was hiding beneath my own house, I never would have believed you...
So there's a structure beneath the island? This is all just too hard to believe...
I detect a slight scent of water coming from somewhere...
This forest feels so mystical! I wonder what we'll find waiting inside...
It's almost like the sunlight itself is green. What a wonderful forest...
I have to assume there are monsters lurking in this forest...
I sure hope there aren't any monsters in here...
Every forest is a treasure trove of materials. We must search every nook and cranny.
Forests are often filled with dangerous creatures. Keep your wits about you.
A forest, huh? Let's see how it differs from Pixie Forest.
This forest is so thick... I'm not looking forward to find out if there are monsters in here.
What a lovely forest. I wouldn't mind living near a place like this.
This place is so hot and humid. I hope my bottles don't melt...
The ground looks like it's melting... This whole area seems dangerous.
This place is too hot! Can we please get out of here?
Oh jeez, I'd better be careful not to fall off the ledge!
This place is extremely intriguing. Consider my interest piqued.
It's too hot here. I don't like it.
Ugh, did we *have* to come to a place like this?
If we're not careful, this place could destroy us. In a way it's more dangerous than any monster.
This place is not meant for living things. Let's not stay here too long.
Is that the ocean? This place isn't so different from Kurken Island...
That ocean breeze feels so nice! It makes me want to take a swim.
That water looks pretty deep! I'll have to make sure not to fall in and drown...
Anyone wanna go fishing? I wonder what we might catch...
The sandy beaches here are gorgeous. This is the perfect place to take a little break.
I don't like the ocean breeze. It makes my hair feel stiff.
Now this place I could get used to! It has a different vibe from the island.
If only we had a ship... Although sailing off to some unknown land might not be the best idea.
I have no use for the water around here.
Holy cow, I can hardly believe this place is real! I wonder what we might find here...
It's so beautiful... I feel like we're floating through the night sky.
I feel almost...lighter, somehow. Like I'm floating through the air...
This place makes me kinda nervous. Do you mind if I hold on to you?
I had no idea alchemy research had reached such heights...
We don't have secure footing here. We need to move carefully.
I don't look forward to fighting monsters with such unsecure footing...
This place makes me feel like I can fly. I know I can't, of course.
The water is so clear here! It's kind like that other world...but not exactly.
This place is similar to that other world, but the air is much more fresh.
Is this the same as that other world? ...No, looking around I see some differences.
This place... No, it can't be...
Such inviting scenery! So even something like this exists...
I sense monsters hiding in wait. And they feel quite powerful...
So this place is supposed to be connected to some unknown world? You can't be serious.
I have a bad feeling about this place... I hope nothing happens.
This seems to be the same as the world I'm from.
Alright, got it! You can never have too many plants.
I got the plant! ...I have no idea what it actually is, though.
I'm the man to call for all your plant-gathering needs!
Are you sure you want these plants?
Plants are fantastic alchemy ingredients. Be sure you gather plenty.
Most plants are actually edible. Even the poisonous ones can be dealt with in different ways.
Any kind of grass is fine, right? I'll just grab some right here. If you want more, get it yourself.
I don't really understand. You just want a bunch of grass?
Let's make sure we find the best plants possible.
I'll be sure to put this to good use.
Sorry, I'd rather not touch that...
If the material you need is too big, I can use my sword to cut it down to size!
This smells so gross! But if I really have to...
Many materials can be harvested from living things. Of course, they're a bit more difficult to obtain.
Monsters offer many useful materials. Don't forget that.
You use stuff like this for alchemy? Pretty gross, to be honest.
I'm pretty good at picking out the best of these kinds of materials! I'm happy to be useful.
Remember, this used to be a living thing. Make sure it doesn't go to waste.
I'm not sure how useful bugs might be, but for now I guess I'll just take 'em with me!
People are always surprised when they find out I don't actually mind bugs.
I'm so bad at gathering bugs. I always end up crushing them!
G-Get it away! You know how much I hate bugs!
Extracting fluids from poisonous bugs is a fundamental aspect of alchemy.
Bugs are quite nutritious. If you get hungry out in the wild, feel free to chow down.
No, I won't be touching any bugs. I'll leave this one to you.
Nng, bugs are kinda...er, never mind! You just need me to gather them up, right?
Is this what you were looking for?
Do I use it for synthesis, or do I just eat it? Always a tough decision...
Every type of meat has its own distinct flavor and texture. I wonder what kind everyone prefers...
Alright! Meat time! Let's gather some more!
Meat is really important back home. Should we dry some of it to preserve it?
Meat is better for cooking than synthesis. Personally, I'd rather eat this more than anything else.
I'm getting hungry. Why don't we just cook this up and eat it?
We're not gonna eat it as is, right? I mean...surely we're gonna cook it first.
This is the type of meat I cook up whenever I'm traveling by myself.
I don't really eat meat very often...
This'll be perfect to cook for dinner tonight!
Do you really use stuff like this for alchemy? I thought it was just good for cooking.
You can never have too much food on an adventure! I'll gather as much as I can!
There are so many food ingredients I've never seen before...
Vegetables are better for cooking than synthesis. Personally, I'd rather eat this more than anything else.
I'm so hungry. Maybe I can grab for myself to snack on.
This is edible, right? But you use it for alchemy?
We can eat this, right? I'm glad I gathered it!
Mushrooms, mushrooms! Some are poisonous, so I'd better handle them carefully...
I love how cute and round mushrooms are.
I found some mushrooms! Do you need any more?
I think this is poisonous. Or maybe not...? Ahh, it's so confusing!
Many mushrooms are poisonous, but it's difficult to extract the poison. It's a tough material to work with.
Most mushrooms are actually edible. Even the poisonous ones can be dealt with in different ways.
Were you aware that some people have even died from eating poisonous mushrooms?
I don't have many fond memories associated with mushrooms...
Is this the kind of mushroom you were looking for?
I bet this would taste really good in a stew! I should give it a try.
I don't usually get a look at seafood while it's still alive...
Fish eyes really creep me out. I have no idea what they might be thinking...
There sure are lots of different kinds of fish, huh?
Remember, a fish's value in alchemy is only as high as the purity of the water it comes from.
I'm starving. Maybe I should just cook this up right now...
Is this what you wanted? I do prefer fish over meat, personally.
Here's the fish. Ahh, now my hands are gonna smell all fishy...!
It's always nice to know the water is clean enough for fish to live in.
It's so cute and squishy! Let's not focus on how I actually got it...
This thing is so cute! I wanna gather a whole bunch.
So, uh...what is this thing, anyway?
It's kinda sticky. I don't really wanna touch it...
This is necessary for a puni to maintain its squishy body, but nobody really knows what it's composed of.
Apparently some are edible, and some aren't. It's hard to tell the difference, though...
I assume this is what you were looking for?
You can use stuff like this for synthesis? I have no idea how alchemy works...
I better be careful not to spill any...
How much do you need? I can still carry more, no problem.
Water is way heavier than most people realize!
Water is a basic component in alchemy. You can never have too much.
You don't really realize how important water is until you don't have any...
We have plenty of water back home, but it's quite precious in some parts of the world.
We all get thirsty after a long day of adventuring. Maybe we should get a little more.
It's always good to have water on hand.
Good thing I brought a bag! I dunno how I would gather this otherwise.
And...there! I hope I got enough.
I did my best to get the gas in the bag, but honestly I have no idea if I did it right.
The best method to gather gas depends on what type it is. But we don't really have that luxury out here.
I gathered as much as I could, but I'll have to defer to your gassessment of my performance. Heh heh heh.
Make sure to tie the bag securely so none of it leaks out.
Hmph. What's the point of gathering a bunch of gas? This is stupid.
I'm not sure why you need it, but I'll do my best...
I believe this is what you wanted, right?
I better be careful with this to make sure it doesn't catch on fire...
I'm carrying a lot of metal stuff that might cause a spark. Don't blame me if this blows up.
I need to make sure not to make it explode...
Some fuels don't catch fire so easily, but you must always be extremely careful anyway.
Careful, now! I don't want you blaming me if it catches on fire.
This looks really flammable. Be sure to handle it with caution.
This is certainly flammable, so be careful.
This is perfect for building a bomb with.
This makes me kind of nervous... Here, you take it.
My sword is fine for most things, but it's always good to keep a Bomb on hand, just in case.
I think we're the only ones in the village that use gunpowder. That's kind of surprising, actually...
Gunpowder is essential to alchemy. Synthesis can't happen without explosions!
Gunpowder is useful in battle, as well.
I know gunpowder is really strong, but I never really figured out how to use it right.
You have to be really careful with this. It can explode if it gets near an open flame.
What should I make with this? There are so many choices...
Is this good? I'm a master when it comes to hauling lumber!
Visiting different areas means we get access to all different types of trees!
Lumber is extremely useful outside of synthesis. It's much easier to process than metal.
Come on, now you're just having me do manual labor! You've got a lot of nerve...
Now this is some quality lumber. Not to brag, but I've got an eye for stuff like this.
This should be enough, right? I've got a lot of experience gathering lumber.
Thread is really valuable. It's tough to make, so I can make a nice profit if I find a lot.
There's so many different kinds of thread! I always thought you could only make thread from silk.
Ah, crap. I got it all tangled up. I can't just cut it apart, right? Can you help me out here?
Hmm... My eyes aren't so great, so I have trouble spotting small stuff like this.
Thread is great for synthesis, and also has uses in medicine.
You can bundle up the thread to make it easier to manage.
Ahh, this sucks! I hate trying to gather little things like this.
Thread is useful in all kinds of ways. I hope we can find a lot...
Clay has all kinds of uses, it seems.
So clay is just...a kind of dirt?
The clay was kind of hard so I softened it up a bit first. Is that okay?
Parts of my house are made from clay. It's old and damaged, so maybe I can use some of this to fix it.
I'd rather knead bread than clay, but sometimes you just don't have a choice.
Clay is soft, so you should shape it to make it easier to carry. That doesn't change the weight, of course...
I did *not* expect to be digging through the dirt. What? It's not dirt, it's clay? Same difference!
Here's your clay. It has lots of uses, so you can never have too much.
Plants will not grow in this earth...
Lots of different ores look similar, but it's important to learn how to tell them apart.
Metal is made from ore, right? No wonder it's heavier than normal stone.
Ore has a nice weight to it, so it's good as a throwing weapon.
The island doesn't have that much ore. Some, but not enough...
Extracting metal from ore is a quintessential alchemy process.
I don't have much experience with ore...
So you can turn this rock into metal? I should keep my eye out for more...
Apparently all the ore near the village has already been excavated. We should definitely gather more.
Plants don't grow well in areas that have a lot of ore.
Jewels! They're so pretty, I almost feel bad using them for synthesis. But such is the life of an alchemist!
It's so shiny and pretty. They do say jewels are a girl's best friend...
Hey, why don't we sell these and make some quick cash? I'm sure we can find a willing buyer.
I wonder what these jewels are good for... There's so many I lost count!
Jewels are nothing more than colorful rocks. Do not hesitate to use them for synthesis.
Jewels...? I don't find them particularly interesting.
Whoa, a jewel! Let's get more!
I like jewels as much as anyone else, I guess.
I have no interest in jewels...
I found some metal! This is super useful, so I'd better make sure to gather a lot.
Agh, metal is so heavy! Please tell me you don't need any more...
So this is what my sword used to look like?
Metal is super heavy, but I'll gather more if you really need it.
Metal undergoes the greatest changes in alchemy, making it the most interesting. Be sure to experiment!
So this is what you need to make new weapons...
A big part of alchemy is messing around with different metals and stuff, right?
Metal is perfect if you want something strong and sturdy.
Give me a sturdy metal weapon and I'm all set.
I'm getting excited thinking about what kinds of new clothes I can make with this...!
It's not often you see this kind of cloth.
I'm glad we found this. I'm always getting my clothes torn up!
Cloth is so useful! I've been thinking of using some to make a few book covers.
Constant travel tends to wear out your clothes quickly. I can use this to patch up anything that needs it.
Cloth is an important component in most armor.
This cloth looks like crap. You should probably dye it.
I used to wear skirts a lot, but I'm not sure that's really my style anymore.
In my world, we had very little of this thing you call cloth.
So this is part of a dragon... I never imagined I'd get my hands on something like this.
So this is a piece of a dragon... I thought they only existed in fairy tales.
I'd really like the chance to defeat a dragon myself someday...
I could never have brought myself to touch even part of a dragon on my own...
To be honest, I don't have much experience dealing with dragon parts. They are exceedingly rare.
I've never gathered dragon materials before. I *have* eaten dragon, though.
So this is really part of a dragon? If so, I bet we could make a tidy profit.
If I ever faced and defeated a dragon, I'd be famous. But I think I'd rather avoid that conflict...
They say eating dragon can extend your life. Someone should test that theory.
This is good for normal medicine, but I think it's even more useful in synthesis!
I had no idea there were so many different materials that can be used in medicine...
So you can use this to make medicine? I should really familiarize myself with stuff like this...
Here ya go! You might be surprised to learn that I know quite a bit about medicinal herbs!
This is a fine medicinal ingredient, but its value is determined entirely by the alchemist's skill.
They say you can chew on this to gain a bit of its effects.
I dunno how this is supposed to turn into medicine, but if it's what you want, more power to ya.
If you really can turn this into medicine, that'll be a huge help to the villagers.
My world had no medicine. We had no need for it.
I'd better be VERY careful with this...
This is poisonous, right? It makes me kind of nervous, but I guess we need it...
Wait, isn't this poisonous? Ahh, I touched it! Am I gonna die!?
You must be extremely careful when handling any type of poison.
Don't even think about eating that.
Hey, is this poisonous? Agh, I just touched it...!
Poison is really effective against monsters. I don't like using it, though.
Wow, this looks so mystical! I bet I can use it in all different kinds of syntheses!
This looks really magical. It gives me kind of a...strange sensation.
Hmm... I can feel something magical coming out of this.
Something about this feels kind of...divine. Not that I'm sure things of that nature really exist.
Alchemy is a true science, but it tends to rely on mystical items as well. This will be very useful.
This thing is so strange. But even I can see how it would be useful in alchemy.
This thing feels...odd. I don't know how to explain it.
I hope I get a chance to use this in a synthesis soon!
Here ya go. I dunno what it's good for, but just holding it feels amazing. What's this mysterious power...?
I can feel a burst of power flowing through my veins... Is it because I picked this up?
Just holding on to this is making me feel oddly powerful...
The types of syntheses that use this tend to be quite difficult. It's a good chance to hone your skills.
I sense a strong life force within this...
Hey! I feel like this must be pretty rare, right? I'm assuming you want it?
It's obvious how valuable this must be. I can sense the power within it...
This contains some kind of life essence...
I bet I can use this to make a new kind of food!
There are so many different kinds of spices and seasoning...
My family never used many seasonings growing up. We just love that raw, natural flavor.
I'd love to take back some spices to use at home. Oh, but I'm not gonna keep this one!
Seasoning is good for improving flavor, of course, but it's also useful in medicinal syntheses.
Here, you can use this to cook with, right? I don't have much interest in it myself.
Father always said that you could tell how wealthy someone was by how many spices they had.
I like to cook, but I don't usually use spices unless the food is *really* pungent.
I can see how it would be enjoyable to use spices to change the flavor of your food.

You can perform synthesis by going to the cauldron in your atelier. The Material Loop will increase its Element Value as you add more materials to it, which will allow you to create items with a variety of effects.
Item Level indicates the strength of an item. Keep in mind, however, that if a battle item's level is higher than a character's dexterity, they won't be able to equip it.

Items have different effects and traits that affect its overall power.^00^00■Effects:^00These are determined by the original recipe, and are generally active immediately (depending on synthesis method).^00^00■Traits:^00These are transferred from the synthesis materials to the final item. As such, the materials you use will affect the traits the item gains.

Traits attached to synthesis materials can be transferred to the final item. You can transfer up to 3 traits, which allows you to create totally unique items. But before you can activate a trait, you'll have to level up its unique Material Loop.
Add materials to a Material Loop in order to meet its required Element Value, which will level it up. When you level up a Material Loop, you'll gain the effect connected to that level.

Add more materials to a Material Loop in order to unlock connected loops, which will allow you to then add materials to them. These locked loops will become fully available once the original Material Loop gains a high enough Element Value.
You can level up special Material Loop recipes to transform them into completely new item recipes. If you can successfully synthesize this new recipe, you will learn it for good.

A finished item's strength depends on its quality, which is determined by the quality of the materials used. In other words, higher quality materials will lead to higher quality items.^00^00Also, higher quality leads to a higher Element Value, even when using the exact same material. So higher quality items will make it easier to level up Material Loops.

Item Rebuild allows you to add new materials to improve an item you've already synthesized in order to improve its effects or traits. Rebuilding will also let you level up Material Loops you weren't able to when you first synthesized it.
Item Rebuild requires special materials known as Gems, which you can obtain by using Gem Reduction to reduce other materials.

Each time you use Item Rebuild, the item's level will increase. Remember, though, that if the item's level surpasses a character's dexterity, they won't be able to equip it. Also, you can't perform Item Rebuilds that surpass Ryza's Alchemy Level.^00
You can visit different areas to gather the materials you'll need for synthesis. These materials will be added to your basket in the field, then transferred to your container back in the atelier.
Specific spots where you can gather materials are called gathering points. Press <IM00> to gather, or press <IM04> to swing whichever gathering tool you have equipped.

Alchemists can use gathering tools to collect a larger variety of materials. Swing these tools while near gathering points to obtain different types of materials. The specific tool you use can change the materials you obtain, even at the same gathering point.^00<CLGR>Gathering tools can only be changed within your home base.<CLNR>
Use the Staff on grassy areas or fruit-bearing trees to obtain Plant materials, or use it to destroy barrels or boxes.
Use the Scythe to gather Plant materials, or to obtain Lumber from trees. Hitting an enemy with it will <CLGR>reduce their attack<CLNR> at the start of battle.
Use the Axe to obtain Fruit or Lumber materials from trees, or use it on rocks to gain Ore. Hitting an enemy with it will <CLGR>reduce their defense<CLNR> at the start of battle.
Use the Hammer on rocks to obtain Ore, or on vegetation to gain special types of Plant materials. Hitting an enemy with it will <CLGR>slightly damage their Stun Gauge<CLNR> at the start of battle.
Use the Bomb Rod to obtain Ore from especially hard rocks, or to destroy any rocks blocking your path. Hitting an enemy with it will <CLGR>deal direct damage to them<CLNR> at the start of battle.
Use the Bug Net on grassy areas to obtain Bug materials. Hitting an enemy with it will <CLGR>reduce their speed<CLNR> at the start of battle.
Check the map for Fishing Points, then equip the Fishing Pole to go fishing.

Running into an enemy on the field will send you into battle. If you're able to hit them with a gathering tool first, you can gain certain advantages, such as <CLGR>gaining 10 AP at the start of battle<CLNR>.
The Minimap displays info about your surroundings, such as quest locations or special gathering points.
Kurken Island has a number of guideposts set up that act as shortcuts to different locations throughout the area.
Time will pass as you explore a given area, going from morning to day to dusk and finally night. Certain enemies or citizens will only appear at a specific time of day.
There are special wind-powered shoes you can equip which will let you jump over special rocks scattered throughout the world.
There are special wind-powered shoes you can equip that will let you use powerful whirlwinds to leap high into the air.

Inspect these special flowers to replenish your HP and Core Charge. They will also allow you to advance the time of day. But keep in mind that after using a Safety Flower, you won't be able to use it again for a set amount of time.
Running into an enemy on the field will send you into battle. Reduce the enemy's HP to 0 to win the battle--but keep your own HP above 0, or else you'll be returned to your homebase.

Certain skills and items have elements associated with them. If you can exploit an enemy's weakpoint, you'll deal extra damage, but they'll take less damage if you hit them with an element they're strong against. There are both primary and secondary elements.^00^00Primary:^00There are two primary elements--physical and magic. Every ability you use is one of these two.^00^00Secondary:^00There are four secondary elements--fire, ice, lightning, and wind. These are important for exploiting enemy weaknesses, but keep in mind that some enemies may resist them. Anything without a secondary element is referred to as non-elemental.
There are a variety of status effects that can either help or harm a character. These effects will disappear after a certain amount of time.

Regeneration: Heal HP over time.^00Haste: Reduces Wait Time after action.^00Ailment Block: Prevents all negative effects for a set amount of time.^00Ailment Reduction: Reduces the active time of negative effects.^00Damage Reduction: Reduces damage taken for a set amount of time.^00AP Bonus: Doubles AP gained for each action.^00Item Boost: Boosts the power of items.^00Technique Boost: Boosts the power of skills.^00Stun Resist: Halves damage dealt to Stun Gauge.

Sleep: Unable to take any action. Disappears if the character is attacked.^00Poison: Take damage over time.^00Slow: Increases Wait Time after each action.^00Curse: Doubles magic damage taken, and any healed HP becomes damage instead.^00Blind: Reduces accuracy and evasion.^00Seal: Cannot use skills or items.^00Envenom: Take increased damage over time.^00Burn: Take damage over time. Will not disappear on its own.^00Frostbite: Doubles physical damage taken, and reduces speed.^00Paralyze: Increases damage to Stun Gauge. Cannot initiate Orders, and cannot execute multiple hits per attack.^00Thorn: Take additional damage when attacked.

When you deal damage to an enemy, their Stun Gauge will decrease accordingly. If the Stun Gauge reaches 0 they will be stunned. Their next turn will be delayed and they'll take extra damage. If you continue to attack them in this state, you will Break them and delay their next turn even more.

Action Points (AP) are shared among the whole party, and are used to take certain actions. You will gain AP when using items or normal attacks. Using the right gathering tool against an enemy to initiate battle can also grant extra AP.
Your Tactics Level affects the entire party--as this level goes up, normal attacks can hit multiple times (by pressing <IM90>) and certain skills will become stronger.
Skill Level (S-Lv.) increases along with your Tactics Level. As this increases, a skill may become stronger or gain additional effects.
Other party members will sometimes suggest certain actions they'd like you to take--this is called an Action Order. If you follow their suggestion, you can unlock a powerful Order Skill for them.

If an enemy unleashes a special attack or is stunned and you use your Quick Action, this can activate an Extra Order. If you then fulfill the conditions for the Extra Order, you'll unleash an Extra Skill that can deal huge damage to the enemy's Stun Gauge, canceling its special attack.

Certain enemies will begin charging a special attack when their HP gets low enough. Once it's fully charged, this attack will deal massive damage to your team. But you can cancel the attack if you're able to stun the enemy before it finishes charging.
You can consume 10 AP to use a Quick Action, which will let you take your turn immediately, regardless of your Wait Time. But when you do this, you can only use skills or items.

Placing an item in a Core Crystal will allow you to consume Core Charge to use the item, rather than consuming the item itself. A Core Charge can have up to 4 items, and the items you can equip depend on the weapon it's attached to.

If you don't have enough Core Charge, you can Convert items to replenish it. Convert can be triggered in battle and pressing and holding <IM04> when selecting an item.^00You can also go to "Use" in the basket menu. Converted items can't be used again until you return to your base.

Press <IM24> and <IM25> during battle to switch between Aggressive Mode and Negative Mode. In Aggressive Mode, party members will freely take actions that consume AP, while in Negative Mode they will only use normal attacks.

Fatal Drive will become available once your Tactics Level reaches 5, while you are on standby, you can press and hold <IM06> to use your Fatal Drive. Fatal Drive is a powerful skill, but using it will return your T. Lv back to 1. Also, each character can only use their Fatal Drive once per battle.

You can change your difficulty in the Options menu.^00^00EASY: Enemies are weaker and attack less often.^00NORMAL: The default difficulty setting.^00HARD: Enemies are slightly stronger.^00VERY HARD: Enemies are much stronger.^00CHARISMATIC: Enemies are much stronger and have access to even more vicious attacks.^00^00"Very Hard" and above will grant additional experience points.^00* Some difficulties can only be unlocked by clearing the game.

Each character has their own stat distributions that determine their strengths and weaknesses.^00^00LV: Stats increase as level increases.^00HP: Decreases as you receive damage. KO when HP becomes 0.^00ATK: Affects damage dealt to enemies.^00DEF: Affects damage received from enemies.^00SPD: Affects Wait Time and Critical Rates between actions.^00Equip Quality: Increases the multiplier for ATK, DEF, and SPD.^00Dexterity: Determines the highest level of items you can place in your Core Crystal.
Each team member has an assigned role, which will affect their stats. Increasing the Role Level of an equipped item will unlock special buffs within that role.

Attack characters excel at defeating enemies. They receive a huge bonus to ATK, and a boost to related effects such as critical rates.^00^00The more party members you assign to Attack, the faster you'll get through battle.

Defense characters specialize in absorbing enemy attacks. They receive a huge bonus to DEF, and are more likely to be targeted by enemies.^00^00Assigning someone to Defense will let you direct incoming damage to them and keep other team members safe. Having multiple characters on Defense will lead to more drawn-out battles.

Support characters increase AP gained, allowing them to focus on keeping the party safe. They receive a huge bonus to SPD, and are less likely to be targeted by enemies. This role can also reduce AP consumption and further increase AP gain for themselves.^00^00Assigning someone to Support will increase your AP pool, allowing for more skill use and Quick Actions, as well as increasing your Tactics Level more quickly.

New Legend is a specialized role unrelated to the other three, and it focuses mainly on using items. This role greatly increases item effectiveness and AP gain when using Core Items. There are also some stat bonuses, but they are very small.

Braver is the ultimate role--a combination of all the previous ones. They receive huge bonuses to multiple stats, and an increased chance of being targeted (just like Defense). The Braver role also has an exclusive effect in which the attack power of Fatal Drives is heavily increased.
Quests are simply requests made by townsfolk. Some quests only appear after certain conditions are met. If a villager has a quest for you, a quest icon will appear on your map.
Party quests are goals that your allies set for themselves. Completing party quests will unlock a variety of passive skills.
Any quests you've received will appear in the Quest Log from the Main Menu.
Inspect the desk at your homebase to save or load game data.
Inspect the desk at your homebase to change clothes for Ryza or other team members.
Inspect the desk at your homebase to change the game's background music. You can select music for individual areas, or change it all at once.
At the hideout, you can use the cauldron to synthesize, take a nap in your bed, and take a number of other actions. More features will become available as the story progresses.

You can decorate your hideout as much as you like to give it a different feel. You can change the wallpaper, rug, ceiling, terrace, and more. Your friends may also sometimes bring their own personal items to the hideout.

The hideout has a garden where you can plant seeds made with alchemy, which will grow over the course of several days. There are many plant options, and you may even find that something completely unexpected sprouts up!
Inspect the forge to reinforce your weapons by adding materials to the item you want to strengthen. As you improve the forge, you'll be able to add more materials.

The Memory Map is a detailed account of the adventures you've experienced. As you discover new areas across the map, you can write it down here. But keep in mind that once you write your account, it cannot be changed.

Select a destination on the Memory Map to warp to that area's entrance. If you have a treasure map or quest in progress, those will also be displayed here. Press <IM20> to access the World Map outside your hideout.
The Multiplicauldron consumes Gems to replicate items with the exact same effects and traits. However, note that some special materials and items cannot be replicated.

The Gathering Synthesizer allows you to select a bottle and material to create a unique gathering area for you to explore. The worlds created this way can potentially contain special materials or enemies.
A Travel Bottle has only a limited number of uses, and once you've fully explored it, it will run out of energy. However, you can add Gems to explore it again.
Each Travel Bottle comes with a unique password. You can give this password to other players so that they can explore your handmade world.
Gold Coins are extremely rare items scattered throughout the world. You'll find them hidden in treasure chests or, very rarely, dropped by enemies.
You can trade any Gold Coins you find to Lubart in exchange for rare items that you can only get from him.

You can feed the Puni that takes up residence at your hideout, increasing its stats and eventually allowing it to evolve. As you feed it, it may decide to leave. WHen it returns, talk to it to receive a gift!

When you fight Weasel Roast, the damage your dealt or the chain count can be measured. When Weasel Roast does 5 actions or Ryza's party flees, it will end the battle.^00Total damage and chain count will be recorded, and you'll receive rewards based on your performance.

Press <IM28> to switch to Photo Mode. In this mode, you can change the time of day and even add different filters. You can also change characters' poses and move them around however you like. Once you're happy, you can hide the help window and take your photo.

Forging allows you to further improve your already boosted weapons. You can forge a weapon until all its stats reach 999, but the Gem cost will continue to increase as well. When forging, you have a small chance of a "Great Success," which will double the stat gain, or a "Super Success," which will the add the highest value gained from forging, to all stats.

Legendary difficulty not only boosts enemy power, but also reduces the defenses of your allies. This is a permanent debuff, and cannot be removed with items or skills. The higher the enemy's level, the more your defense will be reduced. Legendary difficulty is unlocked after clearing the game once.

When your Battle Level is 50 or more, the skills of your party characters can sometimes be boosted. When your skill is boosted, "+" will be added to the skill name, and the damage it deals or other effects will be boosted. Once boosted, you cannot use the skill in the form prior to being boosted.

A Normal Order may sometimes trigger when your character has low HP. This Normal Order has simpler conditions compared to Action Orders, and if you meet those conditions, it will trigger an Order Skill that will heal the character.
When checking your desk at your homebase, you can change the appearance of weapons Ryza and party use. Changing the appearance will not change the stats of your weapons.

Item Rank is a grade system of the item's quality and traits that evaluates its value as materials for alchemy.^00Ranks go up in the following order E < D < C < B < A < S.^00<CLGR>Depending on the item rank, element value will change.<CLNR>

In battle, you can press <IM11> <IM15> to change the character you are controlling. Change your character to provide an advantage to yourself in battle. However, when you change your character, the suggested Action Orders will be reset.

In battle, you can press <IM08> to change the target of your attacks. The party will aim at the targets that you designate, so try to aim at enemies with low HP or defense to bring the battle to your advantage.
Battle: Confirming Status of Allies and Enemies

In battle, press <IM19> to pause the battle and to check the element of allies/enemies as well as any buffs/debuffs that are applied.^00Press <IM13> to check "Party Info". Press <IM17> for "Monster Info". Toggle each information to see the information you need.

At the Gathering Synthesizer, you can select to "Transfer Materials" to add more materials to your current Travel Bottle. The added materials can increase the Travel Bottle's level <CLGR>up to 200<CLNR>, which maintains the same gatherable materials and monsters while increasing the quality of materials or level of the monsters. The amount of the level that is raised from "Transfer Materials" will be reset if you re-synthesize the Travel Bottle.

Trait Level is a level attribute of certain traits. By combining the same traits in synthesis, you can increase the Trait Level of that trait.^00<CLGR>Trait Level can be increased up to your Alchemy Level<CLNR>, so the higher your level, the more powerful it can be.
Water with no additives or impurities. It can be easily gathered from a variety of water sources, and is good for drinking, cleaning, and farming. It also has a number of uses in alchemy.

Milk collected from a goat. It can be drunk as is, or processed into other dairy products. Goats are plentiful on Kurken Island, so the milk is very common. Visitors, however, tend to complain about its strong odor.
The extract from a collection of plants that have been broken down. Drinking it is good for you, but it's too bitter for most people, so it has to be modified a bit before consumption.

Water gathered from the nearby mines. It contains iron and other heavy materials, so drinking it makes some people sick. Kurken Island is part of the Roteswasser Kingdom, which is famous for its iron deposits.
It may look like normal water at first glance, but as the name suggests, it's filled with tiny little air bubbles. Drinking it is strangely stimulating.
A glittery, green, semi-transparent liquid. Due to its fantastical appearance, people often keep it in clear containers and use it as a decoration.
A strange liquid whose use and method of creation are completely unknown. All anyone knows is that it was originally created beneath Kurken Island long ago, and it's likely very useful in alchemy.

A common weed that grows absolutely everywhere. It has no distinct features, which is why it doesn't have a proper name. At the same time, it's also a staple ingredient in a large number of alchemy recipes.
Grass that's been completely dried out. Due to this, it ignites if it comes anywhere near an open flame. It's often used as kindling, as well as bundled together and used as a fuel source.
This special clover has a fourth leaf, and it's believed that if you find one it will bring you good luck. Usually rare, there are actually some regions that *only* have four-leaf clovers.
A blue-tinged white clover. Within the Roteswasser Kingdom, actual white clovers are actually quite rare, while these blue ones are fairly common. It's believed that this is due mainly to the soil.

A plant that looks quite deadly. It absorbs toxins from its surroundings, so it actually purifies its environment and is considered very beneficial. Still, it looks scary due to all the poison it contains.
A wheat strain that grows throughout Roteswasser. It's resistant to extreme climates and matures quickly, but has trouble growing in the iron-rich soil of certain regions within the kingdom.
A common leaf that looks like an open palm. The tree it comes from excretes a sweet sap, so the leaf itself also has a bit of sweetness to it.
The leaf of a plant that used to grow an especially sweet fruit. However, due to its odd evolution the plant can no longer bear fruit, and instead stores all of its sugar in its leaves.

The leaf of the Delphi Rose. When dried out, it becomes a highly valued spice. It can also be diced or ground and used as an alluring fragrance. It's considered a true luxury to experience the scent of a Delphi Rose.
The branch from a colossal tree that has been growing since before recorded history. Its age gives it a powerful vitality, and it's extremely rare because of the singular tree it comes from.
The fruit of an extremely spiky plant common to most forests. It's technically edible, but is most often used as a thrown weapon. The spikes themselves are also a prized material.
An Uni that shines with a silver glow. Even the shell and spikes have turned silver. It's extremely rare and command a high price. The fruit contained within, however, is completely ordinary.

An Uni that shines with a golden glow. It's easily the rarest type of Uni, and can sometimes fetch a higher price than actual gold. Also, the fruit contained within is much tastier and healthier than a normal Uni.
A red flower found all across Roteswasser. It's an everyday sight on Kurken Island, and does in fact have healing properties. It's a common addition to many medicinal syntheses.
A blue flower found all across Roteswasser. It gets its name from its icy blue color. It contains a mild poison, which luckily doesn't have an effect on most people.
A yellow flower found all across Roteswasser. The flower's stalk really does contain a small amount of sweet honey, which attracts a variety of insects. Children seem to enjoy picking these flowers.
A cute little red flower. It's most commonly found growing next to a much larger flower.
A cute little blue flower. It's most commonly found growing next to a much larger flower.
A cute little yellow flower. It's most commonly found growing next to a much larger flower.
A flower that glows in the dark. Experts believe it absorbs sunlight and emits it later on, but it can also glow in caves and other areas completely devoid of light, and nobody is quite sure why.

A flower that scatters pollen which glows in the dark. The flower itself also resembles a lantern, leading to its name. It can often be found in Pixie Forest, and travelers tend to use it as a landmark.
A plant that emits odd bubbles. Nobody knows how it does this, or why.
A flower with a calming scent. The smell also has a slight pain-relieving effect, and some people like to chew on the petals to help relieve toothaches.
A white flower that usually grows near bodies of water. Travelers in search of fresh water will keep their eyes peeled for this.
An insect-eating plant that grows in the quiet corners of dark forests. It emits a sweet odor to attract bugs, and as it grows larger it may even feed on birds or other small animals.
A unique type of rose. It can be dried and ground to release an especially potent fragrance which is considered very elegant and used in expensive perfumes.

A plant that can grow just about anywhere in the world. It's a basic ingredient in a number of different medicines and other items, giving it its nickname of "magic grass." It's popular among budding alchemists.
A Taun variant. It's not as common, but it's very easy to notice due to its remarkable height. Its medicinal properties seem to be stronger than a regular Taun.

A Taun variant. Its color and shape are completely different. Nobody's sure why it originally mutated, but it's often found growing in small clusters, leading some to believe it's related to the soil.
A Taun variant. It's as if all three other Tauns were combined together. It's perhaps the oddest known Taun, and also has much stronger medicinal properties.
A grass that's always red, no matter the season or maturity. It has many applications as both a medicine and a dye.
An extremely bitter plant. In some parts of the world, they say that the more bitter something is, the better it is for you. Unsurprisingly, this is a prized medicinal ingredient in those areas.
A branch from a sapling with oddly mutated leaves. It's generally boiled and used as a medicinal ingredient, or turned into a powder, depending on the region.
Moss that grows on rocks near most bodies of water. It's ground up or boiled and added to a variety of medicinal treatments.
A soil filled with vital nutrients. It's good for growing all different kinds of plants, so it's popular among farmers to increase their yields.
An animal bone with many medical applications. It's most commonly placed over an open flame and then crushed into a fine powder, at which point it can be taken orally.
The fruit of the kumine plant. It contains a mild poison that may sting your tongue, and can cause stomachaches if consumed in large quantities.
A potentially dangerous juice extracted by squeezing the Kumine Fruit. The poison is more concentrated in this case, so it's much more potent than simply biting into the actual fruit.
The bark from a tree that has long been breathing polluted air. Though highly poisonous, it's safe to the touch. It emits poisonous smoke when burned, however, so make sure you have good ventilation.
A normal looking plant, while still in the ground. But once you pluck it, it will inexplicably begin to scream. The root is incredibly poisonous, and should never be consumed.
The spore of a giant mushroom. It will eject spores like a cloud of smoke when disturbed, or when its time to reproduce has come.
The petal from an insect-eating plant that dwells deep within the darkest forests. It makes its poisonous nature obvious in order to avoid being eaten by hungry woodland animals.
A plant found deep within the most secluded forest areas. Every part of it has some sort of medicinal use.
A powerful medicinal flower said to have the power to bring someone back from death's door. It's used in more advanced synthesis, but its brief blooming period makes it very rare and expensive.
Sand with a reddish hue. Unlike normal sand, it can perfectly retain moisture, so it always feels a little damp. It's not quite as solid as clay, but it can still be shaped to some degree.
Sand with a bracing odor. It will catch fire and burn if placed near an open flame. Some believe that the sand soaked up some unknown combustible liquid centuries or millennia ago.
Sand that can be found at most beaches. It appears to be composed mostly of fossilized coral or shells.
Soil composed of decomposed leaves and other materials. However, these components are mostly poisonous, which is where it gets its name.
A green-tinted soiled that contains lots of minerals. A closer look reveals tiny, glass-like stone fragments. It is most often found in ore-rich areas.
An ordinary type of rock found mostly near rivers. It's extremely fragile and will crumble into sand under any amount of direct pressure.
A mysterious rock that tastes strangely sweet if you lick it. Nobody knows where its sweet taste comes from, nor does anybody know who the first person was to lick it...

A common building material in ancient times. It's become extremely weathered and worn over time, so it's very fragile. It can be processed via alchemy and repurposed as a useful new building material.

A stone used in the construction of pillars in ancient times. There are clues as to the original process used to create it, and since it was originally a building material, it's fairly easy to repurpose it to that end.
Originally a normal piece of coral that fossilized over time. It has properties completely different from a regular stone.
A unique type of coral. Most coral grows in shallow sunlit waters, but this coral grows deep within cave networks, where the sun never shines.
A stone featuring green and orange gradations. It's normally used for decoration, but it's valued among alchemist for its lightning and wind properties.
A stone featuring red and blue gradations. It's a variation on the standard Riverstone, and so is valued for its fire and ice properties.
A stone covered in moss, found near beaches and rivers. It's a common sight the whole world over.
A chunk of rock found mostly in cave formations. It has properties not usually found in normal stone, meaning a skilled alchemist can expect it to have a huge effect.
Stone material extracted from a white-hot meteorite. It constantly gives off a bluish-white glow, lending it a ghostly tinge.
Features an outer shell darkened by the cool air, but an internal core that still burns red-hot. It never loses its heat, so sometimes it spontaneously bursts into flame.
Features high heat conductivity, so it's always cool to the touch. Its crystalline core is the source of its frigid nature, and touching it with your bare hands could damage your skin.
