A seemingly normal ore that hides the power of lightning. It's most often found at high elevations where thunderstorms are common. Some believe the ore was transformed after being struck by lightning.
What most people imagine when you say the word "metal." It's a very common material that everyone is familiar with. It combines readily with other metals, making it easy to work with.
A very common ore. Though inferior to some other metals, it's a core component of stronger alloys, which makes it a popular material that you can never have too much of.
A plain, dark ore. When refined into a pure metal, however, it reveals a bright green hue. The refined version is hard and tough, but also extremely heavy.
An ore with a unique milky color. It can be refined into a metal, but the stone portion can also be polished into a translucent white jewel.
A golden colored ore. Keep in mind, though, that it's not actually gold. It's quite soft in its purest form, but becomes extremely hard when combined with other metals.
A white ore with a bluish tint. It looks like a shooting star streaking through the night sky, giving it its name. It's always hot, so can't be touched with bare hands.
A mineral with patchy black-and-white coloring. It's a hard ore in general, but a strong shock will easily split it along the color borders.
A milky ore that glows from within. Despite its appearance, it's actually one of the hardest known ores-in fact, it's nearly impossible to process using conventional means.
A transparent stone fragment with a crystalline structure. It includes a variety of materials, including rare and expensive jewels.
With so many different materials mixed in, nobody can say for sure what it's made of. If you're lucky, you may find an especially valuable jewel mixed in.
An incredibly rare white sphere found only in giant bivalve shellfish that dwell in relatively shallow waters. It's quite lovely as is, so people usually choose not to process it further.
A stone with a patchy outer pattern. It's believed that this type of rock is formed during a large tectonic movement with extreme heat and pressure.
A small piece of amber. It's not highly valued as a jewel due to its size, which means it can be used without reservation as an alchemy material.
Among a collection of regular amber, you may be lucky enough to uncover a crystallized fragment. It's much harder and more beautiful than normal amber.
A hard marble with a number of metallic properties. At the same time, it reacts well to a variety of chemicals, making it a useful synthesis material.

A crystallized segment of a massive tree branch. Some people believe the crystal material is groundwater that was absorbed by the tree's roots, traveled up to the branch, and then crystallized by the tree itself..
The raw stone starts out black, but begins to shine in a variety of colors when it's processed.
Wood that has been dried and broken into pieces. It burns easily, and can be scattered across an open area to facilitate an explosion.
Black sand that smokes and burns when placed near an open flame. If placed in a container and then heated, it can act as a powerful makeshift explosive.
Created by crushing magma under intense pressure. Even as a powder, it's still magma and may suddenly combust if left unattended.
An everyday piece of paper. It's most commonly found near villages or other places where people are found. Paper is extremely valuable, so even a scrap piece of paper wouldn't be seen as trash.
Tree bark that was sheared from a tree using a very sharp instrument. This section of the tree is fairly dry, so the bark burns well and is often used as a source of fuel.
Bark from a Palma tree. It's more fibrous than normal tree bark, but it's also easier to separate into thin sheets, making it much more flammable.
Oil extracted from plant materials. It can be used to cook with, but due to its distinct smell most people prefer animal-based oils.
Emits white smoke when placed in fire, rather than burning. As such, it's not very useful as a fuel source, but is often used to make smoke signals.
A remarkably black charcoal made by burning Palma wood at a very high temperature. It's good for absorbing even the most powerful of odors.
A simple potato that grows in the wild. They're usually quite small compared to the plump, delicious ones grown on farms.
Meat from wild game. It's tough and stringy, with a strong odor. It requires a significant amount of processing before it's considered edible.
Meat from livestock bred specifically for consumption. It can also be harvested from certain monsters and wild beasts. Travelers often smoke and dry it to carry with them on long journeys.

A type of tomato that grows only on Kurken Island. It's quite juicy, and very sweet when first picked, which is why it's referred to as a fruit. It's also called the Luceaux in other parts of the world.
It's impossible to tell what animal or monster laid this egg. A fertilized egg has never been found, so in all likelihood nobody will ever know...
A rainbow-colored grape native to Kurken Island. While technically edible, it's most often used as a clothing dye.
A fruit with a hard outer husk. The sweet juice within is prized as an ingredient in fancy drinks, but the husk is so tough it can be difficult to extract.
A type of wild berry. In some regions, it's known as the Chiko Fruit. It's naturally tangy, but it becomes much sweeter when crushed and cooked, making it a popular dessert ingredient.
A fruit that's filled mostly with oil. Because of this, it doesn't taste very good, but it's perfect if you need to get your hands on a bunch of oil.
An extremely sweet fruit. Some people consider the juice a gift from heaven, and think that it can help you recover from any sickness.
A beehive filled with sweet honey. The honey's traits change slightly depending on the flower it's made from, and some people travel the world trying out all the different varieties of honey.
A silver-tinted beehive. They tend to contain even more different types of honey than normal hives, and most connoisseurs agree that the honey has much more depth in general.

Apparently, the beehive itself is made of hardened honey. It's extremely rare and highly sought after, and alchemists would much rather use this high quality material in their alchemy than simply eat it.
A mushroom that grows only on Eiche trees. It's not poisonous, and is quite tasty when roasted. It's very popular among both casual travelers and dedicated adventurers.

A poisonous mushroom. Although it may look scary, the poison isn't actually that strong. They say that it will make you drowsy, but also give you nightmares. It's sometimes used as a cure for insomnia.
Mushrooms that grow together in large clusters. They're edible, but some of the mushroom members are more nutritious than others, so these are best for those who value quantity over quality.
A larger than average mushroom found all throughout Pixie Forest. It has an extremely thick stalk and the roots run deep, so you'll need an axe if you want to gather it.
A mushroom with a cap shaped like a crown. It's very rare, and said to have a marvelous scent and flavor. Between this and its shape, some people refer to it as the king of mushrooms.
A seashell that reflects light in a variety of colors. It's popular as a fashion accessory, but it can also be melted or crushed and used in alchemy.
A common fish that can live in both fresh and salt water. These are plentiful in the water surrounding Kurken Island, so it's a staple part of everyone's diet.
A fish with fins that look like wings. It can even leave the water to glide through the air. Of course, it can also swim like a normal fish when it wants to.
A fish covered in spikes. Normally the spikes lay flat against its body, but when it feels threatened it will puff itself up and make the spikes jut out. Some species can be quite poisonous.
A particularly large and delicious fish. It's also quite heavy, so you'll need a strong, durable fishing pole to catch it--or a fishing boat with a thick net.
A shellfish commonly found near beaches or in cave-based tide pools. Roast it over an open flame and dig in for a delicious meal.
A small crab that lives on beaches and other waterside areas. It can grow to a respectable size, and the claws of the bigger ones are sharp and powerful enough to cause harm.
A huge mollusk with massive claws. It can be roasted or even just eaten raw. As an alchemy material, most of its value is in its shell.
A giant fish with a highly developed upper jaw that's lined with sharp spikes. It's a common catch around Kurken Island, but there's no shortage of people who get themselves hurt trying to catch it.
A fish with a head like a giant hammer. It's extremely aggressive and will happily attack humans. It's also not particularly tasty, so fishermen mostly do whatever they can to avoid it.
A fish that hasn't changed or evolved for tens of thousands of years. Its form is extremely different from any other known fish, and there are only a few specimens left in the wild.
The lord of all fish that live in the lake around Kurken Island. Of course, despite its name and reputation, many more than one exist.
The "master" of the Underworld waters. It can actually survive outside of water, although nobody is quite sure how or why it gained this ability.
An insect with a pattern on its back that looks like seven stars. It prefers sunlight, and can often be spotted hanging out on a leaf sunbathing.
An ant that collects honey and stores it in its body. As such, it can often be found near sweet things. It's said that they taste sweet, but most people aren't too eager to find out for themselves.
A firefly with a natural lantern for a tail. It glows bright red and orange at night.
A bee with a pattern shaped like a red rose. It's actually carnivorous, and mainly feeds on other insects. It also has a poison strong enough to allow it to attack and overcome small animals.
A massive insect protected by a hard exoskeleton. Its shell is thick enough to deflect most animal bites.
A bright red insect. It can fly much faster than most other bugs, so you need to be clever if you want to catch it.
An insect that consumes toxins in the soil, making it popular with humans. It's generally a transparent white color when it's born, but gradually turns purple from all the toxins in its system.

An insect whose body looks like a shining jewel. But make no mistake--it's still just a bug. Most people know the story of the merchant who hoarded them to try and get rich, but eventually went bankrupt.
A butterfly with deep blue wings. The blue sections of its body are rigid like glass or gemstones, which makes its flight pattern a little awkward.
An insect that looks like a tiny wyrm. Despite its name, it's actually pretty timid, and tends to flee at the sight of humans.
A completely golden bug that has massive horns. Some people consider it the king of bugs, but it doesn't actually get very big--possibly to make it easier to hide from birds and other predators.
A giant spiderweb. It's surprisingly difficult to break, so it's used in a variety of products. The spider that makes it tends not to stick around very long if it doesn't catch any prey.
A plant vine that doesn't rip very easily. It's also flexible and fire-resistant, so it's used in a large number of products.
A plant that grows puffy white cotton pods. The cotton is harvested and used to make thread and cloth--although it takes a lot to make even a single item.
Ivy that tends to wrap itself around centuries-old trees. It's actually a parasite, and feeds directly off of the tree.

A large tree found in all regions of the world. It's extremely rigid and difficult to process, although it's still easier than metal. As such, it's a fairly common construction material throughout the land.
A durable log that won't break no matter how many people stand on it. It can be cut to shape and used as construction timber.
A dead tree that fell into the water and got covered in moss. There's moss on it from end to end, so it's completely green.
A tree that grows in the warmer southern regions. It tends to have far fewer branches than most other trees, but tends to grow extremely large leaves as well a tough but valuable fruit.
A chunk of wood that fossilized after many years. It's basically as hard as stone.
A honey tree unique to the Maple Delta. Its sweet scent can be detected from a great distance, and of course the tree's sap is quite sweet as well.
A rotten tree that grew in the Underworld. It was once a lush, beautiful tree, but now it looks ominous and foreboding.
A branch that's been broken off of a massive tree. It's incredibly stiff and tough, and very difficult to process.
A plant with leaves that resemble the wings of a bird. It's common to see these leaves flying through the air.
Bubbles extracted from Bubble Grass. They're surprisingly thick, but can still pop if you press against them too hard. You need to gently take them in the palm of your hand while collecting them.
A mushroom that looks like it's already been cooked. The inside is completely empty, so it's surprisingly light.
A toxic gas emitted by rotwood. It has an obvious purple color, and you need to be extremely careful not to breathe it in.
A mysterious blue sphere found within Blue Punis. It's sleek, smooth, and partially transparent.
A mysterious green sphere found within Green Punis. It's sleek, smooth, and partially transparent.
A mysterious red sphere found within Red Punis. It's sleek, smooth, and partially transparent.
A mysterious black sphere found within Black Punis. It's sleek, smooth, and partially transparent.
A mysterious silver sphere found within Silver Punis. It's sleek, smooth, and partially transparent.
A mysterious golden sphere found within Gold Punis. It's sleek, smooth, and partially transparent.
A feather apparently plucked from a giant bird--although nobody knows the creature's exact nature. Regardless, it's glossy and quite beautiful.
The pelt of a wild animal. It's useless as is, but can be easily tanned, trimmed, and added to useful fur-based goods.

An animal pelt from a mythical beast. The fur is softer and thicker than normal animal hides, so it demands a higher price. It still has to be properly tanned and cut if you want to use it in fur-based products.
A bone that came from a gigantic animal--certainly something much larger than a human. It's extremely hard, which makes it a useful synthesis material.
The molted skin of a snake. Some people believe it brings good luck, although most people who have actually tried might not agree.
The fossil of a giant prehistoric beast. It seems to have turned to stone after many, many years.
A stone fragment filled with mana. These can mainly be found in Fairystone Forest on Kurken Island, but nobody knows how they originally came into being.
A jet-black crystal. Despite its appearance, it doesn't have dark powers--although it *is* mystical to an extent.
A crystal that glows bluish-white. People used to think it had holy powers, hence the name. But although it *is* mystical, there's nothing particularly holy about it.
Part of a book written by an ancient mage. The book is about the study of magic, and even this small piece is filled with mana.
A book written by an ancient mage. Even those who have no ability to use magic can feel the mana coursing through it.
A type of crystal that every Philuscha being has somewhere on its body. No one know what the purpose of it is.
A leaf from the crystallized branch of a massive tree. The tree itself really is holy, so this has a certain amount of mystical power.
The bark from a honey tree that grows in the Maple Delta. It has a sweet smell, and it can be dried and ground up to use as a tea additive or food seasoning.
The branch from a honey tree. It's surprisingly sweet, and some people like to use this to stir their tea and add an extra little bit of flavor.
Part of the body of an elemental monster. It looks like a flower petal, hence the name, but it's actually a patch of body hair.
Part of the body of an elemental monster. It's a nearly transparent wing, and it's made up of extremely fine fibers.
A sword that's completely rusted due to years of neglect. It could still be reforged into a new blade, or broken down into raw metal.
The emblem of an ancient knight. It's extremely rusted and worn.
Part of a poisonous monster. In fact, this is the gland that produces the monster's poison.
Part of a poisonous monster. It's the stinger from the monster's tail, and even removed from the body it remains extremely toxic. Make sure you NEVER touch the stinger's tip.
The spine from a monster. It's possible to process it into an edible material, but it takes a long time and advanced technique, so it's seen mostly as a luxury food item.
A monster's fang that's said to be full of mana. It can be processed into an accessory, or used as a medicinal ingredient. The stronger the monster it came from, the more valuable it is.
A monster's outer shell. Shelled beasts are especially tough and resistant to weapons, so you have to aim for the gaps between the shell to deal meaningful damage.
A monster's outer shell. It's much more attractive than a normal shell, and is often used as a decoration. Some people don't even realize it was once part of a monster.
A monster's scales. Each scale is as hard as any shield. It's extremely useful, but it's difficult to find and even more difficult to actually obtain.
A monster's stinger that's covered in spikes. It's normally soft, but can quickly become rigid under the right conditions. Research is still being done to discover more uses for it.
A crystal said to belong to the Great Fire Elemental. It's also known as the Inferno Spirit Stone.
A crystal said to belong to the Great Ice Elemental. It's also known as the Blizzard Spirit Stone.
A crystal said to belong to the Great Lightning Elemental. It's also known as the Bolt Spirit Stone.
A crystal said to belong to the Great Wind Elemental. It's also known as the Storm Spirit Stone.
A crystal said to belong to the Great Dark Elemental. It's also known as the Abyss Spirit Stone.
Meat from a dragon. They say you'll gain eternal life if you eat it, but the fact is that it's tough, flavorless, and all around just not very good.
The wing of a dragon. The membrane is tough but thin, so it's used to make high quality armor. It also contains mana, making it popular with alchemists. Like all dragon parts, it's extremely rare.
The egg of a dragon. It can be obtained from just about any dragon's nest, but it will only hatch under very specific circumstances, so no human will ever be able to hatch one.
The eye of a dragon. They say it can gaze through anything, and since you can only obtain two per dragon, it's considered an incredibly valuable material.
An exceedingly large Puniball. The average Giant Puniball is about as big as an actual Puni.
The claw from a fierce monster. It's even sharper than it looks, and even a minor scratch can cause extreme injury.
A strange object found on most pixie creatures. It possesses elemental power, and reveals mystical properties when used in alchemy.
Part of a golem. Strictly speaking, it's a type of gemstone or jewel, but really it can be considered the golem's heart.
The soul of a knight. Even after transforming into a monster, it continues to wait--this is the soul's final resting place.
A fire said to burn for all eternity. No matter where it is, no matter what you do, it will always burn.
Sand that glitters like gold dust. You might think it contains flecks of gold, but it just reflects light in a special way.
A huge flower that resembles the Sun. Nobody knows where it originally comes from, and it's extremely difficult to grow in captivity.
A mysterious crystal that won't chip or crack no matter what. However, in the hands of a skilled alchemist, it can be melted down and combined with other materials.
Just a bunch of garbage. It contains rotten material that could be harmful to humans.
An item that's no longer of use. It can be taken apart before being used in a new process.
Items that have been burned up. It's mostly just ash, but some bits haven't been completely destroyed.
A bag containing highly combustible Uni powder. It scatters easily to deal damage over a wide area.
A bag filled with tiny ice crystals. It's easy to toss at an enemy, and the explosion will free everything in range.
A collection of spikes. They'll spread out across a wide range when thrown.
A device filled with gunpowder or other explosive materials. After the shock of the initial explosion, it will burn everything within range.
A cube-shaped icy explosive. When it explodes, it will quickly lower the temperature and cause frostbite.
An orb with a powerful magnetic field. Give it a good toss to unleash the power of lightning.
An explosive that can change the flow of air. When it detonates, it gathers all the air around it to create a vortex.
A magical item that can summon countless ice daggers to slash the target to ribbons.
A deadly bell. Hold it up high to call down a thunderous blast and a bolt of lightning.
An item that will fly around the area before shooting toward the enemy and exploding on contact. The bubbles will fragment to damage an even wider area.
Similar to a normal Bomb, but with a graceful red explosion. It has a wider range and an even more lethal blast force.
Similar to an Ice Bomb, but with a wider range. It unleashes frost in a lovely yet deadly blast. It can also be made to focus all its power on a single point.
An orb with a super powerful magnetic field. Throw it at the enemy to unleash a bevy of lightning strikes.
A powerful blast of wind followed by a bright light that slashes through the target. It gives the impression of a shining spirit emerging from nowhere.
Summons flames from the sky to rain down on the target when shattered. Be careful where you throw it, though, because it makes no distinction between enemy and ally.
A hammer that rules over all destruction. When it strikes the ground, it creates an earthquake that shakes the very heavens above.
A tapestry with a geometric pattern that signifies invisibility. When held aloft, it will summon a violent tornado that tears through everything.
A truly mysterious lamp. When the fire is extinguished, the entire area will grow dark, and moonlight will appear to purify everything.
A perfectly square block said to be the source of all power. When you use it, you'll experience a deep rumbling followed by a violent lava blast.
A book said to contain all the wisdom of the ancient sages. Each time you turn a page, the energy contained within radiates out in waves.
A common medicine that can be created using plants gathered around Kurken Island. It's definitely effective--but not *that* effective.
A traditional flour-based food. It can last a long time, so it's a good travel snack. But since it's designed with longevity in mind, it's quite dry and rather flavorless.
A topical treatment good for cuts and scrapes.
A gooey jelly. It was inspired on how soft and squishy Punis are, and has a delicious, refreshing taste.
A tasty dessert made from Rasen-specific ingredients. It hasn't been widely advertised, so it's mainly popular among Rasen district residents.
A powder made from a fragrant tree. It's described as containing a living forest wind, and it has useful healing properties.
An ointment that heals and beautifies. It's not quite clear which use it was originally designed for.
A miracle medicine that revives the unconscious or comatose with a single sip. There is no known way to create it other than through alchemy.
A decorative ball containing lots of different medicinal properties. Crack it open to spread its effects across everyone in the area.
A revitalizing syrup that can heal you instantly. The effect will also linger for a while after drinking it.
A fruit-filled dessert. The delicate flavors dance on your tongue, as well as heal your fatigue and replenish your health. Basically, it just makes you feel good.
A cup filled with holy water. Sprinkle it on someone to instantly bless them with massive healing.
A powerful medicine said to heal all illness and injuries, and even revive the dead. It's one of alchemy's greatest creations, and only a handful of alchemists are skilled enough to make it.
Refined oil extracted from fish. It smells quite fishy compared to regular oil, but it helps refresh your mind when you ingest it.

A powder with a stimulating odor. When applied to your skin, it makes you feel hot all over, leading to enhanced aggression in battle. Don't use too much, though, unless you've got some kind of death wish.
A liquid that contains thorns. If the liquid touches you, the thorns will bind you and keep you from moving. It may also have poisonous properties, depending on how it's produced.
A harmonica that can play music according to your mood. It provides various enhancements to whoever hears it.
A remedy that can treat all sorts of illnesses. You should try and have this handy at all times.
Unleashes a shocking blast and poisonous vapor when thrown.
A thin cloth with a mystical pattern. Spread it over yourself to protect against all kinds of attacks.
Creates a deal with the devil. You will gain supernatural powers, but your body will begin to deteriorate. It's part medicine, part poison.
A stone containing powerful mana. It unleashes a heroic power that engulfs the area and deals continuous damage to the enemy. Many believe that the stone contains the actual soul of a hero.
Observes the movement of the stars and converts that into energy. This will allow you to move faster than your enemy--in a way, you gain control of time.
A tool that can help you gather plants. It's small and light, so you can easily wield it with one hand.
A tool mainly used to split firewood and chop down trees for lumber.
A tool that can crush rocks and other hard objects. The metal section is composed of a strong alloy made with alchemy.
A long stick with a red orb mounted to the tip. Swing it to shoot fire from the orb, which can burn anything around you.
Your very own fishing rod. Now you don't have to borrow one from your parents. Still, there's nothing that special about it.
A tool designed to catch insects. It has an extra long handle to catch flying insects or particularly skittish bugs. It was also made to be lightweight to keep it from being too unwieldy.
A tool that lets you check your current position. The higher quality you can make it, the more information you'll have access to.
Shoes so light they're said to contain the very spirit of the wind. In fact, they're so light that they actually make you move faster than normal.
A knapsack made from lightweight material to make it easy to carry. It can hold much more than you would think, so you can gather lots of materials in a single trip.
A tool that lets you see more environmental details. This helps you see which materials are good or bad, so you can select only the best materials available.
An extremely sharp axe. This combination item has the heft and balance of an axe, but the razor's edge of a scythe.
A hammer with the additional power of a Bomb Rod. You can smash stuff just like a normal hammer, and follow up with a fiery explosion.
A tool that features the combined utility of a fishing rod and a bug net. You're free to use each one separately as necessary.
A combination of compass and a mirage loupe. The design is compact and functional, and each item can be used on its own.
Wind Spirit Shoes combined with a knapsack. This is a highly specialized tool that's great for exploring any area.
A common alchemic compound. Any beginner should be able to make this, but as they say--it takes a moment to learn, but a lifetime to master. The red liquid gives it a fire affinity.
A common alchemic compound. Any beginner should be able to make this, but as they say--it takes a moment to learn, but a lifetime to master. The blue liquid gives it an ice affinity.
A common alchemic compound. Any beginner should be able to make this, but as they say--it takes a moment to learn, but a lifetime to master. The yellow liquid gives it a lightning affinity.
A common alchemic compound. Any beginner should be able to make this, but as they say--it takes a moment to learn, but a lifetime to master. The green liquid gives it a wind affinity.
A fine powder used to polish metals and other hard materials. The powder itself is both hard and fine, leading to a mirror-smooth finish.
Paper made using alchemy. There are a number of slightly different methods for creation, but in general it's very durable and difficult to tear.
Fish food. It's a soft, wet mush that sticks easily to a fishhook. It doesn't smell too great, but some people actually enjoy the taste of it.
Paint made using alchemy. It can be mixed with other colors or diluted with water, just like regular paint, but it's much more durable and will last a long time.
A powder containing the concentrated fragrance of the Delphi Rose.
A dense bar of metal. It's created by melting down natural ore, then collecting the metal portions and letting it harden. This forms the basis of many metallic items, weapons, and armor.
Slightly softer than a normal ingot, making it easier to work with. It's most often used for metallic items that don't need to be as hard.
An ingot with a bluish tint. It's extremely hard and difficult to work with. You'll need a furnace that can reach extremely high temperatures, so most blacksmiths aren't able to use it.
A black and white ingot with a dull sheen. The balance of colors affects the weight, and the colors will naturally separate when it's refined.
An extravagant gold-colored ingot. It's about the same weight as gold, but it's extremely hard, making it good for weapons and armor.
Cloth made from a variety of thread types. It's used to make clothing, and can be incorporated into certain types of armor.
Cloth made from natural, mostly plant-based, materials. It's softer and lighter than normal cloth, but it's also less durable, so it's typically woven into thicker layers.
Cloth made mostly from monster materials. Despite the similar odor, it's not actually leather, so it's lighter but also not as durable.
A more upscale cloth featuring an attractive color and classy scent. It can also store mana, so it's often used to make clothing for mages.

A very upscale cloth that uses the rarest of materials. Even though it's just cloth, it's woven with great care and has incredible durability. It's a common component of formal clothing for people of noble birth.
A pearl that's been polished with great care. It was valuable before, but after such attention it's treated as a rare jewel and commands an even higher price.
An amber crystal whose impurities have been removed. It's been polished to bring out its innate beauty, and now it's highly prized as a lovely jewel.
An amazingly clear jewel. None of the original materials are purple, but when it goes through the synthesis process, it comes out a pale violet color. Nobody's quite sure why this happens.
An incredibly pure Holy Arbor Crystal. Any crystal lacking bubbles or cracks are cut into a specific shape and then polished. The resulting jewel is considered extremely rare and valuable.
A prismatic gemstone cut at certain angles to accentuate its beauty. It's then further polished until it shines so bright it seems like there might be an actual rainbow inside.
A sweet liquid found in most beehives. It's used in many foods, especially desserts, or you can just eat it as is. It's surprisingly healthy, but it shouldn't be given to infants.
Sugar extracted from the Nectar Rock. It comes out looking like a sugar cube, but it's extremely fragile--press even slightly too hard, and it will immediately crumble.
Water encased in a transparent membrane. It's surprisingly durable, and you can just poke a small hole in it whenever you need some water. The water itself is distilled, so it will never go bad.

Water that has been purified to the extreme. Since it has essentially no impurities whatsoever, it's the best water to use in synthesis. In fact, it's so pure that it's not actually good for drinking.
Ground up medicinal herbs. Light it on fire to release a calming smoke.
Blessed holy water. It doesn't look any different from normal water, but adding it to a medicinal material will enhance its positive effects.
A block of concentrated poison. It's very volatile, so unless you want to be covered in poison, you need to keep it in a sealed container.
Said to be demonic water tainted by the devil himself. It's poisonous enough on its own, but you can also add it to another poison material to enhance the overall effect.

It may look like sand, but it's charged with the power of lightning. A careless touch will leave you paralyzed. A light breeze is enough to whip it up, so you need to be extra careful when handling it.
Stone material with alternating streaks of color. Its elegant coloring makes it a prized building material, and it can be polished to further increase its luster.
The perfect mixture of materials for flammability and explosiveness. It's much more volatile than most materials, so you need to take extra caution to avoid flattening your atelier.
An ember that burns blue for all eternity. The sparks that it shoots off can combust and explode, so be sure to store it away from other fiery objects.
A solid fuel mixed with several kinds of oil. It won't actually explode even when exposed to direct flame, so it's relatively safe. Instead, it burns slowly, and can even be relaxing to look at.
A material that's stable at room temperature, but suddenly begins releasing heat when exposed to flame. It doesn't actually catch fire, however, so it will merely turn red and begin to melt.
The powdered form of Wasser Wheat. It's used in just about every form of cooking, but is especially common in the baking of desserts.
A powder used in many desserts. When mixed with other ingredients, it turns to jiggly gelatin.
Fibers synthesized from a combination of animal and plant materials. Since it's a mix of many things, it doesn't look too pretty, but it's about as durable as you could ask for.

Pure white thread reminiscent of an angel's feather. It takes a truly skilled alchemist to imbue it with such elaborate detail. The thread itself is very fine and used to make pure white robes fit for an angel.
Lumber that's been infused with iron to increase its strength. It's more durable than regular wood, but loses the advantage of being lightweight.
Lumber made from a holy tree. It's light and flexible, yet very strong. It's perhaps the best lumber you could ask for and has all kinds of uses, but it's incredibly difficult to obtain.
A liquid that turns into a gas at room temperature. Make sure you have good ventilation, because breathing it in can have ill effects on your body.
A transparent crystal that seems to contain swirling wind and feathers. Nobody's sure if the feathers are dancing in the wind, or if the feathers themselves are the source of the breeze.

Animal leather that's been tanned using Puniballs. It loses some of its color during the process, so now it's somewhat translucent. It's less durable than other leathers, but it's more flexible than any other.

An especially tough leather made by combining the skins of different animals and monsters. It's both stronger and lighter than many metals, so it's a common component of lots of expensive leather armor.
A transparent flower made using alchemy. It has no use on its own, but its strong ice affinity makes it a useful synthesis medium. Some people simply keep it around for decoration.
A small bottle containing elemental power. It has an affinity with all elements, which is useful but also makes it difficult to work with. It's incredibly difficult to synthesize one with high power.
An advanced material created from the four Elemental Cores. Since it has high affinity with all elements, it's extremely useful in alchemy.
The ultimate goal for any alchemist. As they continue their research, they all dream of stumbling on some way to create this--which would then let them create anything their heart desires.
Some sort of seed. There's no way to know what will grow until you put it in the ground. Put it in your garden and it'll grow into some kind of plant-related material!
Some sort of seed. There's no way to know what will grow until you put it in the ground. Put it in your garden and it'll grow into some kind of stone-related material!
Some sort of seed. There's no way to know what will grow until you put it in the ground. Put it in your garden and it'll grow into some kind of fire-related material!
Some sort of seed. There's no way to know what will grow until you put it in the ground. Put it in your garden and it'll grow into some kind of water-related material!
Some sort of seed. There's no way to know what will grow until you put it in the ground. Put it in your garden and it'll grow into some kind of mystical material!
Ryza's trusty staff. As the name implies, she made the staff herself, and the craftsmanship is quite solid.
A staff that can charge up mana by holding it up to the Sun. Particularly lazy owners like to use it as a clothesline to dry their laundry and charge it at the same time.
A staff that uses a glittering crystal. Each one is completely unique, and contains a powerful mana source.
A staff once used by mages from a faraway nation. It's inscribed with unfamiliar runes, but someone well versed in magic might be able to decipher them and unleash powerful spells.
A staff composed of materials made solely using alchemy. The rare materials make it difficult to synthesize, but its immense power makes it more than worth the trouble.
The flute Klaudia bought to practice in secret. Since it's meant for beginners, it's not too expensive.
A flute with a stylish design. It has an unconventional color scheme, but you still play it just like any other flute.
A gleaming white flute often used in royal parades. It was designed assuming the player would be wearing smooth gloves, so the keys are coated with an anti-slip material.
A flute popular among orchestral first chairs. It's extremely difficult to play, so it's used to display your mastery of the instrument. Naturally, the sound is quite heavenly.

A truly top-class flute. There are only a few in existence, and its production method and materials are a complete mystery. Many craftsmen have tried to recreate it, but all have failed time and time again.

An old, worn greatsword. It once belonged to Samuel, but he abandoned it long ago. Lent retrieved it and has done his best to maintain it, but it's covered in scratches and has clearly seen a lot of use.
A greatsword that's broader than most other swords. It's more difficult to swing, but its width allows it to double as a shield.
A sword preferred by soldiers on the frontline. It's designed to be lightweight to make it easier to quickly charge the enemy.
A magical sword enchanted with a spell that can deepen inflicted wounds. Of course, this can be used against the owner if they're not careful, so it's not a particularly popular weapon.
A sword modeled after the ones wielded by the ancient kingdom's Royal Guard. The warriors of the time used a shield as well, so it's designed to be wielded with one hand.
A simple hammer. Ryza told Tao he needed a weapon, and this is what he came up with. It's a farming tool he brought from home, and it's light enough for him to use without too much trouble.
A hammer said to boost spiritual power by holding it. However, they say it also attracts the souls of the dead to the user at the same time...
A weapon used by mercenaries for demolition jobs. It's also strong enough to destroy most armor, so soldiers tend to flee when they see it come out.
A hammer said to belong to a mythical god of thunder. Hold it aloft to summon rain and thunder.
A hammer wielded by only the wisest and bravest. They say the weapon chooses its owner, and few throughout history have proven themselves worthy.
A one-handed walking stick. It's light enough to avoid being a burden, but can still be used as a weapon in a pinch.
A staff once wielded by a sage who defended the forest. It features a bell used to guide lost children out of the forest, as well as to warn poachers of their impending doom.

A staff popular with anyone in training. They say that if you toss it in the air, when it lands it will point you toward the path you must take. But remember--the right path isn't always the easy path.
A staff made from a gigantic holy tree. It's charged with mana, which will keep it from ever snapping. It's also totally immune to fire.
A staff said to bestow great wisdom upon its owner. However, they say that it has a mind of its own, and will take over the consciousness of anyone it deems inferior to itself.
A gauntlet with claws attached to it. It's been with Lila for a long time, but despite years of use it's still sharp and sturdy due to her faithful maintenance.
Claws once used by many ancient warriors. It prevents the wielder from using a shield, but makes up for it with incredibly destructive power.
A gauntlet with monster fangs where the claws would normally be. Getting hit with this feels like you're being crushed by powerful jaws.
Claws that they say can cut through the very wind itself. They're quite heavy, however, and need remarkable strength to wield.
A traditional weapon used by the Oren. Equipping it will grant its owner with all the power of the elements.
A long-sleeved outfit commonly worn all across Kurken Island. It wicks away sweat to keep you cool and dry even in summer, but it's not really fit for use in battle.
An outfit popular with the wealthy and aristocratic. As such, few people on Kurken Island can be seen wearing it.

Leather armor that covers most vital areas. Made from pretty much any kind of leather, it doesn't restrict movement too much. However, it still has many exposed areas, so it doesn't provide the best defense.
A vest you wear beneath your normal clothes. It resembles cloth, but it's actually chainmail, so it's both stronger and heavier than it looks.
Polished stones connected together like scales and shaped into armor. It's relatively cheap, and yet surprisingly effective.
Bulky armor made from metal alloy. It's easier to make than it looks--apprentice blacksmiths produce them in bulk as part of their training. As a result, there's pretty much always a surplus.
A coat common among scholars. It's made from materials that make it easy to wash off any chemicals that might get on it, so it's very popular with alchemists as well.
Armor made with mana-infused ice that won't melt at room temperature and can keep you cool. But keep in mind, it's still vulnerable to extreme heat.

A coat once owned by a famous detective in the capital. It has the odd ability to give you epiphanies to help you solve difficult mysteries. But it also has a tendency of getting you involved in unwanted situations.
An outfit made from materials obtained from pixies and spirits. It's extremely light, and seems to provide some amount of healing.
Armor constructed using copious amounts of gold and jewels. The right arm is lacking in decoration, because the person who commissioned it ran out of money.
An evening dress imbued with mana. Witches tend to wear it wherever they go, and use it as a catalyst in place of a wand. It's mentioned in a large number of fairy tales.
Armor once worn by a brave knight who once fought off a hundred enemies at once. It's made from a large variety of materials, and is amazingly strong.
A cloak that embodies the idea that knowledge is power. It doesn't provide much defense, but makes up for it with other benefits, including providing the user with previously unknown wisdom.
Magical armor that moves using mana-infused cores. The materials are quite heavy, but due to the mana technology most people would have no trouble wearing it.
A common pendant. Wearing it seems to provide extra energy, so it's highly recommended for adventurers that often find themselves injured or fatigued.
A ring popular among adventurers. Its specific effects change according to how it's made. Seasoned alchemists are capable of crafting highly advanced versions.
A pair of multicolored earrings. Each one contains a bit of fire and ice magic, reducing damage taken from each element.
A pair of multicolored earrings. Each one contains a bit of wind and lightning magic, reducing damage taken from each element.
A brooch with the power to exorcise. Its purpose isn't obvious from its design, but it does look nice as a normal accessory. Some people even wear it just because they like how it looks.
A necklace designed to last longer while using less metal. It's the perfect gift to give the object of your affection.
A bangle that motivates its owner for no apparent reason. It makes you want to shout out the name of your special attack whenever you use it.
Extremely light magical shoes that make you feel like you can fly. But please, PLEASE remember that they don't actually make you fly. So don't go around jumping off cliffs.
A charm intended to ensure safe travels. Wearing it helps keep your legs from getting tired or going numb, so it's perfect for long trips.
A chain with multiple jewels attached to it. Its effects will change based on the jewel and color choices, and there are a number of common combinations.
A crown once worn by someone very high up. Wearing it will make anyone look more important. It fits snug, so it won't fall off even if you do a cartwheel.
A ring exclusively for use by alchemists. It takes two Philosopher's Stones to craft. It just looks like a normal ring to most, and only an alchemist can recognize its true value.
Fresh meat from a goat. Kurken Island has a large number of goats, but they're mostly used for milk. It's unusual to use them for their meat, so it's not often you see this for sale on the island.
A plant that grows near the seashore. It's just about the only plant that can grow there, and since it soaks up so much seawater, it tastes extremely salty.
A Fairystone of much higher quality than the ones found in Fairystone Forest. It's charged with vast energy, and is warm to the touch.
A construction material needed to build the secret hideout. It's mostly just wooden planks, so it's not especially useful for alchemy.
A construction material needed to build the secret hideout. Some of the stone has been further processed to make it easier to stack.
Dirt with Salt Grass mixed into it. It's used as a sort of plaster to build reasonably durable walls.
A soft, rubbery, water-resistant material. It can be combined with other materials to make it quickly harden.
A pungent aroma that attracts monsters. Of course, it's not as effective on creatures with a poor sense of smell.
Fish bait that can attract any type of sea life. It doesn't taste very good, but apparently fish can't resist the smell.
A jewel needed to build Empel's prosthetic arm. A weak electrical current is constantly running through the center of it.
A device designed to let your arm function without having to use any of your own strength. It utilizes the power of lightning to function.
An extremely durable mechanical component that can withstand great pressure and force. It's a replica of an alchemic invention from the past, but it should function as intended without issue.
A mysterious key found hidden within Pynnor Tower. It looks old and worn, and has probably been lying there for ages.
After adding new materials to the Old Pynnor Key, it looks brand-new and ready to use again.
A transparent red stone created wholly through imagination. It contains a one-of-a-kind energy.
A piece of the Ravaging Queen. Even without touching it, it's obvious there's a vast reverse of energy lurking within.
A rebuilt version of the Queen's Treasure. It has a richer color than the Red Stone, and a much greater amount of energy.
One of many mysterious and powerful ancient artifacts. If you insert items made with alchemy into this, it will bring out the item's full power. Nobody knows how it was created.
A reinforced version of the Core Crystal. It can house even more powerful items, and further improve their output.
A Core Crystal reinforced to its maximum level. It can house yet more powerful items, and even further improve their output.
An ancient artifact that can create a miniature forest world. Nobody knows how it was created.
An ancient artifact that can create a miniature volcanic world. Nobody knows how it was created.
An ancient artifact that can create a miniature oceanic world. Nobody knows how it was created.
An ancient artifact that can create a miniature world full of ancient ruins. Nobody knows how it was created.
An ancient artifact that can create a miniature dark world. Nobody knows how it was created.
Not fit for human consumption. The oil extracted from this fruit can be used to coat lumber and give it an attractive luster. It doesn't rot easily, so it can be freely traded as is.
A type of wood that's rough around the edges. Despite its appearance, it's light yet tough and very easy to process, making it the perfect construction material. It's extremely rare on Kurken Island.

Sap collected from the fabled Akashia tree. It's rather sticky, but quickly hardens when exposed to air, which gives it a very attractive sheen. It can be applied as a coating to a large variety of objects.
An extremely hydrophobic oil, which makes it popular as a waterproofing agent.
Woodchips that call to mind tropical trees. Decorate your abode with these to give it a laidback beachy feel.
Normal looking lumber. It's not very exciting, but it acts as a fantastic insulator. Use this in your home to give it a rustic feel.
A truly appealing pigment. Add this to your bare walls to make them feel truly upscale.
A water-resistant oil. Coat your stone materials with this to create a water-tight and expensively looking floor layout. Place this in your residence to make it feel like an ancient kingdom.
An ancient artifact. Attach this to your forge to increase its power, allowing you to create even more advanced equipment. Nobody knows how it was originally created.
A piece of paper with a goat hoof stamped right in the middle of it. Technically speaking, this is an extremely rare item.
Part of a stone tablet with a strange design that may or may not show the location of buried treasure. Collect all the pieces, and maybe you'll be able to track it down!
Fresh milk obtained from Bascila's goats. It's very flavorful, but the pungent odor drives most people away.

A scale that fell from the dragon of light. It's much tougher than a normal dragon scale, making it a valuable additive in a number of metals. It's also extremely beautiful and is often displayed on its own as a kind of jewel.
The shining eye of the dragon of light. It possesses mystical powers that can be transferred to weapons and armor, and some adventurers think it even allows its owner to see into the future.
A jelly-like liquid made from Puniballs. It breaks down quickly so it's not fit for long-term use, but it's often used to fill in cracks as a form of makeshift waterproofing.

An original concoction invented by Ryza. It's created by combining regular polish with Gel Liquid, and can remove even the most stubborn stains and rust. Whatever you use it to polish will maintain its shine for a surprisingly long time.

A polish composed of extremely fine particles. This leads to an exceedingly lovely luster for whatever you're polishing, so it's often used on glass surfaces and bejeweled accessories, which benefit the most from an alluring sheen.
A small Bomb that Empel prefers. It's smaller than Ryza's version, but the explosion is focused in a specific direction, allowing for a powerful blast with minimal collateral damage.
The result of adding a Red Stone to a Bomb. Its power is truly incomparable, and misuse can easily lead to insurmountable destruction.
Empel's Red Stone creation based on the one that Ryza previously synthesized. It's composed of different materials from Ryza's version, but its power is no less potent.
An heirloom version of the Kurken Fruit. It's much larger than the one found on Kurken Island, but its skin is thicker and the flavor is relatively bland, making it a poor fit for human consumption.
A Bomb created by Ryza to gain entry to the cave on Moritz Island. Unlike a typical Bomb, which is simply thrown directly, this version is designed for controlled remote detonation.
A berry as pale as a moonlit night. It's technically edible, but is extremely sour. It grows in clusters, and can only be found in certain parts of the world.
A special berry said to grow only in moonlight. During the day the entire plant shrivels up, including the flowers, so it can be extremely difficult to uncover.

Flour-based dough used as a base for a variety of desserts. It uses a good amount of sugar, so it's sweet even when eaten raw. Of course, raw dough might give you a tummy ache, so it's not recommended.

Flour-based dough used as a base for a variety of desserts. It uses a good amount of sugar, so it's sweet even when eaten raw. Of course, raw dough might give you a tummy ache, so it's not recommended.

Flour-based dough used as a base for a variety of desserts. It uses a good amount of sugar, so it's sweet even when eaten raw. Of course, raw dough might give you a tummy ache, so it's not recommended.
A sweet liquid made from reduced tree sap. It's not actually honey, but shares honey's surprisingly high sugar content. It's too sweet to use in most everyday cooking.
A base ingredient for making special donuts. Just mold it into your favorite donut shape and you're good to go. It's much sweeter than normal dough.
A fluffy, sweet white cream. It's popular as a topping on all different kinds of desserts.
Whipped cream combined with Moon Berry juice. The juice gives it an alluring blue tint.
Whipped cream combined with Moonlight Berry juice. The juice gives it a delicate pink tint.
An ordinary donut, with no frosting or toppings of any kind. It tastes...fine, but that's about it. A very forgettable, unremarkable donut.
An ordinary donut, with no frosting or toppings of any kind. It tastes...fine, but that's about it. A very forgettable, unremarkable donut.
An ordinary donut, with no frosting or toppings of any kind. It tastes...fine, but that's about it. A very forgettable, unremarkable donut.
A donut said to originate in the capital, Ashra-am Baird. Despite its unappetizing color, it's extremely sweet and has long been one of Empel's favorite sweet treats.
A bit of material thought to have come from the Klint Kingdom era. It's shown some use as an alchemy material, but its original use and production method are completely unknown.

A crystal originally belonging to the Great Light Elemental. Its composition and properties are notably different from other elemental stones, and it has a dispelling effect when used to reinforce weapons.

Water found on the secret island. Elementals have a profound effect on it, and just drinking it will provide a number of benefits. It's colorless in natural light, but under the right conditions it can shine in a variety of colors.

A cracked globe. It contains the power of the earth itself, and can alter the shape of the land or make rocks rain from the sky. If you're not careful, it can even alter the geography of an entire region.

A special pill that can convert the user's health into a different kind of power. This allows you to restore the energy of ancient artifacts and replenish Core Charges at the cost of your own vitality.
The Blue Puni can be found just about anywhere. It's smooth and cool to the touch, but no matter how cute you think it is, it's still a monster and it WILL attack you.
The Green Puni is found mainly in forests and grassy plains. It loves to sunbathe and sparkles more as it gets more sunlight.
The Red Puni is rare, but most often found in hot regions. Due to its high body temperature, seasoned travelers will often bring one along on trips to cold regions.
The Black Puni is highly elusive, and even the most experienced adventurers would consider themselves lucky to ever spot one. It prefers to lurk in damp, dark locales.
This Puni shines so bright it can illuminate its immediate surroundings. It travels in large groups, and can live in whatever area it likes. The brighter it shines, the stronger it is.
This Puni is of the highest class, and where you find one you're likely to find more. It's much heavier than it looks.
This Puni prioritizes a highly nutritious diet. It's quite bold in everything it does, making it a natural leader among all Punis.
This Puni doesn't literally shine--rather, for some reason other Punis come to trust it easily, so it "shines" in a metaphorical sense. Still, it is just as powerful as its name suggests.
A typical monster found in plains and forests. They live and travel in family-based packs, and are actually born from eggs.
A mutated version of the Giant Weasel. It's extremely agile and will try to disorient you with its speed. But it has almost no stamina, so it's easy to take down if you simply wait it out.
A white-furred weasel. Its pelt was so prized that it was hunted nearly to extinction. They're naturally ferocious, and now they're even more hostile and wary of humans.
Hunts at night, as its name implies. Its skin pattern is very noticeable, however, so it's easy to spot. It's also not very good at recognizing when it's been seen.
A Giant Weasel that's evolved due to its unique environment. They're most often found in areas with little food, making them especially vicious and ravenous.
A Giant Weasel that's fallen into the abyss. They make use of their dark powers to satisfy their hunger.
The mother of all weasels. However, this mutated version is much bigger than a common Weasel Mother.
A Giant Weasel that somehow grew to be even larger. They say an evil pixie used mana to corrupt them. Unable to control their newfound power, they fell even further into darkness.
A pixie born from a flower exposed to plenty of sunlight. It uses its laurel-like crown to sense its surrounding, and chases away anyone who comes too close to its flower.
A pixie born from a flower that grew in the moonlight. The antennae on its head can quickly detect any nearby danger.
A pixie that grew to adulthood entirely within its flower. It watches over all the flowers in its territory, and will unleash violent magic on anyone who dares to get too close.
An immortal pixie. It has watched over everything in its territory for as long as it can remember, and will stand against anyone dumb enough to challenge it.
A pixie imbued with the power of fire, which eventually burns up the flower it's born in. It directs its rage toward itself, causing it to go berserk.
An awakened being born from sunlight pouring through a tower window. Despite its holy nature, it hates all living things.
A pixie born from a Safety Flower, which has the power to ward off monsters. Even after the flower withers, the pixie continues to protect its lands.
A pixie that wanders the world, even though its flower is long gone. It absorbs mana from other pixies to grow in size, and creates a mirage of its former flower in order to protect it.
Once the messenger of the Moon, it has since turned its back on its duties in favor of battling anyone who steps foot in its territory.
A living collection of magical rocks. It has been polished by a raging river, exposing its glowing inner stones. It's extremely aggressive and will attack anyone who gets too close.
A collection of ice blocks animated with mana. It uses its sharpened ice to attack, but is extremely vulnerable to fire.
Living gems that have been shaped and polished into valuable jewels. It's obsessed with aesthetics, and travels the land in search of even more lovely jewels.
Forged from a powerful lava flow. Its unending source of power from its insatiable desire to consume anything that moves.
Born from an ore that fell from the sky. Said to contain infinite power, its rocky body is harder than any known substance--perfect for destroying all living things.
A clump of soil that can move on its own. It was given orders to stand as a line of defense, and does so to this day. It uses earth-covered rocks as a weapon.
A giant beast amplified with powerful jewels. What seems like an aggressive attack may simply be its attempt to show off its gorgeous decorations.
A sculpture created by an unknown artisan. Every day it questions its own existence.
A soldier made from rocks brought to life with magic. With its creator long gone, it repeats the same defensive routine it was given on the day it was born.
A suit of armor discarded long ago. Belonging to no one, it covers its head with a mysterious hood and wanders the land in search of a new master.
A suit of armor discarded long ago. It wanders the night seeking a new master, and anyone who dons it will find themselves forever drawn into battle.
A suit of armor discarded long ago. It has been drenched in blood countless times, and now moves via the power of hatred. It grips tight its distorted sense of honor and lost pride.
A suit of armor discarded long ago. Brought to life by an ancient curse and lacking a body that rotted away long ago, it now seeks nothing but glory through battle.
Once belonged to a famous warrior. The warrior's name has been lost to history, and now only the armor lumbers on, aimless.
A warrior that craves battle even in death. It's seeking someone who can finally put it to rest.
A massive ceremonial suit of armor, made alive with the power of magic. It has no innate sense of martial skill, but still contains a raw power.
A suit of armor worn by a high-ranking knight while he was still alive. One day, the knight went missing and his armor later appeared as a deadly monster.
The guardian of ancient treasures. The armor and sword contain unlimited mana, which it uses to crush anyone who tries to take its treasure.
A fearsome beast similar to a scorpion. It's made up of materials not found anywhere else in the region. It can close huge distances in a flash, and strikes with its lethal tail and pincers.
A mutated beast that inhabits even harsher environments than the Stinger. Its pincers are even bigger, and it's even more aggressive.
A deadly creature that has evolved to move quickly underground. Even the flesh between its thick shell is extremely hard, making it difficult to take down with either edged or blunt weapons.
An exceptionally intelligent beast that can lead other monsters into battle. It uses its tail to communicate its commands.
A mutated monster similar to a rat. Its razor-sharp fangs are highly lethal, and it has highly developed night vision.
A mutated monster similar to a rat. It's evolved a hardened spine used for both defense and hunting prey. It's vicious by nature and will attack at the first opportunity.
A mutated monster that's filled with rage. It pierces its prey with its sharpened horns before tearing it to shreds with the rough scales on its back.
A mutated monster that moves in packs. It's surprisingly gentle usually, but becomes immediately aggressive if it feels like its pack is under attack.
A mutated monster with a hardened fin on its back. It can curl up and then spin at high speed to quickly dig underground, where it can either escape or continue the fight.
A mutated monster said to feast on shadows. Its body is designed specifically to hunt prey, and the only vulnerable part of its body is its soft, sensitive ears.
It may look small, but it's a fully grown creature. It typically moves in flocks and attacks as one. Its feet are tipped with sharp claws that can tear through anything.
A wyvern that lives in open-air areas. It has an innate ability to read the winds, and its horns help it detect lightning.
A specimen that's evolved tough scales on its back. The red sections of its claws give off a terrible scent, which it uses to mark its target so that others know what to attack.
A highly aggressive beast with an incredibly sharp beak. It can dive at supersonic speeds to surprise its prey.
A creature with a split personality. Normally quite gentle, it becomes aggressive when protecting its nest. Because its eggs take so long to hatch, most of its life is filled with aggression.
Very intelligent despite its size. It can lead larger wyverns into battle, and is quite adept at coming up with effective strategies and battle tactics.
A wyvern that's mutated to become remarkably massive. It's no smarter than a normal wyvern, but its attacks are much more powerful and deadly. Its size has led to a solitary life.
A truly gigantic specimen unique among all wyverns. It's extremely vindictive and will pursue its victim to the death. So be very careful that you not let it discover you...
A wyvern with a highly developed sense of smell. It's also extremely intelligent, which allows it to perceive its surroundings and the flow of battle.
It's similar to a fish, but nobody's quite sure what it actually is. It digs into the ground to build a home, and it reveals its head and fin before emerging to attack its prey.
A shark normally found in the sea, but which can cover itself in sand to come aground without dehydrating. Its powerful jaws can punch holes through boulders, where it makes its nest.
A monster that lives and dies entirely underground. Pay attention to the ground beneath your feet when you're in its habitat.
A sly and ferocious monster. Once it locates its prey, it will quickly spit lava at it.
A giant Underworld creature that commands a legion of beasts. Its back features a jewel charged with mana, which is the source of its strength.
An Underworld beetle featuring two large horns. The size of its jewel signifies its standing in the swarm, so a quick look can tell you just how strong it is.
A being that commands other Underworld monsters from the shadows. It has heightened battle awareness but little aggression, so it rarely fights on its own.
A monster particularly feared in the Underworld. It always travels alone, and preserves its strength for when it's time to fight.
The dragon found at the old castle. It can summon tornados and spit fireballs. Also known as the Roaring Demon, it's feared by anyone who's heard its name.
A massive dragon protected by divine providence. Somehow it came to possess power to rival a god, and become the ruler of its lands.
An elemental being that presides over the wind that flows throughout the world. Any who would claim its power will be tested. It's rather gentle compared to other Elementals.
The one who appears before those recognized by the other Elementals. It presides over the darkness that balances the light of the world. It's rather crass compared to other Elementals.
An elemental being that presides over the fire that burns throughout the world. Any who would claim its power will be tested. It's rather rough compared to other Elementals.
An elemental being that presides over the ice that crackles throughout the world. Any who would claim its power will be tested. It's rather distant compared to other Elementals.
An elemental being that presides over the lightning that strikes throughout the world. Any who would claim its power will be tested. It's rather energetic compared to other Elementals.
Queen of all the Philuscha. She exists to devour all that she sees. She's extremely intelligent and uses her scythe-like arms to destroy her enemies with electrical blasts.
A cursed soldier from a lost kingdom. It now exists as a disembodied soul, representing the purest form of hatred.
The true form of the Ravaging Queen, revealed when she feels cornered. When cornered, she attacks with reckless abandon to destroy any threat standing before her.
Acknowledging its own ruin, the embodiment of hatred discards its shell. It will forcibly consume anything that tries to harm it.

A massive winged dragon that made its home at the old castle. It appeared without warning, so most believe it must have simply wandered into the area. Its entire body glows with a radiant light, so it's easy to spot even in faraway villages.

An elemental being that presides over the light that flows throughout the world. Along with its dark counterpart, it stands head and shoulders above the other elementals. Also, this element draws a clear line between personal life and work. During off time it is quite lazy.

A monster that the great elements fearfully referred to as the “Calamity” and sealed away. It resembles the Queen of Philuscha, but whether it has any connection to alchemy from the Klint Kingdom era is unknown. It has the power to bring despair and destruction to all.
Calamity's true form after taking off the outer shell. Its existence brings natural disaster and those who stand before it will be defeated in an instant by its amazing power and speed.
