There's no time to take detours right now.
A Road Meant to Be Safe
First Sight in a Red World

This island is where I was born and raised. We just have the one village here, so most outsiders think of it as the boonies, but we've got everything we need here. That is, except for fresh water. That's one thing we're always struggling with...
Fressher's general store and Dr. Edward's clinic are the busiest places in town (even though the clinic is a little...outdated). Lent's house is around here somewhere, too.
This is the village's main port. The Boden district has some pretty unique shops, but it's most popular for the fish, caught fresh daily.
Right now, Klaudia and her dad are living in Old Town. The house is just a rental, but it's really big. Old Town is full of places like that...
This is our hometown. To be honest, there isn't really anything special about it. Nothing ever changes--it's so boring! Still...I have to admit, I'm pretty fond of it.

The Boden district has all kinds of back alleys--it's like a giant maze. We used to play there when we were younger--and I still live in the area. You might run into my dad though, so don't go there unless you have to. And even then...
Kurken Port has the biggest market on the entire island. They sell everything you can think of there--whether we need it or not. Lots of big ships stay anchored in the harbor, too.
Old Town has always been full of these huge houses. Lila and Empel are actually renting a place here.

Other than the ancient Klint Kingdom ruins scattered around town, there isn't much to this little farming village. We do grow lots of stuff, but our specialty is the tasty Kurken Fruit. We also raise a little livestock--we've got lots of goats running around.

The Boden district has a town square where people like to meet. There's also a shopping arcade that's always filled with people. But since it's so popular, sometimes we run into people we'd rather not see--people like Bos...
Kurken Port has a ferry that goes back and forth from the mainland, which is the main way to get to the island. All the other ships around here are just normal fishing boats.
This area is known as Old Town. It used to be the center of the village, but a lot of things happened and now it's been kind of forgotten.
I've never been to a farming village before, so I was surprised to learn how early people here wake up. I'm not really a morning person, but I'll do my best to follow suit.

Walking around the Boden district, people seem to love striking up conversations. The population is pretty small, so I guess everyone knows each other. They're even really nice to me, even though I'm not from here!
We can reach Ryza's hideout from a little-used port, but there are all kinds of huge ships here that I've never been on before.
My father is renting a house for us in Old Town. We have plenty of extra space, so I hope everyone comes to visit!

I've never encountered this kind of island life before. The village isn't very big, but I still can't believe it's remained so well hidden from the rest of the world. It's almost as if it was designed to be like this on purpose...
The village seems to be designed around the central fountain--all the water channels connect to it. But the fountain itself has dried up--or perhaps it's always just been for decoration.
There isn't much trade between the island and the mainland, which makes me wonder why it has such a huge port. It must be the village's main source of food.
The house we're renting is just one of many large abodes on this part of the island. But why are so many of them empty?
<S30>The island is very peaceful and pleasant.
<S30>This is where Lent's home is located.

Despite the name, this forest is actually full of Punis! Although there *are* some pixies here too--and they're way stronger than Punis, so we need to be careful. The atmosphere here is totally different from the island, and it makes me feel like we're actually on a real adventure.
I think this must be the biggest tree in the forest. I wonder how old it is... It's kinda like it's the "master" of Pixie Forest. It feels almost...divine.
I found a stump with a bunch of mushrooms on it! I bet I can gather all kinds of rare stuff here. Let's go and get it!

This is the first place we came after we left the island. There's lots of monsters here, but they're mostly pretty weak, so it's the perfect place to train. Although there *are* a few stronger ones around here, so we can't afford to ever let our guard down.

Head deeper into the forest and you'll never run out of training partners! But go too deep and you'll run into some real deadly opponents. So we can't let Tao go off on his own! Not ever! I should probably also come up with a system to keep from getting lost. Maybe I can start by marking this tree right here...
Check out this huge stump! Which means someone came out here and cut down a huge tree for some reason... Someday I'll be strong enough to chop down a tree like this in a single strike!

This is the part of the mainland closest to the island. But it's still a really dangerous place filled with monsters! It's great that we can gather materials here, but one wrong move and it's all over... This is no place for our first adventure!

All these giant trees means there's lots of blind spots--there could be deadly pixies hiding behind any of them, waiting to strike! Or a Puni that spits acid that can melt through iron! Or maybe the tree itself is actually a giant monster!
I wonder how big the tree that was here was. And why did someone cut it down? But there are so many monsters around here, I can't let my curiosity get the best of me...
The villagers call this Pixie Forest, and I can certainly feel how magical it is. The deadly monsters they call pixies certainly look cute, but it's probably best not to get too close...
I found this gigantic tree deep in the forest. I've never seen anything like it. But when I looked up at it...an Uni fell down on me! I need to be more careful.
There's a strange stump deep within the forest, and mushrooms so big you can stand on them! The stump itself feels almost like a natural stage. It's all so unusual...

This forest isn't especially big, but it's quite fertile. It does contain some monsters, but they generally pose little threat, and it also contains many useful materials. Overall, I'd describe it as quite a pleasant place.

This species of tree is no different from the others in the forest, and yet it's grown to such a size... There must be some sort of unknown power at work here. I'm not sure if the power is located within the tree itself, but I look forward to researching it further.

I can't help but wonder what the tree that once stood here looked like. I believe it was the type that would flower rarely, but I've never seen it for myself. It seems to be home to a number of parasitic plants.
<S30>This place is filled with weak enemies. Even Lent can handle it.
The Traveler's Road stretches as far as the eye can see! This is where our adventure began. I have no idea where the road leads, but there's nothing more exciting than an unknown path!
There are huts along the road here and there, but I don't think anyone lives in them. I wonder why... I want to make good time, but it never hurts to take a little break.
My goal is to climb the tower way in the distance! This road might just lead there, in which case it's the first step to achieving my dream! And I'll crush any monster that stands in my way!

People might have lived here way in the past, but now we just use it as a place to rest. It's got shade, and a cool wind that blows down from the mountains, so it's the perfect place to take a nap. There are still monsters lurking around, though, so we have to keep an eye on Tao!

This road is the only direct route to the island. They say it's relatively safe..."relatively" being the key word. I'm sure there's still lots of dangerous monsters lurking around. I'd really rather avoid this area if we can help it...

This is an old, abandoned area that people use to rest now. People used to live here, but they probably moved away once monsters started showing up. Even without the monsters, the walking alone is exhausting, so I'm glad we have somewhere to take a break.

This is a nice, open spot with a good view of the entire area--I really like it. I came through here once before, in a carriage on our way to Kurken Island. Of course, I was headed in the opposite direction then.
There are lots of huts all along this road that are completely abandoned. I guess it's tough to live somewhere you could be attacked by monsters at any moment...

This is more of a path, but there are remnants of a road underneath it. So the road has been here for a good long time. Which does nothing to explain why nobody seems to know much about Kurken Island...

There are many places to rest along the road. I feel bad for using these places without the original owners' permission, but as a consummate traveler, I'm forever grateful. As long as there's a roof over my head, I can't ask for much else.
<S30>The beasts here are still too weak.

This bright red forest is connected to the Traveler's Road. I wonder why all the trees turn red here all of a sudden... Maybe the soil's different? Oh, but there's lots of dangerous monsters around here, so we have to be careful!

There's a completely pure waterfall here! If I could bring this back to the village somehow, I could throw my weight around just like a certain someone. But there are super strong monsters all over the place, so I guess that's not an option.

This is the true beauty of nature! I love how there's not a manmade thing to be seen here. Empel said there's no clear explanation for all the red trees--all I know is I never would have seen something like this if I hadn't decided to leave the island.

This forest just gets deeper and deeper. And the farther we go, the redder the trees get! What's waiting for us when we reach the end? Normally, a deep dark forest is kind of creepy, but with this one...who knows?

The entire forest is red--I assume they've been growing this way forever and ever. I've never seen anything like it... But there are also lots of scary monsters hiding around here. They're hard to see, so we have to be careful and not get ambushed!

There are gold-colored rocks jutting out all over the place deeper within the forest. Whether it's actual gold or just something that happens to look like it, I have no idea. I'd love to do some more research on it...
I've seen the leaves of mountainside maple trees turn red before, but never have I seen completely red trees like this. They're so beautiful...

There were outcroppings of jewels with a golden shimmer, and lots of other lovely crystals in the same area. Just looking at them filled me with happiness... The Fairystones on Kurken Island shine in a similar way, but I'm not sure if they're related.

The leaves of some trees turn red as the temperature drops, but these trees seem to remain completely red regardless of the season. I've never seen an entire forest of red like this before. I have to imagine we can gather some useful alchemy materials here.

As we moved further into the forest, the scenery completely changed. We saw gemstone outcroppings, rocks shimmering with a golden hue, and a brightly shining spring. Naturally it was a sight to behold, but I'm more interested in finding out what alchemy materials we might be able to extract.
<S20>This is a perfect spot to train. I should bring Lent here later.
<S20>I don't think we should drink the water.
I was mostly joking when I mentioned a hot spring, but we actually found one! This really is a proper hot spring, right!?
Vivid flames of different colors shoot up into the night sky here. It's really beautiful, but it's also just as dangerous...
I never expected to find a hot spring here. But it doesn't seem like a good place to take a dip. Of course, if you insist I won't stop you...
Seeing those flames shoot up into the sky really fires me up, you know? You feel the same way, right?
This is a naturally occurring hot spring, but I think it's a bit too hot to go swimming in...
The volcano here is much different from the ones I've read about back home. Especially the way the flames appear here and there.
I wonder if we can go swimming in the hot spring...
I know this place is dangerous, but I can't help but marvel at its beauty...
The water is filled with calcium, which causes it to harden and shape the land as we see it. I think we could find some extremely rare materials here.

The crater has a very unusual shape. The bedrock is brittle, so flames shoot up at regular intervals. Since it's constantly having these tiny eruptions, I doubt there will be a major eruption anytime soon.
There are lots of rocks here I've never seen before, but I bet I can use them for alchemy somehow. I should probably gather as many as I can.
I can see flames shooting up through the tower! Has it been on fire all this time...?
These rocks don't look like they belong here. Did they make their way here from somewhere else somehow? Maybe the two sides were throwing them at each other during the war...
That tall bit looks like a tower, but maybe it's just a lookout post. Either way, it looks like it's on fire.
This place might be a castle, but there's lots of monsters here, so it's still plenty dangerous. I hope everyone will be extra careful...
What's with that chimney in the center of the castle? Wait...is it just on fire? What the heck?
There's so many rocks I've never seen before. Why are there so many inside the castle? I can't imagine people just carried them in here...
The tower in the center of the castle is burning. Is it some kind of signal or something? But the castle is abandoned, right?
It seems that these rocks fell from the sky. That would explain the castle's name. It would also explain the castle's battered state.

This tower is a kind of summoning device. When the right conditions are fulfilled, it can summon a creature from another dimension. If the fire is still burning, it means the device may still be active.
This was meant to be a defense against the Philuscha. We should leave as soon as we can.
Someone must have dug this mine a long time ago. It's such a big, dark maze, it feels like we're on a real adventure! There definitely isn't anything like this back on the island.
Looking around here, it's easy to forget we're in a mine. It's so nice and warm here, it's almost like we're in some kind of secret playground.

Lots of people used to work in the mine, but now it's just a home for monsters. It's dark and there's lots of places to hide, so it's like a monster's dream come true. We could run into one at any moment, so we need to take good care of Tao.

There are still trees growing here, and stuff that looks like some kind of fruit. It's not too terrible, considering where we are. Of course, we can't forget about all the monsters. We need to stay on guard...

This must be where all our Fairystones came from originally. If they were mining on such a huge scale, I'm sure it must be all dried up by now. The whole mine is even bigger, but a bunch of seawater came pouring in and flooded a huge section of it.
There are trees in the mine! And even a little bit of light seeping in. But I wonder how a seed made its way down here to start growing in the first place...

I know this place was dug by human hands, but it's still so dark and creepy... And there are ruins down here in addition to the tunnels. Does that mean people used to live down here? I've lived in all kinds of places, but I think this would be too much for me...

After trudging through all those dark, narrow mine tunnels, I can finally breathe a sigh of relief here. There's lots of trees, and even a little bit of light. The whole area is surprisingly wonderful.

The mine itself appears to be fairly ordinary, but there are also some ancient ruins unrelated to the excavation of Fairystones. So perhaps it *isn't* an ordinary mine? This warrants further research.

At first glance, it's quite strange to see a tree growing in the middle of a cave. But all any plant really needs to grow is light, soil, and a bit of water. And this area satisfies all of those conditions.
<S30>This is a good place to test Lent's strength.
These ruins are right next to the lake. They were obviously built a long time ago, so they're pretty dilapidated now. Still, the original design is really elaborate.
This gate connects our world to the Underworld. But how the heck was anyone able to build it here...?

Right here! I wanna build another hideout in this exact spot! Heck, it's practically a hideout already! It's pretty far from the island, and it's totally hidden. But there are also monsters everywhere, so maybe it's not the best idea...
This is where we wound up after trying to track down Bos. It's not that far from the island, but I doubt anyone back home has any clue it exists.

Up ahead is the Underworld, which we basically know nothing about. I can't even imagine what danger is waiting for us there... And once we go through the gate, there's no guarantee we can ever make it back. It would take real courage to actually walk through it.
This is the perfect place to do some proper exploration! Nobody else knows about it, which I think is cool. If only there were no monsters, it would be the perfect vacation spot...

These ruins aren't all that far from the island, if you could go in a straight line. There's also a hidden peninsula you can't see from the island. Based on the architecture, this must be another relic of the Klint Kingdom.
This gateway looks really dangerous! My old self would absolutely refuse to go through it. But I think that side of me has decided to take a little break for now...

The most important thing here is the gateway leading to the Underworld. But there are also lots of buildings that have nothing to do with the gate. I wonder if people use to come here just to hang out and chat...

Looking around this area that opened up before us so suddenly, I noticed a building standing quietly next to the lake. I'm not sure if it's actually a temple, but that's what it reminds me of. I think it'd be nice to play my flute here...
I know it's a gate to the Underworld, but I feel like I'm walking into the mouth of a demon. I can never tell Father I came here.
If it weren't for all the monsters around here, I wouldn't mind relaxing here a little while. Maybe go for a swim... Ahh, it feels like such a waste!

It may seem like a simple royal garden to the untrained eye, but to me it's just another type of gateway. Not that I expected to find it here of all places... Considering how much effort they obviously put into hiding it from the outside world, I guess I shouldn't be surprised.
I would describe this as the root of all evil for this region of the world. Lila and I have been traveling near and far to seal these gates, and this one is no exception.
I'm sure the people moving resources through the gate used this area to rest and relax. That's the only explanation for why it's laid out like this.
<S20>The Philuscha are a huge threat. We need to hurry and destroy them.
<S30>This place is filled with strong enemies.
It looks like a giant stone sword has been stuck in here. If it was a real sword, imagine how big the person who could swing it would have to be...
The tower we've been working toward is right up these stairs... There are all kinds of monsters, and the path just keeps getting more narrow and more dangerous!
This whole place is so treacherous. There are signs of battle everywhere. Just what the heck happened here...?
That looks like a giant sword, but made of stone instead of metal. If you got hit with it, you wouldn't stand a chance. Who the heck could have made something like this?
Past these stairs is the tower that's been my lifelong goal. I'm ready to see what it's like with my own two eyes...
I used to look at my goal far off in the distance. From Kurken Island, it was nothing but a tiny speck. But now that I'm here, I see how huge it really is.
There are bones and weapon scraps scattered everywhere. I don't like it... The sword is probably just for decoration--I can't imagine someone actually using it as a weapon.
The stairs are so steep it feels like we're climbing up into heaven. We've come so far already, but now the tower is within our grasp...I hope.
It's clear that this was once a battlefield. It's really chilling and ominous, but it's the only way to reach the tower.
A really terrible battle must have taken place here. But what's with that sword? Some kind of decoration...?
The entire ravine was gently sloping up, and now we have to climb all these stairs. I bet the view from the top is going to be really amazing...
The tower used to be so far away, but now it's right before our very eyes. I'd better not look down...
This sword was likely wielded by a stone giant. It's anyone's guess where such a giant ended up, but this is a clear reminder that it once fought here.
The key to reveal the truth lies beyond here, and it's our duty to uncover it with our own eyes.
Clearly, a fierce battle took place here. Judging by the equipment I see scattered around, there was an attempt at a defensive line, but it seems the humans were overrun...

When I saw the tower from Kurken Island, this is the spot that always glowed the brightest. And this giant crystal is what I saw... It's obviously made of Fairystone, but I have no idea what it might have been used for.

There's something strange spinning around in the air. My gut tells me this whole place has something to do with alchemy, but I can't even begin to guess what kind of research they might have been doing here.
Back on the island, on a clear day you could go to a high-up place like Treppe Hill, look to the north, and see the tower...
I guess my goal was a little different from what I always thought. I'm not sure if I'll be happier knowing the truth, but I still think finding out is the right thing to do.
I have no idea what this is. Maybe I should ask Ryza and Empel about it. Of course, I'm not sure I'd understand no matter how much they tried to explain...

It's always been my dream to climb this tower--the Holy Tower of Pynnor. It's bigger than I ever could have imagined, but now that I've reached the top and learned the truth...I'm done with this place.
There are clear traces of a battle that took place here. And there are even some documents scattered around. The whole place must have been in a state of panic...
What is this thing? Floating in the air like this, it's clearly not normal. Could it be related to alchemy...?
There's a giant tree wrapped around the tower, like a choking vine. And it's covered in beautiful crystals. The tree or the tower--I wonder which one was here first...
The highest point of the tower has a huge jewel in it. I have a feeling there used to be a lot more up here, but now there's nothing else left.
There's some mysterious object floating high up in the air. Maybe that's what kept it from being destroyed in whatever battle took place here...
I've seen towers built in the middle of cities before, but never one in a place like this. I think I'd rather not learn too much about it...

There's a giant Fairystone affixed to the top of the tower. Placing it so high and utilizing its unique properties was their attempt to use it against the Philuscha. In short...it was likely used as a summoning device.

Tracking the movement of the stars is an important aspect of alchemy--I believe this floating globe was a device used to research that. I wonder if it's still functional, now that the master of this place is gone.
At first, I thought this was a bizarre structure in a bizarre location, but now I see this tower was specially built to combat the Philuscha. Towers are easy to defend and difficult to take over.
There are lots of homes here, but no people. It must have had an active, bustling place at one point, though.
I'm not sure how to explain it, but I can sense a kind of...mana pressure in this area. It's like some sort of mysterious force. I wonder what exactly it is...
The scenery here makes me really uneasy. I hope we can find a way to lift the darkness covering it someday. How might I be able to help with that...?
So this is where Lila comes from. If my home turned out like this, I'd probably go crazy.
Are these all Fairystones? Fairystone Forest was kinda like this, but this is on a whole other level. It's all kind of overwhelming...
I know I'm always talking about going on journeys to test my strength, but I'd never want to come here alone. Er, not because I think I'm weak! I just...don't feel like it.
How can I put this? When I look around at everything here, it makes me realize just how simple and peaceful our life back home is.
The people of the Klint Kingdom invaded this place just so they could exploit its resources...?
This place ended up this way thanks to everything the Klint Kingdom did. I guess that's just how the world is. But I wonder if the Sun here was always black like this...
The scenery here makes me feel so sad... I just wish there was something I could do about it.
People long ago came here seeking those shining jewels. Were they really so attracted to them? I dunno, I just don't feel the same kind of pull that they must have.
The Sun here is like our own, but jet black. To be honest, I don't like looking at it. I feel like it's sucking me in...
No matter how many times I come here, seeing the world like this makes me sick. Especially knowing exactly what happened to make it this way...

Alchemists long ago invaded all different parts of this world to take control of its resources. Certainly those resources were rare in our own world, but that doesn't give us the right to take them from others...
This is the most sinful of all places. Not just because of the Philuscha, but because this is also where our ancient ancestors came. It's not a place to be visited on a whim.
This is my homeland--no matter how long I've been gone, it's where I was born and raised.
This place used to be full of life. But now that time has come to an end...
This isn't a good place. All kinds of curses have come to rest here. It's best if we don't linger too long...

We made a secret hideout of our own, but I never imagined there was an even bigger hideout hiding right beneath us all! And if we'd never gone out looking for adventure, we never would have found this place.
It hasn't been all that long since I started learning alchemy, but even I can tell this place isn't normal. I'm finally starting to understand just how deep alchemy really is...

The more I look at it, the more impressive this place is. Who could have guessed such a huge place was hiding so close to us? And how'd they build it in the first place? The atelier we made is basically nothing by comparison.
I can't even begin to guess what all this stuff is for. I wonder if Ryza or Empel have any idea...

I had no clue something so incredible was hiding right beneath the ground of Kurken Island! This is like a thousand times more exciting than when I discovered all those books at home! I need to explore every inch of this place!
This is the heart of Kurken Island. I don't know anything about alchemy, but if that's how this island was created, I guess we all owe our survival to the power of alchemy.
There's nobody here now, but I wonder if this place was filled with people when it was first built... This whole thing is so much more amazing than anything I ever saw in the city.
This place is so huge! I've never seen anything like it. I've traveled so much, and created so many memories, but I think this is always going to stand apart in my mind.

This place was built using all the combined knowledge of alchemy. I've traveled far and seen countless alchemic relics, but this is a first even for me. I simply have no idea how they might have built this.
Hmm... I'd love to hole myself up in here and research everything for as long as possible. But I'm afraid we don't have that kind of time. Perhaps one day...
Alchemy is a strange thing. Nothing else has the power to cause an entire island to float. But you must never forget that a price must always be paid--such is the nature of power.
Items with 0 uses left will disappear once removed. Is this okay?
You don't have enough slots, so the Core Item will be unequipped. Is this okay?
Cannot change equipment; no space in basket.
Cannot change equipment; no space in container.
The item will be put into the container. Would you like to check it?
You have discarded all the items you acquired.
Not enough space in the container. Please discard at least %d item(s).
More than 99 gathered items will be destroyed.
You lost some items after your defeat.
No more LP; some of your gathered items have been lost.
There appears to be space for the item.
All team members are set to Support. Members will be automatically changed to Attack. Proceed?
No Primal Arts can be activated.
No space in container; some items were not collected.
Cannot use item; some item effects still remain.
Cannot use this; basket is empty.
This will remove all effects from previous reinforcement. Are you sure?
This will reset your selection. Are you sure?
Use Item Rebuild on synthesized item?
*Cannot use items registered as Favorite.^00*Cannot use some items in certain special Material Loops.
Removing %s from equipment; not enough Dexterity.
Depending on the Material Loop, the recipe may change, as well as the recipe in the Cooking Tree.
Effect 1 will appear or grow based on Material Loop level.
Effect 2 will appear or grow based on Material Loop level.
Effect 3 will appear or grow based on Material Loop level.
Effect 4 will appear or grow based on Material Loop level.
Quality will change based on Material Loop level.
Trait slots will change based on Material Loop level.
Recipe and Synthesis Tree will change based on Material Loop level.
Item level will go down based on Material Loop level.
CC will go down based on Material Loop level.
Equipment HP will go up based on Material Loop level.
Equipment ATK will go up based on Material Loop level.
Equipment DEF will go up based on Material Loop level.
Equipment SPD will go up based on Material Loop level.
Equipment Offense Lv. will go up based on Material Loop level.
Equipment Defense Lv. will go up based on Material Loop level.
Equipment Support Lv. will go up based on Material Loop level.
What we've got here is one of the most basic forms of alchemy--the recipe for Green Supplement.
Alchemy allows you to create something from nothing, but if you don't follow the proper steps, you're doomed to fail.
So watch carefully to make sure that doesn't happen.
You see the collection of materials you'll need to toss into the cauldron? This is known as the <#006e5a>Material Loop<CLNR>.
Alchemy is all about adding the right items to the Material Loop in order to create whatever you desire.
First we'll add the Nameless Grass, which you gathered earlier, into the Material Loop.
I'm sure this is obvious, but you need to possess the necessary materials *before* you begin synthesizing.
So if you find anything that's useful for alchemy, make sure you gather plenty of it.
But I digress. Let's toss in the Nameless Grass.
Did you notice the change in the Material Loop when you added the Nameless Grass?
Let's try adding another Nameless Grass.
By adding a second Nameless Grass, a new Material Loop connected and unlocked its hidden power.
Of course, that doesn't mean you should just add a bunch of strong materials at random.
You have to consider how a material might connect to the Material Loop, and add the appropriate ones.
This would probably go faster if you did it yourself.
I've prepared some Water for you to use with the connected Material Loop.
Most recipes will tell you <#006e5a>exactly how many of each material you'll need for a synthesis<CLNR>.
Green Supplement requires at least 3 materials in total, so adding the Nameless Grass and the water did the trick.
Finally, you need to mix the cauldron to begin the actual synthesis.
If the ingredients have any traits, you can transfer those traits to the synthesized item.
You can transfer up to 3 traits, but first you'll need to unlock the required trait slots.
As you level up the "Trait Slot Unlock" Material Loop, more trait slots will unlock. So be sure to level those up as you find them.
Furthermore, some traits can be combined with themselves to level them up during synthesis.
Trait levels will also increase with your alchemy level. The higher the level, the more powerful and effective they'll become.
Repeating syntheses will lead to more powerful traits, so pursue the strongest item possible.
To synthesize an item, you need <#006e5a>its recipe<CLNR> and <#006e5a>an alchemy level (A-Lv.) higher than the item level<CLNR>.
You'll also need to toss additional ingredients into the Material Loop that the recipe doesn't mention.
Check the icon to see how many materials you'll have to add.
Once all the icons are blinking, press <IM19> to begin the synthesis.
If you're missing any requirements, the item will turn red. So keep an eye on that while preparing your synthesis.
Okay, let's synthesize a Green Supplement. First, select Green Supplement from the list.
Each Material Loop has one of the four elements: <#006e5a>Fire, ice, lightning, or wind<CLNR>.
<#006e5a>Fire<CLNR> is red, <#006e5a>ice<CLNR> is blue, <#006e5a>lightning<CLNR> is yellow, and <CLGR>wind<CLNR> is green.
Adding materials with the same element as the Material Loop will let you add its power, known as its <#006e5a>Element Value<CLNR>.
Now then, let's add a Nameless Grass to the Material Loop of <#006e5a>Effect 1<CLNR>.
Using a Nameless Grass with the wind element increases the Material Loop's Element Value by 1.
Increasing the Element Value can unlock extra benefits, like new item effects and higher quality.
Also, some Material Loops require certain elements and Element Values.
Once you get used to synthesizing, you should keep an eye out for conditions that will let you connect Material Loops.
Now then, go ahead and toss in another Nameless Grass to see if you can connect the Material Loop.
The Material Loop has a high enough wind value, so you've unlocked <#006e5a>Synthesis Quality +5<CLNR>, and the neighboring Material Loop.
Synthesis Quality +5 will increase the quality of the final synthesized item.
The higher an item's quality, the stronger its attack or healing amount. Try to get the highest quality you can.
Finally, let's add some Clean Water to the connected Material Loop.
<#006e5a>Auto-Add Materials<CLNR> will automatically toss in materials, while <#006e5a>Select All<CLNR> will select all necessary materials from the container.
Press <IM15> while selecting the Material Loop to use Auto-Add Materials. You can choose to prioritize by quality.
To use Select All, press <IM15> while picking materials to put a check mark next to them, then press <IM00> to add those items.
Use <#006e5a>Auto-Add Materials<CLNR> to simplify the synthesis, or use <#006e5a>Select All<CLNR> to toss in a bunch of materials at once.
Getting to the store is so hard these days. I miss when I could walk all over the island...
My feet feel much better now. Thank you, Ryza.
I can go for walks as much as I like now, thanks to you.
That fragrance... I wonder where it comes from...
Once my shopping's all done, next I have to...
It's kind of empty around here, but it's still my favorite place to be.
Things have calmed down a bit at the farm. All that's left now is...
Thanks for the help, Ryza. We won't have to worry about the lights again for a while.
Hmm... Things seem to be getting out of hand.
Farming is great and all, but I have preparations I need to take care of.
I want Rolf to take over, so I need to teach him everything I know about dyeing.
The ocean breeze, the view... This island is just so lovely.
You'll realize just how incredible this island is once you see more of the world.
I need to rethink the point of all my traveling...
I'm taking a break from traveling. I hope you don't mind waiting for new stories!
Please get me that medicine. I'll be waiting right here.
*sigh* Maybe I just need to leave the island.
Another day without finding a likely candidate...
I wonder if there's a better way than sending a letter out to sea...
Meeting new people is great, but sometimes you need to meet yourself, you know?
Is there any other way to get stronger?
You're such a slob, you know that? I guess I'll just have to look after you.
What should I ask you to make next? It should be something nutritious!
There aren't many places where it's okay to yell and shout, you know?
This is the best place to do a bit of training.
Welcome! How can I help you?
I hope I didn't forget to buy anything...
If you're in the mood for fish, just swing by the market!
Old Town's slopes and steps get harder and harder for me every year...
Hrm... I'm just hoping for a big job to fall into my lap.
How can I drum up more customers for the dye house?
I should check and see how the ship is doing.
This area is so calm and peaceful...
I'm excited to see how things turn out!
It's hard to do two jobs at once and do them both well.
I'm a handyman by day, so let me know if you have anything that needs fixing!
My training's been pretty tough, but there's always something new to learn.
I'm so busy these days! I should go check on my goat...
How's Fressher doing? I'm sorry to ask you to make my deliveries for me...
There's just so much to do today!
The island never changes, so it's up to you to change things on your own.
If you need anything from my farm, just help yourself!
What's popular in the capital these days? I bet it's some kind of snack or dessert!
I'm working on the pudding right now. Please just wait a little longer!
What's the best way to turn this into a local specialty, I wonder...?
It's important to try and make it popular with the locals before anything else.
And to do that, I have to be extra careful while I'm making it.
Hmm... There's so much to do anytime you want to introduce something new!
Did you bring me the alchemy item I asked for?
I'm looking for the next big scoop...
Won't someone bring me a nice, juicy scoop!?
If you have any good leads, please let me know!
The most popular girl around is back! Let me know if anything happens!
The port has as much juicy info as it does fresh fish!
I'm on the hunt for leads. I'd rather get it out of the way before my dad hassles me.
I guess I can't expect much just doing the same thing over and over...
Trying to come up with an original story is way different from looking for news.
Hrmm... I wonder if I have enough money.
The general store is fine for everyday stuff, but proper clothing is another story.
Fressher's store gets pretty crowded sometimes. Morning is the best time to go.
The port's good for food, but the Boden general store is best for everyday goods.
Maybe I should write a story about Wendy's childhood!
I like how dark it gets here, but Mom and Dad might worry if I stay out too late...
Literature... Mathematics... I really need to think hard about the curriculum.
Education is always important! Especially during times of need.
I have to make sure the educational system can carry on even after I'm gone.
I think I've come up with a good way to keep the system going...I hope.
Creating the textbook has given me another chance to learn. How unexpected...
Things have been set in motion, but now I need someone to spread the good news.
I've been looking all over, but I haven't seen anyone like them.
It makes me mad not being able to find them...
Let me know if you can't find them.
Ryza--it's important to focus on learning, but you still have to live your life.
If you hurt yourself or get sick, come see me.
I wonder if alchemy has something to do with it...
If I had to say for sure...
The more time passes, the more I dream of my past.
Hmm... I wonder if there's some way I could force myself to remember everything.
This island is the most calming place I've ever been. Anyway, I need to stock up...
To me, treasure is anything that can turn a profit.
Can't someone do something about the Puni that's blocking the road to the island...?
You always disappear the second I take my eyes off you! Tomorrow, you're gonna help out around here no matter what!
So you've been palling around with that Valentz fella's daughter, huh? You'd better not be a bad influence on her!
You've been got a lot more than usual lately. Just what the heck are you getting up to?
I heard there are more and more monster attacks on the mainland lately. You'd better not be going anywhere near there!
I was at the port and the fishermen all told me how much you've been helping them out. They even gave me some gifts. I was...surprised, to say the least.
Bos came over the other day. He seemed kind of nervous. Did something happen?
The key? Oh, the bathroom door has been acting up lately. Be careful about that.
I know it happens every year, but I hate when the drought comes... No rain means no crops.
I don't know what you're up to, but just don't get yourself hurt!
You seem different lately, Ryza. I guess maybe you're finally growing up...
Whew! Another hard day's work. It's tough, but it's just so satisfying. Don't you agree, Ryza?
Ryza, do you know where that big pot went that used to be here? I like using it to store our vegetables.
I've been helping out at Bascila's farm, too. I just love seeing all the different vegetables she's growing. Why don't you come with me sometime, Ryza?
I've been spending too much lately. Ryza, make sure you manage your money so your mother doesn't yell at you, too!
No matter how safe the island may be, you're still just a young girl. You shouldn't go out late at night.
The island ruins? They've all been falling apart forever, but nobody seems to bat an eye.
Hrmm... The weather is one thing we just can't control. I'll have to go have another chat with Mr. Brunnen...
Let me give you some advice, Ryza--if you're having trouble making a decision, just be honest with yourself. That's never steered me wrong.
Welcome home! Are you gonna go play with your friends tomorrow? I was hoping you could help out on the farm, but that's okay. Have fun, okay?
Welcome, Ryza. Please make yourself comfortable.
I'd really love to go adventuring with everyone. I hope I can make Father understand...
Ryza, let's hurry to your atelier.
I know it's dangerous, but please don't leave me behind...
This is just between you and me, but...Lila's hairstyle is just so cute, don't you think? I wonder how I'd look with something similar...
I wonder how Kilo's doing... I hope she can come visit our hideout someday.
A manmade island... I never could have imagined such a thing. Are you scared, Ryza? Or maybe you're excited...
Maybe it's because of everything we've been through, but I feel like I can trust you three completely. I have to make sure I can keep up...
One ordinary day... That's the kind of thing I love about this island. We have to do everything we can to protect that.
How's your alchemy coming along, Ryza? I'd love to see you at work again sometime...
Hello, Reisalin. Please, make yourself at home.
It's you again. I still need to determine whether or not I can entrust my daughter to you.
Please look after my daughter. And don't ask her to do anything crazy...
This island is filled with fine, upstanding people. All of my negotiations have gone quite smoothly.
Mr. Brunnen informed me that you brought Bos back safe and sound. It seems you may be more reliable than I first assumed.
Klaudia has been spending a lot of time in the study lately, doing some kind of research. I hope she's not planning to do anything dangerous...
I had no idea the drought could be this terrible. I'm sorry, I don't have time for you right now.
I'm busy as ever. I'm sorry, but could you spend some time with Klaudia?
I'm sorry for asking you to look after Klaudia so much. But I really am very thankful.
Did you prepare the items I asked for?
I'm starting to pick out more individual words in the books I've been reading. It seems like our library is a real treasure trove.
My vocabulary is still improving, but the grammar is so hard! Even so, this is all really exciting!
Looking through our old books, I've noticed a lot of circular patterns. I wonder if they have any special meaning...
So we're really going... Just promise me you'll be ready to retreat at any moment.
Mom and Dad are at work... I should probably get going, before they find me.
I'm starting to pick out more individual words in my books. It seems like our library is a real treasure trove.
My vocabulary is still improving, but the grammar is so hard!
The Oren... I haven't forgotten what Lila said, but I'd really like to explore the Underworld more someday.
I feel like I've been getting stronger, don't you think? Maybe I'll even be able to beat up Bos one of these days...
I never imagined the island could be hiding such a huge secret... And I only just started learning to read those books. It's all kind of scary...
Empel taught me a little trick to help me study. You wanna know what it is? He said I should eat plenty of sweets.
Whew... It's so hot! But I really like reading here. I'm gonna stay a little while longer.
I've been learning more about the past little by little, but the mysteries just keep piling up. I need to keep studying...
Did you buy the goat meat?
When I was little, I used to love pretending to be a treasure hunter. We all knew there was treasure buried all over the island.
I spotted a Silver Puni on the Traveler's Road once. It was so bright, I could hardly look at it!
They say if you follow the Traveler's Road long enough, you may run into a Gold Puni. Apparently if you find one, you'll have a year of good luck.
I've seen you wandering around here a lot lately. Have you stumbled on any treasure? Either way, just make sure you don't lose any of your belongings.
Monsters are more active at night. Of course, the island is safe no matter what time of day it is.
There's a flower in Pixie Forest that only blooms at night. I should try to find it so I can give it to my girlfriend. I bet she'd love it...
Legend tells of a strange being known as an Elemental. Nobody I know has ever actually seen one with their own eyes, though...
I'm the dragon slayer! Now you have to call me the Hunter of Dragons!
I'm the Shining Puni slayer! Now you have to call me the Hero of the Age!
I'm the master of the five powers! Now you have to call me the Glorious Sage!
There used to be a lot more water all over the island. That's why there are canals everywhere.
It's really hard to keep the water clean. In lots of places it's really cloudy and foamy.
I wonder if the water here will dry up someday, like it did in Old Town... I hope not, I really like listening to how it flows.
Whoever controls the water, controls everything--that's what people used to say a long time ago. Living here on the island, it really makes a lot of sense.
That cape has a really amazing view--I think it might be my favorite place on the entire island. But there's probably even more amazing spots on the mainland.
Have you heard of the volcano far beyond the island? A traveler told me the view from the top just can't be beat.
The view from the top of Liese Valley must be really beautiful and impressive. I'd really love to see it for myself someday...
Oh, Ryza! Are you here to help me with the harvest?
You shouldn't wander off like that troublesome goat!
No matter what, stay away from that old castle! It might have hidden treasure, but it's also full of monsters!
There's a fairy tale about a goat that visits a valley, but the valley near the island is full of deadly monsters! Promise me you won't go near it!
Whew... That troublesome goat finally came back. I wish I could leave the island to go play sometime.
Things are peaceful, it's a beautiful night... All is well.
A nice summer rain at night is one of life's finer pleasures.
I just love the view out here. Do you have a favorite view? You should try and find a spot that you truly love.
Some parts of the world fully experience all four seasons. I'd sure like to go there someday...
It's so hot lately! I heard there are some areas overflowing with lava, but all I can think about is how much I hate this drought!
I've decided to go traveling. Fantastical ruins, tropical oceans... I want to see all the things you could never find here!
That Moritz fella is nothing but trouble. He completely disregarded what I had to say to him...!
Slaying a dragon? That's just disaster waiting to happen... I hope everything turns out okay.
You're lucky things went as well as they did. But please don't create any more problems for the village...
This is where I feel most at peace. I wish it could be like this forever...
Pudding is made with goat's milk. Thank you, goats!
I was thinking of new things we could make with our pudding. What about a Kurken Fruit flavored version? It would be so tangy and delicious...
Now that the pudding is really selling well, my mornings are way more busy. I'm not complaining, of course.
Dad got himself drunk again. I don't wanna go home till he's passed out.
If you're planning on leaving the island, I'm coming with you. It's the perfect chance to get some battle experience!
Stop wasting time and let's head to the old castle!
I can't believe we actually beat that dragon. Have we really gotten that strong...?
Compared to Lila's past, what I'm going through is basically nothing. I need to figure out how to deal with my problems better.
Ryza, could you take a look at my sword when you get a chance? Between the dragon and those Underworld beasts, who knows what might happen next?
A manmade island... It's almost too crazy to believe. Of course, after the Underworld I guess anything is possible. Anyway, let's just keep moving.
I'm useless when it comes to complex problems, but if you need someone to brute force something, I'm your man!
I was surprised to hear you wanted to leave the island. But can't stop after coming this far. Need to pay everyone back!
I happened to spot Lila the other day, and she had a huge load of sweets in her arms. I broke out in a cold sweat when I saw that...
Get lost. I'm not here to entertain you.
Hmph. You again? You got too much time on your hands.
Lent, you damn idiot. Where'd you run off to? I'm almost outta booze here...
Hey, you. Tell my useless kid if he has time play adventurer, he has time to get a damn job!
Agh, it's so damn hot out...! Where'd that little brat run off to? What a waste of space...
You're a weird one, Ryza. Nothin' good can come from hangin' out with my kid.
Huh? Where's Lent? Beats the hell outta me. Probably wanderin' around somewhere.
Bos... I guess there's nothing left to say.
Are you ready? I'm not a patient person. Hurry up and go so you can get back.
Rushing around aimlessly like usual, huh? Well...I guess I'd be worried if you *weren't* acting like that.
You better not cause any trouble for Bos!
Stop being so childish! You should learn to be more like Bos.
Oh, welcome! Actually, I'm restocking the merchandise right now. Could you come back a little later?
How could a merchant lose their own map? I guess we'll have to navigate on our own for now.
What? Now the compass is gone? How do you expect to safely make your way through this area? *sigh* I'll go find it, but try and be more careful...
Stay out of the Devil's Field. It's overflowing with dangerous monsters--more than a few adventurers have gotten themselves hurt there.
I've been getting more and more reports of monsters attacking travelers. Don't leave the island!
It seems like the monster attacks have tapered off, but you never know when a deadly beast could appear. Always be well prepared when you travel.
Kurken Island is as peaceful as ever. Hahaha!
I hope Kurken Island can start to develop more now that Lubart is here. Hahaha!
I heard a dragon has appeared on the mainland. How frightening! Hahaha!
It seems like that alchemist has been fighting with the fisherman. That's no good! Hahaha!
Ahh, it's been so hot lately! Looks like the drought is well on its way. Hahaha!
It's just so hot. I can't wait till the rain comes back! Hahaha!
Kurken Island is as peaceful as ever. Hahaha!
Word of our pudding has spread far and wide, and people are coming from all over to buy it. It's the perfect Kurken Island souvenir!
I'm planning to stand in line all night so I don't miss my chance to get some pudding! I just love having it with my breakfast.
Did you know? The ghost of a little girl appears in the cemetery every night...
Did you know? There's a couple dressed all in black that buys all the candy in all the stores every night. Jeez, that's too scary...
Did you know? People say you can hear children laughing in Pixie Forest every night. Ahh, so scary...!
A ghost? Me? As if! I just have sensitive skin, so I don't like going out during the day. I like to go for walks after the sun goes down.
You can find stone monuments like this all over the island. Even near the shore and way up high...
The tower far beyond the island is home to a powerful, thick-skinned monster. It wanders the land, looking for a challenge...
It's starting to get colder. Maybe I should take a break from my nightly walks. ...Is there anything you wish you had done more often?
Did you know? The ghost of a little girl appears in the cemetery every night...
Did you know? There's a couple dressed all in black that buys all the candy in all the stores every night. Jeez, that's too scary...
Did you know? People say you can hear children laughing in Pixie Forest every night. Ahh, so scary...!
A ghost? Me? As if! I just have sensitive skin, so I don't like going out during the day. I like to go for walks after the sun goes down.
You can find stone monuments like this all over the island. Even near the shore and way up high...
The tower far beyond the island is home to a powerful, thick-skinned monster. It wanders the land, looking for a challenge...
It's starting to get colder. Maybe I should take a break from my nightly walks. ...Is there anything you wish you had done more often?
Hmph. You're that Stout brat, right? What business do you have with the Brunnens!?
Oh, Ryza! Thank you again for what you did for Bos. But don't let it go to your head!
Ahh, I love when the weather starts to turn cool. This is my favorite time of year. The rest of the villagers probably love it too, don't you think?
Bos is starting to become a man. He really is his father's son! Hahaha!
You only have clean drinking water thanks to the Brunnen family. Never forget that.
We could never live through the drought without the Brunnen family. We're all so thankful...
The water that flows from Brunnen manor is so lovely. The Brunnen family is just so great...!
*huff huff* I managed to make it...all the way to the top... I think I'm done for today...
Why'd the Brunnen family build their home somewhere so inconvenient? It's got a gorgeous view, but still... I guess they must be really strong.
There's a road that leads away from the manor, but the security is surprisingly tight. I wonder what it leads to...
You remember the exhausted old man by the stairs? He brings in all the supplies. He means well, but I'm not surprised he's always so worn out.
Oh, Ryza. Skipping out on helping out at home again? I hope you're not planning to sneak off to the mainland...
I never imagined you'd be able to defeat the dragon. When did you get so strong?
I haven't seen you around as much lately. I know you handled that dragon, but try not to get into any more trouble, okay?
Bos told me what happened. I had no idea you'd matured so much. You have my thanks for what you did...
I've been hearing a lot of rumors about you recently. All good, of course. I have to say, I'm proud of you. Hmhm...
Looks like the dry season is on its way once again. How's your farm doing, Ryza? Don't forget to help out those closest to you.
I'm not sure how much is thanks to you, but the island seems much more lively lately. I hope we can keep this up...
You seem kind of restless today. Just when I thought you were starting to mature. But to be honest...I kind of prefer you this way.
I can't drink anymore... Ahh, I can't move! I'm totally stuffed!
Terrace seating is always packed in the summer. Everyone loves to party until dawn!
This is the Fairystone Quarry. It's where we work, but kids are always showing up here, acting like it's a playground.
Huh? What's the secret to mining? It's all about using the right tool for the job. Of course, the only job here is mining Fairystones.
Oww! I hurt my back carrying all my equipment. Maybe I should get rid of some of my tools...
Okay, my back's feeling better so it's time to get back to mining Fairystones!
Hey, did you make something useful for us?
Where did that fruit come from again? I think I found it in some cave, but... Hmm...
Milk... Potatoes... Meat... What else? Oh no! The milk has gone bad!
Hello there. Do you need any stone? Or maybe some lumber? No? Yeah, I guess a teenage girl wouldn't need stuff like that...
Young lady, have you tried it yet? I'm talking about the pudding, of course! It's the talk of the town, and I'm here to buy more of it.
*sigh* I missed my chance to buy the pudding again! Maybe I should just move to the island...
My daughter just loves the pudding here. Bragging to your friends about how much you've had is all the rage these days. I don't understand the youth of today...
Today's sales were... Ugh, pretty awful. Maybe I should go try and mine some more ore.
Sales are still low. Maybe I should stop selling raw materials, and try processing it first.
Alright, sales are finally starting to stabilize. Maybe I'll take a gamble and try to get my hands on some dragon materials. Those always sell like hotcakes!
Hrmm, where did I go wrong? Maybe things will go better if I can get more experience making things.
Ahh, things are looking up! It's not so bad to try new things once in a while.
This is the ideal form, but there are still lots of methods out there in the wide world I haven't seen yet. Wow, this is so deep...
There is some shining monster at the Meteor Castle. I hope it's nothing but a rumor.
Geez, Ryza is such a pusher. She'll complain if we're late, so I better go and gather the materials quickly.
Next up after the meat is...Uni. I think I saw the silver ones at the northern part of main road...
The shining monster does interest me, but...do I really have to go? Sigh... I'm really not into this.
A shining dragon... Are we really fighting it on our own? I thought it would be more doable if it was a shining Puni or something.
Did you get everything I asked for?
Well? Did you get anything good?
All right. Let's start the prep. Come on, you're in the way. Can you go over there for now?
You're already forced to help Ryza. Those materials can be gathered around here. It shouldn't be too much trouble.
Ryza appears to be quite motivated. Haha, let's see how this will turn out.
You're helping out Ryza? This is perfect timing. Go do it as part of your training.
Klaudia looked so serious. I wonder if something happened. I hope it's nothing big.
Hmph. You're that Stout brat, right? What business do you have with the Brunnens!?
Oh, Ryza! Thank you again for what you did for Bos. But don't let it go to your head!
Ahh, I love when the weather starts to turn cool. This is my favorite time of year. The rest of the villagers probably love it too, don't you think?
Bos is starting to become a man. He really is his father's son! Hahaha!
You only have clean drinking water thanks to the Brunnen family. Never forget that.
We could never live through the drought without the Brunnen family. We're all so thankful...
The water that flows from Brunnen manor is so lovely. The Brunnen family is just so great...!
*huff huff* I managed to make it...all the way to the top... I think I'm done for today...
Why'd the Brunnen family build their home somewhere so inconvenient? It's got a gorgeous view, but still... I guess they must be really strong.
There's a road that leads away from the manor, but the security is surprisingly tight. I wonder what it leads to...
You remember the exhausted old man by the stairs? He brings in all the supplies. He means well, but I'm not surprised he's always so worn out.
Oh, Ryza. Skipping out on helping out at home again? I hope you're not planning to sneak off to the mainland...
I never imagined you'd be able to defeat the dragon. When did you get so strong?
I haven't seen you around as much lately. I know you handled that dragon, but try not to get into any more trouble, okay?
Bos told me what happened. I had no idea you'd matured so much. You have my thanks for what you did...

Looks like the dry season is on its way once again. How's your farm doing, Ryza? Don't forget to help out those closest to you.
I'm not sure how much is thanks to you, but the island seems much more lively lately. I hope we can keep this up...
You seem kind of restless today. Just when I thought you were starting to mature. But to be honest...I kind of prefer you this way.

Oww! I hurt my back carrying all my equipment. Maybe I should get rid of some of my tools...
Okay, my back's feeling better so it's time to get back to mining Fairystones!
Hey, did you make something useful for us?
Where did that fruit come from again? I think I found it in some cave, but... Hmm...
Milk... Potatoes... Meat... What else? Oh no! The milk has gone bad!
Hello there. Do you need any stone? Or maybe some lumber? No? Yeah, I guess a teenage girl wouldn't need stuff like that...

*sigh* I missed my chance to buy the pudding again! Maybe I should just move to the island...
My daughter just loves the pudding here. Bragging to your friends about how much you've had is all the rage these days. I don't understand the youth of today...
Today's sales were... Ugh, pretty awful. Maybe I should go try and mine some more ore.
Sales are still low. Maybe I should stop selling raw materials, and try processing it first.
Alright, sales are finally starting to stabilize. Maybe I'll take a gamble and try to get my hands on some dragon materials. Those always sell like hotcakes!
Hrmm, where did I go wrong? Maybe things will go better if I can get more experience making things.
Ahh, things are looking up! It's not so bad to try new things once in a while.
This is the ideal form, but there are still lots of methods out there in the wide world I haven't seen yet. Wow, this is so deep...
So they are working... I wonder if Ryza should be helping them.
If they find out what she's doing... Ryza might be grounded for a while.
I don't know how you can run around in this heat. Just be careful so that you don't get hurt!
Ugh, it's so hot... It feels hotter than usual. Give me a break.
Don't do anything too dangerous. Otherwise, Agatha will yell at you again!
Water level suddenly decreased. Is the water backed up somewhere?
I'm bored of playing the hero. What should I play next?
Sounds of water flow is so nice. It gives me peace.
Water level suddenly decreased. I loved looking at the water from here, too... I hope it comes back soon.
Hey, are you out for a walk? It's rare for you to come out here.
Looks like something happened with the waterway. Do you know anything about it?
Listen. If you get harassed by a big goat, you have to run away immediately! You'll lose the fight!
There's someone digging up holes all around Kurken Island recently. My neighbor's farm got ruined, too!
When I was young, I loved looking at the scenery here. But it felt so much bigger back then. If only I enjoyed that scenery more...
Looks like the water flow in the waterway is completely stopped. We're lucky that it didn't happen during the drought.
Hey, Tao. Be sure to watch out so that Ryza and Lent don't get into trouble.
There's someone playing a prank on Moritz. My stomach hurts just thinking about how he'll be complaining to me nonstop.
Hey, how is your grandfather? Can you tell him that we should have some tea again sometime soon?
You look like you're hiding about something you did. Hahaha, when I was your age, I played so many pranks with your grandfather.
Oh, it's you, Tao. Isn't it hot today? Would you like some milk? You got to grow bigger.
Phew. The water all dried up. I hope something can be done about it soon.
Hey, Tao! Did you find out about the coin?
Phew... Agatha really works you hard. I'll help you guys out in a little bit. I'm counting on you for that coin!
I didn't think that little fishing trip would turn into something so big. There's never a dull moment with you guys.
What do you want? Lent isn't here. Get out!
Oh? Did you have a fight with Lent? Hehehe... I haven't seen him like that in a while.
Tch... Another noisy one coming here... Lent isn't here! You and Ryza never give up, huh?
Bos... I guess there's nothing to talk to them about.
You shouldn't go out at night so much. It's dangerous out there.
Did you guys find the culprit behind the water getting dammed up? The rocks are all fixed in place, and we can't remove it.
It's so hot today. I'm just glad we have a reservoir. Hahahaha.
With the water gone, it feels so much hotter today... It certainly is troubling. Hahahaha.
Oh, hello Tao. Did you need to do a job... Hm? A coin? Hmm... I've never seen this one before.
Hi, Tao. I need more material to write about. If you have a scoop, please do give me some info.
Take a look. The water in the reservoir is suddenly decreasing. This is amazing! I have a scoop!
Hello, Tao. The book you told me about the other day was great. Please let me know if you have any other recommendations.
Hey, Tao. Hmm. I've never seen this coin before. Sorry I can't help.
The water is decreasing all around the island. It's not too serious yet, but I am worried about Rasen or the Old Town.
A coin? Don't know anything about that. Though I did find about 500 Cole once. Not too shabby, eh?
Surprising, isn't it? The water in the channel just suddenly disappeared... Wonder what caused it to do so?
Even you're going on a walk at a time like this? Is it like some sort of test of courage? I've gotta admit, you're manlier than you look!
So the spirit turned out to be a beckoning flower... The cause of the water disappearing is probably also because of the beckoning flower, huh?
Hiya, Tao. Thanks for helpin' out with the farm the other day. And make sure to come back anytime you've got the chance!
Man, this is bad. There's no more water left to use for my farm! If only there was some way to fix this quickly...
I came here this time to fix a water leak that started happenin' after the new person moved in... Though I probably oughta do somethin' about the channel first...
Hmm? What do you want? I have an important guest here at the island. You better not cause any trouble!
Who would play such a prank! I'm in the middle of a business deal with Valentz. I'll punish the culprit when I find them!
The waterfall is so nice. The reason this island has water is because of the Brunnen family and this waterfall.
Oh, this is terrible. The water must be returned soon, or it will stain the family name of Brunnen.
Huff... Huff... The stairs just...never end...
Huff... Huff... I managed to climb to the top. Phew, I'm tired. But I have to do it again tomorrow...
Do you need something from Brunnen? He's dealing with the merchant that came recently, so I'm sure he's busy.
Wow, Brunnen was mad. Someone pranked his precious waterway, I heard. This will definitely linger.
Did you bring what I asked you?
What brings you all the way out here? Don't do anything dangerous like Ryza.
Oh, hi Tao. Hm? What's this? A coin? Hmm, I've never seen this even in my travels.
Tao... I'm sorry... I want to be alone right now.
Hiccup... I see a giant mushroom... All right. I'm making a mushroom pie for my snack today! Miss, get me another wine!
I'm sorry the customer is so rude. It's even more trouble because he's a regular. When you get bigger, I'll give a good deal on stop.
Hm? You want to know if I recognize this coin? I've never seen it around here. Sorry I couldn't help.
The next order is...stone materials. I think you can find it in the open area at the forest on the other side... But there's monsters there, so I should find another way.
Hi, Tao. Sorry about the other time. I managed to repair it by doing as you said. If anything happens again, I hope you'll help.
Hey, Ryza. Would you like to listen to me play the flute again sometime?
I know it's dangerous, but please don't leave me behind...
I feel much more relaxed here than I do at home. Oh, but don't tell my father I said that...
Are there any useful materials in the Underworld? There were so many things there we don't have here, I'm sure you could make some very unique items.
Is there anything you want here, Ryza? I'd like a piano. Wouldn't it be wonderful if we could play music together?
We should try redecorating once in a while. It's a nice change of pace, and you might even make a few fun discoveries.
You look really confident when you synthesize now, Ryza. As long as you keep making items for us, I'm sure we can beat any enemy.
Do you have a crush on anyone, Ryza? For me...it's a secret! We should invite Lila here so we can all chat about it together.
Hey, I had an idea! What if I brought a bunch of my books here? I could call it "Professor Tao's Laboratory." Oh, but I guess it's already Atelier Ryza...
So you're really planning to go? Well...at least make sure you prepare as much as you can.
I'm starting to really like this atelier. If there was one thing I'd change, I'd like a little more space to store some books...
Oww... I keep winding up with all these scrapes and bruises. Ryza, please remember to bring some medicine next time we head out...
Some of the items you make are super poisonous, right? Please make sure you don't leave them laying around...
Do you know how the Gathering Synthesizer works? It's nice that we can use it to get plenty of materials, but it's so strange...
Ryza, could you double-check my items? I want to be able to protect everyone when the time comes.
It looks like summer is coming to an end. This time of year always makes me a little sad. How about you? I wonder if people have always felt that way...
This isn't bad at all, for something made by an amateur. I'll use it with joy.
The dragon, the gate, and the Philuscha... It would seem we made the right decision to come here.
How's your alchemy training been coming along? Even when you make the same thing, changing your process can yield vastly different results.
If you're not sure what to do for a synthesis, try visiting a gathering place to change things up. It may help you uncover a new piece of the puzzle.
One unfortunate thing about this area is that there are no stores nearby. If you have time, could you use this cauldron of yours to make me some sweets?
I hope you're not slacking off on your synthesis. Eventually you'll hit a wall in your training, and you'll need to be able to push past it quickly.
Have you prepared everything you need? It's best to look over them one more time to see if you can make any final improvements.
This place is really quite comfortable. And now that I think about it, it seems we've known each other for quite some time now. Hmhm...
Were you able to make what I asked for?
This is a great place to do my training. I can't exactly swing my sword around when there's a bunch of people around.
Stop wasting time and let's head to the old castle!
I'm getting bored fighting the monsters in the forest. Let's head to the mountains next! I bet you can find some rare stones there, too.
Besides items that just hurt the enemy, you can make items that boost our power, right? Could you try using a few of those next time?
Have you been using the garden? If you plant stuff, make sure you look after it all the way through. You're the Wheat Girl of Kurken Island, after all!
Monsters drop rare materials once in a while. Do you think stronger monsters drop even more rare materials?
Are you prepared, Ryza? Lila says it's really important to meditate, so you can see yourself fighting any type of enemy you can imagine.
I think we've fought all the monsters there are around here. All that's left is... Anyway, I'd like to have a serious fight with Lila one of these days.
First of all, we need to check and see if there are any monsters in the area. Stay alert.
Hmm... It seems you've all matured much more than I realized.
Have you been training, Ryza? I don't expect you to do as much as Lent, but if you run away as much as Tao, you'll never improve.
Have you noticed the relationship between items and monsters? Each enemy has a different weakpoint. Take advantage of that to make battles easier for you.
Pay attention to when you use your healing items. One bad decision could lead to the death of the entire party.
The Gathering Synthesizer makes it much easier to train against monsters. I should take Lent there to train sometime...
The Ravaging Queen will certainly be very powerful. But for some reason...I'm not worried. I suppose it's because I know I can rely on you.
The scent in the air tells me the seasons are changing. It reminds me of the time I had to part ways with an old friend...
Bring me the prosthetic once it's finished, and I'll convince Empel to use it.
If you have the materials, could you give them to me?
I need a few more materials.
Please bring me the rest of the materials.
Hey, Ryza. Would you like to listen to me play the flute again sometime?
I know it's dangerous, but please don't leave me behind...
I feel much more relaxed here than I do at home. Oh, but don't tell my father I said that...
Are there any useful materials in the Underworld? There were so many things there we don't have here, I'm sure you could make some very unique items.
Is there anything you want here, Ryza? I'd like a piano. Wouldn't it be wonderful if we could play music together?
We should try redecorating once in a while. It's a nice change of pace, and you might even make a few fun discoveries.
You look really confident when you synthesize now, Ryza. As long as you keep making items for us, I'm sure we can beat any enemy.
Do you have a crush on anyone, Ryza? For me...it's a secret! We should invite Lila here so we can all chat about it together.

So you're really planning to go? Well...at least make sure you prepare as much as you can.
I'm starting to really like this atelier. If there was one thing I'd change, I'd like a little more space to store some books...
Oww... I keep winding up with all these scrapes and bruises. Ryza, please remember to bring some medicine next time we head out...
Some of the items you make are super poisonous, right? Please make sure you don't leave them laying around...
Do you know how the Gathering Synthesizer works? It's nice that we can use it to get plenty of materials, but it's so strange...
Ryza, could you double-check my items? I want to be able to protect everyone when the time comes.
It looks like summer is coming to an end. This time of year always makes me a little sad. How about you? I wonder if people have always felt that way...
This isn't bad at all, for something made by an amateur. I'll use it with joy.
The dragon, the gate, and the Philuscha... It would seem we made the right decision to come here.

One unfortunate thing about this area is that there are no stores nearby. If you have time, could you use this cauldron of yours to make me some sweets?
