Have you prepared everything you need? It's best to look over them one more time to see if you can make any final improvements.
This place is really quite comfortable. And now that I think about it, it seems we've known each other for quite some time now. Hmhm...
Were you able to make what I asked for?
Even a common pot can be used as an alchemy cauldron in a pinch. But it'd be better if you had the tools to make sure you can heat it up slowly.
Empel bought so much candy again... He's the last person you'd expect to have a sweet tooth.
Did you finish making that medicine?
How is your treasure hunting going? Adventures are boring when everything goes well.
Oh? Seeing how you look, I can expect some good news.
Goodness. It never stops with you, does it? At this rate, you might find that very soon... Don't worry, it doesn't concern you.
I know I'm not the one to say, but Empel and you all are a curious bunch. Just be sure you don't get hurt out there.
Lent was throwing a tantrum. I don't know what happened, but you need to all calm down.
Looks like one of the problems are solved. They say that petty fights are worthless, but you should enjoy it while you can.
Speaking of which, how did you find those ruins? There appears to be some commotion outside.
This is a great place to do my training. I can't exactly swing my sword around when there's a bunch of people around.
Stop wasting time and let's head to the old castle!
I'm getting bored fighting the monsters in the forest. Let's head to the mountains next! I bet you can find some rare stones there, too.
Besides items that just hurt the enemy, you can make items that boost our power, right? Could you try using a few of those next time?
Have you been using the garden? If you plant stuff, make sure you look after it all the way through. You're the Wheat Girl of Kurken Island, after all!
Monsters drop rare materials once in a while. Do you think stronger monsters drop even more rare materials?
Are you prepared, Ryza? Lila says it's really important to meditate, so you can see yourself fighting any type of enemy you can imagine.
I think we've fought all the monsters there are around here. All that's left is... Anyway, I'd like to have a serious fight with Lila one of these days.
First of all, we need to check and see if there are any monsters in the area. Stay alert.
Hmm... It seems you've all matured much more than I realized.
Have you been training, Ryza? I don't expect you to do as much as Lent, but if you run away as much as Tao, you'll never improve.
Have you noticed the relationship between items and monsters? Each enemy has a different weakpoint. Take advantage of that to make battles easier for you.
Pay attention to when you use your healing items. One bad decision could lead to the death of the entire party.
The Gathering Synthesizer makes it much easier to train against monsters. I should take Lent there to train sometime...
The Ravaging Queen will certainly be very powerful. But for some reason...I'm not worried. I suppose it's because I know I can rely on you.
The scent in the air tells me the seasons are changing. It reminds me of the time I had to part ways with an old friend...
Bring me the prosthetic once it's finished, and I'll convince Empel to use it.
If you have the materials, could you give them to me?
I need a few more materials.
Please bring me the rest of the materials.
I think Lila's outside. I should go talk to her.
I never imagined I'd be using a cauldron like this. I'm getting really excited...!
Empel loves sweets, but he's still so thin! Does he use some secret alchemy potion to stay in shape?
I had no idea it would be so hard to make a single donut! Cooking is so...profound.
Once this donut's finished, how about asking Empel about Lila?
What's Empel's favorite food? Well, I always see him snacking on sweets and things...
A cookbook...? I think I have one, but I'm not sure where it is. I'll go look for it.
You can only find Moon Berries and Moonlight Berries at night. Make sure to watch out for monsters!
Speaking of cooking, I'm curious about the Klint Kingdom's culinary culture. I should do some research...
What is it? Did you need something from me?
Ahh, I'm so hungry! I want something sweet, but I guess now's no time to be picky. Oh well...
I smell something sweet... Or is that just my imagination?
What does Empel like? Desserts and stuff, right? It seems like that's all I ever see him eat.
I had no idea that oven actually worked! I bet it'd be perfect for cooking up some nice meat.
Whenever Klaudia uses the oven, it always smells super tasty! I hope she'll share some next time...
Lila was looking kinda red, don't you think? I didn't know the Oren could get sick...
You remember that forest that smelled so good? The donut smelled a little like that...
How's your donut coming along? I can teach anyone to fight, but making donuts is beyond me.
I'll cook for you next time we go on a journey. Empel's eaten my food and he's still alive, so...
Anyway, now's no time for talking nonsense. Let's just finish this before he realizes what's going on.
I bought too much merchandise; it won't all fit on the ship. Just take some, would you?
Even a common pot can be used as an alchemy cauldron in a pinch. But it'd be better if you had the tools to make sure you can heat it up slowly.
Empel bought so much candy again... He's the last person you'd expect to have a sweet tooth.
Did you finish making that medicine?
まったく、お前さんたちは次から次へと。^00この調子ならアレを見つけることも……。^00いやなに、こっちの話だ……、気にするな
人のことを言えた義理ではないが、^00アンペルもお前たちも物好きな奴らだ。^00ケガだけはしないよう注意しろよ
レントがいじけていたぞ。^00何があったかは知らんが、^00ほどほどにしておけよ
とりあえず問題が一つ解決したようだな。^00つまらんケンカは犬も喰わぬと言うが、^00それが出来るのも今の内か……
そういえば、^00あの遺物はどうやって見つけたんだ？^00何やら外が慌ただしいような気がするんだが
It's so quiet with them gone. Hm? No, I’m not lonely. You better not misunderstand.
Things are getting back to the way they were. However, Philuschas are just as powerful as always. I better move on with the investigation.
I need the Red Stone to reinforce that bomb. There should be enough materials around here to make up for that.
I have a bad feeling about this. We should hurry on once we've made the preparations.
I had a feeling about it... But it will all return back to the way it was unless that thing is defeated. We must complete the job.
I'd strongly advise against going in the cave up ahead. It's really dangerous. How dangerous is it? Even I can't say for sure...
Meteor Castle is up ahead. But don't go near it! It's really dangerous...
This place used to be beautiful...
Ryza, since I need durable parts I will need you synthesize them.
Even a common pot can be used as an alchemy cauldron in a pinch. But it'd be better if you had the tools to make sure you can heat it up slowly.
Empel bought so much candy again... He's the last person you'd expect to have a sweet tooth.
Did you finish making that medicine?
Please don't get it dirty. I'm the one that's going to get yelled at by Moritz.
Materials for bombs? I think I've seen some stones in the rocky areas of the island. Don't let things get out of hand.
I didn't know about that cave deep in the island. I hope you'll exterminate that monster as soon as possible.
I heard you defeated the monster. You can make some noise for a bit. I'll keep it a secret from Moritz.
You want to live on this island? I don't recommend it. These places are nice because you don't come here often.
All the preparations are complete. How are things with you?
Rest assured, I did *not* go easy on you. You've proven yourself a worthy opponent.
You stood strong against even my most powerful attacks. Well done, I must say.
I sense a mysterious power lurking within you. I'd like to learn more. Let us fight again.
You've bested me. But there are others far stronger than myself. You'd do well to keep your guard up.
Hmhm. Consider me impressed. I look forward to seeing how strong you can truly become.
If only all humans possessed such strength. But I shouldn't dwell on the past...
You wield true power. Thank you for showing me. Just be sure to use it only for justice.
This is a nice place. Let's take a swim together when we have time.
I found a pearl oyster at the beach. I saw them near the rocky areas.
Looks like that cave goes pretty deep. I wonder what's in there.
Now we can play to our hearts' content! I think it's been a while since I played with everyone.
You can get so many things at the island. Is it because there aren't many people who come here?
The sound of the waves and breeze are nice. I should have brought a book.
The vegetation of this island is essential to the area. I hope we can come again after defeating the monster, too. That's if Moritz allows it.
Sigh... I was prepared for it, but that monster looks strong. I should have brought a stronger item.
Heh, I actually wanted to play some more. The air on this island feels different from Kurken Island.
I'm glad Moritz let us explore around the island. I should make my own reading space next time.
That old man gets all the good stuff. Look at what a nice place he was hiding from the rest of us. Let's go and beat up that monster and then go play.
I found a nice fishing spot at the southwest side of the island. Ryza, you should check it out.
Wow, I didn't think you could break that huge rock. Alchemy is pretty great.
This, this, and that... We'll need all of it when we go play! Let's enjoy it while we're here!
Ugh, my head aches when I'm here on this island. Is it because of the sea breeze?
Now where is that monster? Playing around is fine, but don't forget you're here on a mission...
The fruit here tastes good, but I still want some sweets. Let's hurry up and defeat that monster.
The monster here could be stronger than initially thought. If you don't think the item you brought is enough, you should go and gather materials.
We have to obtain the reward for completing the quest. I suppose it's not bad to play around like a bunch of kids once in a while.
Looks like Lila likes this island, too. A place like this is rare on the other side.
This is a beautiful place. Doesn't it feel like time seems to pass slower?
There appears to be monsters stronger than the one we were looking for. I wonder if you can obtain some useful materials from them.
We haven't brought the right equipment this time around. Be sure to do the right preparations if you're going into battle.
It'll get busy once we return. You should play while you still can.
This really is a beautiful place. I like the way the air flows so slowly. If I had the chance, I'd bring Kilo here.
I'm starting to pick out more individual words in the books I've been reading. It seems like our library is a real treasure trove.
My vocabulary is still improving, but the grammar is so hard! Even so, this is all really exciting!
Looking through our old books, I've noticed a lot of circular patterns. I wonder if they have any special meaning...
So we're really going... Just promise me you'll be ready to retreat at any moment.
Mom and Dad are at work... I should probably get going, before they find me.
I'm starting to pick out more individual words in my books. It seems like our library is a real treasure trove.
My vocabulary is still improving, but the grammar is so hard!
The Oren... I haven't forgotten what Lila said, but I'd really like to explore the Underworld more someday.
I feel like I've been getting stronger, don't you think? Maybe I'll even be able to beat up Bos one of these days...
I never imagined the island could be hiding such a huge secret... And I only just started learning to read those books. It's all kind of scary...
Empel taught me a little trick to help me study. You wanna know what it is? He said I should eat plenty of sweets.
Whew... It's so hot! But I really like reading here. I'm gonna stay a little while longer.
I've been learning more about the past little by little, but the mysteries just keep piling up. I need to keep studying...
Did you buy the goat meat?
When I was little, I used to love pretending to be a treasure hunter. We all knew there was treasure buried all over the island.
I spotted a Silver Puni on the Traveler's Road once. It was so bright, I could hardly look at it!
They say if you follow the Traveler's Road long enough, you may run into a Gold Puni. Apparently if you find one, you'll have a year of good luck.
I've seen you wandering around here a lot lately. Have you stumbled on any treasure? Either way, just make sure you don't lose any of your belongings.
Monsters are more active at night. Of course, the island is safe no matter what time of day it is.
There's a flower in Pixie Forest that only blooms at night. I should try to find it so I can give it to my girlfriend. I bet she'd love it...
Legend tells of a strange being known as an Elemental. Nobody I know has ever actually seen one with their own eyes, though...
I'm the dragon slayer! Now you have to call me the Hunter of Dragons!
I'm the Shining Puni slayer! Now you have to call me the Hero of the Age!
I'm the master of the five powers! Now you have to call me the Glorious Sage!
There used to be a lot more water all over the island. That's why there are canals everywhere.
It's really hard to keep the water clean. In lots of places it's really cloudy and foamy.
I wonder if the water here will dry up someday, like it did in Old Town... I hope not, I really like listening to how it flows.
Whoever controls the water, controls everything--that's what people used to say a long time ago. Living here on the island, it really makes a lot of sense.
That cape has a really amazing view--I think it might be my favorite place on the entire island. But there's probably even more amazing spots on the mainland.
Have you heard of the volcano far beyond the island? A traveler told me the view from the top just can't be beat.
The view from the top of Liese Valley must be really beautiful and impressive. I'd really love to see it for myself someday...
Oh, Ryza! Are you here to help me with the harvest?
You shouldn't wander off like that troublesome goat!
No matter what, stay away from that old castle! It might have hidden treasure, but it's also full of monsters!
There's a fairy tale about a goat that visits a valley, but the valley near the island is full of deadly monsters! Promise me you won't go near it!
Whew... That troublesome goat finally came back. I wish I could leave the island to go play sometime.
Things are peaceful, it's a beautiful night... All is well.
A nice summer rain at night is one of life's finer pleasures.
I just love the view out here. Do you have a favorite view? You should try and find a spot that you truly love.
Some parts of the world fully experience all four seasons. I'd sure like to go there someday...
It's so hot lately! I heard there are some areas overflowing with lava, but all I can think about is how much I hate this drought!
I've decided to go traveling. Fantastical ruins, tropical oceans... I want to see all the things you could never find here!
That Moritz fella is nothing but trouble. He completely disregarded what I had to say to him...!
Slaying a dragon? That's just disaster waiting to happen... I hope everything turns out okay.
You're lucky things went as well as they did. But please don't create any more problems for the village...
This is where I feel most at peace. I wish it could be like this forever...
Pudding is made with goat's milk. Thank you, goats!
I was thinking of new things we could make with our pudding. What about a Kurken Fruit flavored version? It would be so tangy and delicious...
Now that the pudding is really selling well, my mornings are way more busy. I'm not complaining, of course.
Dad got himself drunk again. I don't wanna go home till he's passed out.
If you're planning on leaving the island, I'm coming with you. It's the perfect chance to get some battle experience!
Stop wasting time and let's head to the old castle!
I can't believe we actually beat that dragon. Have we really gotten that strong...?
Compared to Lila's past, what I'm going through is basically nothing. I need to figure out how to deal with my problems better.
Ryza, could you take a look at my sword when you get a chance? Between the dragon and those Underworld beasts, who knows what might happen next?
A manmade island... It's almost too crazy to believe. Of course, after the Underworld I guess anything is possible. Anyway, let's just keep moving.
I'm useless when it comes to complex problems, but if you need someone to brute force something, I'm your man!
I was surprised to hear you wanted to leave the island. But can't stop after coming this far. Need to pay everyone back!
I happened to spot Lila the other day, and she had a huge load of sweets in her arms. I broke out in a cold sweat when I saw that...
Get lost. I'm not here to entertain you.
Hmph. You again? You got too much time on your hands.
Lent, you damn idiot. Where'd you run off to? I'm almost outta booze here...
Hey, you. Tell my useless kid if he has time play adventurer, he has time to get a damn job!
Agh, it's so damn hot out...! Where'd that little brat run off to? What a waste of space...
You're a weird one, Ryza. Nothin' good can come from hangin' out with my kid.
Huh? Where's Lent? Beats the hell outta me. Probably wanderin' around somewhere.
Bos... I guess there's nothing left to say.
Are you ready? I'm not a patient person. Hurry up and go so you can get back.
Rushing around aimlessly like usual, huh? Well...I guess I'd be worried if you *weren't* acting like that.
You better not cause any trouble for Bos!
Stop being so childish! You should learn to be more like Bos.
Oh, welcome! Actually, I'm restocking the merchandise right now. Could you come back a little later?
How could a merchant lose their own map? I guess we'll have to navigate on our own for now.
What? Now the compass is gone? How do you expect to safely make your way through this area? *sigh* I'll go find it, but try and be more careful...
Stay out of the Devil's Field. It's overflowing with dangerous monsters--more than a few adventurers have gotten themselves hurt there.
I've been getting more and more reports of monsters attacking travelers. Don't leave the island!
It seems like the monster attacks have tapered off, but you never know when a deadly beast could appear. Always be well prepared when you travel.
Kurken Island is as peaceful as ever. Hahaha!
I hope Kurken Island can start to develop more now that Lubart is here. Hahaha!
I heard a dragon has appeared on the mainland. How frightening! Hahaha!
It seems like that alchemist has been fighting with the fisherman. That's no good! Hahaha!
Ahh, it's been so hot lately! Looks like the drought is well on its way. Hahaha!
It's just so hot. I can't wait till the rain comes back! Hahaha!
Kurken Island is as peaceful as ever. Hahaha!
Word of our pudding has spread far and wide, and people are coming from all over to buy it. It's the perfect Kurken Island souvenir!
I'm planning to stand in line all night so I don't miss my chance to get some pudding! I just love having it with my breakfast.
Changes have been made. Save changes and exit?
Defeat 1 Great Guardian (Traveler's Road and Central Lime Plains).
Defeat 1 Lunaria Angel (Traveler's Road and Central Lime Plains).
Defeat 1 Boulder Soldiers (Liese Valley and Valley Path).
Defeat 4 Flower Gardeners (blocking the Traveler's Road and northeast of the port).
Defeat 1 Cloud Liner (blocking the Northern Fork area of the Traveler's Path).
Defeat 3 Punis (blocking the Traveler's Road north of the port).
Pamila is a newcomer from somewhere far away! She wants to try the Rasen Pudding, which I had a hand in inventing. I really hope it becomes popular!

Pamila has decided to stay with Bascila, and I found her taking a walk near my family's wheat farm. She said she didn't put that much thought into traveling--that she just started doing it one day. But does that kind of thing really happen?

Peter was interviewing Pamila, and when he asked if she had any questions for him, she was curious about any other specialties the island might have. I guess she's not gonna leave until she samples everything on the island at least once.

Pamila was out shopping, but forgot what she was looking for. Then she almost fell into the water. Gina was suggesting places for her to check out, and mentioned Treppe Hill. Pamila ran off before Gina could tell her how to get there. Everyone sees her as this mysterious traveler, but maybe she's just kind of an airhead...

Pamila visited Old Town, and while I was telling her why there were so many empty houses there, Barbara showed up. She let me know that she's been walking a lot more as part of her daily routine. Meanwhile, Pamila's excited to find fun new things to do each day--but apparently she's just as happy to wander around at random.

After visiting Fairystone Forest, Pamila found herself enamored with the Fairystones. I explained how the island uses the stones, and Jonna stopped by after finishing one of her training sessions. She mentioned that she's been preparing for her next martial arts competition.

After walking all over, Pamila decided that her favorite spot was a hill on a farm in one small corner of the island. She asked me if I'd noticed any small changes on the island, but to be honest I can't really tell. It just feels like absolutely nothing ever changes.
A piece of a strange stone tablet got caught in a fisherman's net! Pamila said she recognized it--maybe it's a clue to some amazing treasure!

We found out what the tablet is! It's the same as something that Pamila saw in a book a long time ago. We don't have the whole thing, but the piece we do have seems to point to a spot in Pixie Forest. Let's go and check it out!

We dug up the base of a tree and found a treasure chest! But it was just a bunch of junk inside... Pamila lost all interest, so she gave me her book. But I'm sure the real treasure is still waiting out there somewhere! Let's look for more pieces of the stone tablet!
Pat had another piece of the tablet. He said he didn't have any use for it and gave it to me! Okay, let's keep looking for more!
I asked Bascila about the tablet, but she didn't know anything about it. Maybe there aren't any more on the island...
I saw the goat at the volcano, and he gave me a piece of the tablet! But how'd he know I was looking for it...?

All the pieces of the tablet are back together again! And the final destination points right to the Traveler's Road! Pamila had to take time out to play with a friend of hers, so I'm going on ahead to check it out!
We finally found where the treasure is buried! But when I tried to dig it up, a monster appeared!

Barbara mentioned a fragrance that she'd like to find again--the scent of a flower included in a letter that she received when she got married. Klaudia seemed familiar with the flower, so I'm going to follow her lead to find out more.
The flower that Klaudia mentioned looks just like the one we're looking for, but Barbara said it isn't the same scent she remembers. I guess we have to look for more clues about the smell...

Barbara's legs are feeling a lot better, so she went to meet Pat at the Old Town cemetery. The two of them used to run around town along with Walter, causing all kinds of trouble. It must be nice holding on to that kind of relationship, even when you turn old and gray. I'm really glad I was able to help them.

Pat mentioned that Klaudia's outfit looked and felt just like the kind of thing he used to make when he used to run a dyehouse. I asked him why he didn't reopen his business, and he said it's because he doesn't have an apprentice to pass it on to. Hmm... I wonder if I know anyone that might fit the bill.

While talking with Pat, I was reminded of Rolf, who's been working as a local handyman. I asked Rolf if he'd be interested in becoming an apprentice, and he said he was! I feel like this could be a match made in heaven!
The travel-loving Daniel is back on the island! He ran into a little trouble in the mountains to the north, so he decided to come back early. But I'm glad to see he enjoyed himself!
Daniel made it all the way to that town, but he didn't ask to get his harmonica fixed--because he didn't have any money! But something seems a little off with him. I wonder if something happened...

I found Daniel playing his harmonica in the middle of Pixie Forest. It turns out, he didn't get it fixed because he saw his daughter working at the repair shop and got too nervous. Klaudia managed to convince him to give it another shot. I hope everything turns out okay...

Thanks to the makeup I created for her earlier, Jonna decided to join a martial arts competition to test her strength. She's like a totally different person now...but she seems happy, so I guess it's okay.

Jonna placed really high at her competition, and because of her performance a man named Milos came to the island to seek her out. I let him know that he'd just missed her, since she'd recently left for another competition on the mainland. He seemed a little timid, so I'm not sure what's going to happen now...

I was walking around the Traveler's Road, and found Jonna tending to Milos's wounds. It was exactly what I was afraid of... Anyway, I ended up having to fight off a bunch of monsters in Jonna's place.

With Klaudia's help, we were able to tell Mr. Valentz about the reopened dyehouse. And he said he'd talk to a merchant friend of his! I hope things start looking up, so Rolf won't have to worry anymore!

Rolf created a waterproof dye that he wants to add to all the kids' clothes on the island. The dyehouse has been way busier lately, but Rolf can't stop thinking about how he became a handyman to try and help out other villagers. So he's decided to restrict the number of orders for the dyehouse. It'll cut into his income, but it's exactly the kind of thing he would do!
Bascila has an idea! She wants to use goat's milk to make a new dessert.
Bascila finally finished her new dessert! It's known as "pudding," and we're all hoping it can become a new island specialty!

Peter's been looking all over to find a "big scoop" for his next article. I agreed to help him without really thinking about it, but I have no idea how I'm going to find any stories... I even asked around for ideas, but I'm not sure if anything's gonna come up.

I went to tell Peter about how well Rolf's dyehouse was doing, but he already knew all about it. Now he's gonna write another article about how I helped set it up. I just hope it doesn't turn out too weird...

I told Peter how Cynthia was taking a break from working on her textbook. He was sad at first, but then he came up with the idea to write an article about her class. I doubt his daughter Gina is gonna be happy about that...

Daniel's home again! And he was able to talk to his daughter, and ask her to fix his harmonica. Peter decided to pay Daniel a visit and ask him to describe all his travels in great detail. It looks like Daniel is back to normal now, so I'm really happy for him.

Peter brought up what I did while Edward, the island's doctor, was gone. I thought the interview would be too much of a pain, so I just ran away. But I did hear a little about Peter's time from before he came to the island. It's rare for him to talk about himself like that...

After helping out villagers whenever I could, I was surprised to learn I was suddenly really popular! Peter wanted to interview me about it, and after that was over I asked Peter why he loved the island so much. He told me about his time as a reporter in the city, and how he hit a roadblock in his work and decided to come to the island on a whim. You never really know where life might lead you...
I ran into a goat wandering around on the mainland! But I didn't get a hoofprint sheet of paper this time... I wonder what happened.

I was at Fressher's store doing some shopping, and I ran into Gina! She was there to buy a book--even at her age, she's already reading adult-level books. She really seems to have it together. I wonder what I was like when I was her age...

I ran into Gina at the beach. She said she was looking for a subject to write about--she's read so many stories written by others, she feels like she's finally ready to write her own. It looks like she wants to leave the island and become an author when she gets older. I think her dad would have a heart attack if he heard her say that...

Fressher got the book that Gina wanted to buy, but she didn't quite have enough to afford it. Fressher offered to give her a discount, but she refused. If I were her, I'd take the discount and call it my lucky day...

Peter read Gina's unfinished story, which made her REALLY mad. He showed up later and tried to calm her down--he was just worried she'd left the island, because of what she'd written. He recognized how talented she was, however, and started thinking about how he might be able to use that. I'm starting to understand what her life must be like with him as a dad...

Peter solved the problem of the pilfered book! He really does seem to know everything that happens on the island. Then he proposed a deal to Gina--let him publish her story alongside his articles, in exchange for the book. Gina completely refused...but it looks like they've made up, at least for the time being.
Cynthia's textbook seems to be coming along nicely, and Tao's really excited to help out. Apparently it's intended for the village's younger children.

I went to visit the school, and saw Elmer taking care of things. It sounds like Cynthia's been busy with her textbook, so she's been having her students work on their own a lot. I hope everything will be okay...

Cynthia decided to take a break from working on her textbook and focus on her students. I'm kinda sad it's gonna be delayed for a while. I hope I can help her out whenever she decides to go back to it.

After looking at the items I made, Edward said he's starting to remember his past. He was part of the army once, and there was also an alchemist with him. Empel doesn't seem to know who it could have been. I wonder what they were like...

I ran into Edward at the Maple Delta, and it sounds like his memory came back. A long time ago, he and the alchemist left the army to continue their journey on their own. There was an accident later, and he found his way to Kurken Island. If it weren't for that, we never would have met, so it's kind of a weird feeling. Either way, I'm glad Edward found what he was looking for!
Edward is back on the island. He left behind the equipment I made for him as a clue for the alchemist. I can't help but wonder if I'll ever meet her...
Lila and Romy--what an odd combination. But I guess Lila's actually a regular customer of hers. I've never seen anyone run circles around Lila like that, but I guess that's how Romy is with everyone.
I found Romy's ledger at Kurken Port. She didn't leave too long ago, so maybe I can still catch up to her. I'm sure she needs it, so I need to hurry and try to find her.

Romy came back to the island sooner than I expected! I don't know the details, but I guess she turned a nice profit thanks to Mr. Valentz. She said she's planning to stay on the island for a while, so I'll have to pay her a visit next time I need something.
I wanted to ask about the stone tablet, but I got roped into doing some repair work instead. So now I need to go get some lumber...
Romy had a piece of the stone tablet! But I'm gonna have to trade her for it... I really want to get my hands on all those fragments!
Barbara has chronic leg pain and can't move too well. Can I make a medicine to help her?
Barbara asked me to go get her something from Pixie Forest. Apparently Barbara has never left the island herself--to be honest, that's really hard for me to understand.
I finally figured out how to capture the flower's fragrance! It's called the Delphi Rose Incense. I should make it and give it to Barbara.
Pat's looking for Fairystone fragments. There aren't really any nearby, so I offered to take care of it for him. I'm pretty sure I can find some in Fairystone Forest, near the port.
I got some sturdy lumber to help out Rolf and Pat. Now I need to make a Composite Plate and bring it to them.
It looks like the dyehouse preparations are almost complete. I'd better bring them all the materials they need to update the equipment.
I need to prepare some cloth to practice his dyeing.
Daniel's back! He agreed to tell me some of his stories if I told him what I've been up to. I'll show him what I can do with alchemy!
Daniel's favorite harmonica is broken, so he's going to take it to a music shop Klaudia told him about. I should make him some items that'll be useful on his trip.
Daniel gave up on getting his harmonica fixed. Maybe I should make him a new one...
Jonna's waiting patiently for her Prince Charming, and in the meantime she wants to learn how to sew. I'm happy to make whatever she needs to learn.
Jonna asked me to make her some "battle makeup." Does that mean she wants something that will make her a better fighter...?
Jonna wants me to make something that can send letters to faraway places super fast. I'm thinking something a little...explosive!
Jonna made it all the way to the finals in her very first martial arts competition! I'm gonna make her some armor to help her in her next one!
I ended up having to put together the materials Milos needs to prepare his meal. I don't mind helping out...as long as I get to taste the finished product.
Rolf's working hard on his job as a handyman, and I need to bring him some lumber.
Rolf asked me for new materials to make some repairs. I'll bring it to him as soon as it's ready.
Rolf's been struggling to balance his dyehouse tasks with his handyman jobs, but he thinks he knows how to resolve the problem. He wants me to bring him some thick cloth.
Fressher usually picks up the goat's milk, but he's nowhere to be found. Bascila can't leave, so I'll make the delivery myself!
Bascila's so funny! She wants to find seeds to grow something "exciting." But is that even possible...?
The pudding's a huge hit! But now they're running low on sugar. Let's see if I can make more...
Peter's looking for his "next big scoop," but he missed his chance to catch a new type of bug. Now it's up to me to make some honey to lure it in...
I decided to make an item using alchemy, like Peter asked. I guess the more obvious it is that I used alchemy, the better.
That goat in the forest! It seemed hungry, so I guess I should bring it some paper?
The goat gave me a sheet of paper with a hoof print on it. Is it trying to tell me something? Maybe I should ask Bascila about it...
Peter's daughter Gina says her father's making her find something to write about. I think I can help by making some fishing bait.
I told Gina about my adventures, and ended up having to gather some materials. I wonder if she's planning on using it as reference for a story...
Cynthia takes education VERY seriously, so I need to go out and gather some ore for her students.
Cynthia asked me to bring her something she'll need to make her textbook.
Cynthia wants ink made with alchemy. Once I heard that Empel expects me to be able to make it, I don't really have any choice but to do it...
Edward is the only doctor on the island, and he needs more medical supplies. I hope I can get some for him...
Edward asked me to bring him some Supplements. But will that really help him get his memory back?
Daniel told Edward he met an alchemist, and Edward thinks it might be the one he knew long ago. He's going to chase after her, so I'm going to make him some items he might need on his trip.
An emergency patient showed up while Edward was gone! I don't think I can treat him, but I can at least come up with some medicine...!
Romy's a traveling merchant, and now she's back! I'm gonna get her that wheat she's always wanted.
The goat is surrounded by monsters and can't escape! Let's go and defeat them!
Romy heard about my adventures on the mainland, so now she wants me to hunt down some monsters. I guess they're kind of strong, so I hope I can handle it...
Rolf's handyman business isn't doing so well. I wonder why more people don't hire him... I should go ask around!
I'm glad Rolf reopened the dyehouse, but they don't have too many customers. I should ask around and see what I can do to help.
Someone else ended up buying the book that Gina ordered. Let's see if we can find whoever bought it!
Cynthia's son has disappeared! Let's ask around town and find out if anyone has seen him.
I went to give Romy her ledger, and found her hiding from some monsters! Romy doesn't seem too concerned, but the monsters seem pretty powerful to me...
The goat that's been traveling all over the mainland finally came home! I'm glad it didn't get hurt or anything...but how did it find its way back?
Pamila walked around the entire island. Once she finishes enjoying her pudding she is going on a journey. I think I'll keep quiet so she will stay here forever.
Romy might know something about the stone tablet...
Barbara lives in the Boden district. I wonder if something's bothering her...
I figured out what the fragrance is, but I have no idea how to recreate it. I need to do some more research.
Pat lives in Old Town. I wonder if he needs anything...
I wonder if Rolf needs anything...
I wonder if Daniel needs anything...
I wonder if Daniel needs anything...
Jonna's always looking to leave the island. I should go talk to her.
Peter's always running around the island, searching for his next "big scoop." I wonder what he's up to in Fairystone Forest...
...I hear a cry I don't recognize.
I noticed Gina, the daughter of local town snoop Peter, talking to Wendy. I wonder what's going on...
Edward isn't here right now. I wonder what happened...
Hey, is that...Romy? She's the merchant that always buys my family's wheat. I should go talk to her!
I'm sure there's lots of stuff near home that I can use for alchemy! I should look around the west side of the island and gather whatever I can find.
Some materials have mystical properties, and I'll need them if I want to make really amazing items.
The hammer is a really useful exploration tool! All I need to do is smash stuff apart and I'm sure I'll find lots of valuable stuff!
The explosion can blow the biggest boulders to smithereens!
The easiest way to defeat any monster is with a bomb! I should make lots of them to take into battle.
When it comes to battle, medicine is the best medicine! I should make a bunch to bring with me.
Some equipment reveals its magical elements when you put it on. I should try making as much as I can!
Practice makes perfect when it comes to alchemy!
Now I have an even bigger list of stuff I can make!
It's important to make lots of different stuff, but it's just as important to see just how good I can make one specific thing!
This is the unknown world you can only discover by obtaining more materials! Let's try out as many different things as possible!
All I need is a single swing to take down the enemy!
I came up with a good idea while I was fighting. I should try it out in my next battle!
I need to make sure to use the items I've made early and often in battle.
Core Crystals lose their strength if you use them too much. But if you just use the items instead, they'll get it back eventually.
How strong can you get if you only master one single item? Let's find out.
I can make lots of items now, but let's see just how far I can go. I'm gonna let my imagination run wild!
Experience is essential! Let's start out by beating up on some Punis.
We're getting better at smacking down monsters. Let's try and find something a little more challenging.
We're ready for even stronger monsters now! We can't let it go to our heads, but let's go and fight something really tough!
You never know when our techniques will come in handy, so we have to practice as much as we can.
I can definitely tell I'm way stronger than before. I wanna test out my new moves!
Look for an opening and take your chance to strike! That's something you always have to keep in mind.
In order to attack effectively, you need support from the rest of your team.
I need to practice my timing for follow-up attacks.
I'm so bad at stuff like tactics. But it's an important part of getting stronger.
Beating down monsters with brute strength is great and all, but it's also important to figure out their weak points.
Exploiting weak points is a great way to keep my allies safe, so I should try to do it even more.
I need to practice my ultimate abilities whenever the opportunity presents itself!
My goal is to reach the top of the tower. And I WILL achieve my goal!
My heart is pounding...! I'm about to achieve my dream!
I reached my goal, but now I have a new goal--to keep growing and become even stronger!
I'm a more confident fighter now, but I need to always remember the basics. Let's do a little teamwork review!
If we can all close the distance and strike at the same time, the enemy won't stand a chance. Ryza, Lila, let's give it a shot!
Whenever I walk around town, I seem to notice something new about the island. So let's go for a walk!
The mainland is filled with things you'll never find written in a book. We should make a point to jot down anything that piques our interest.
Whenever I discover something new, I love to write down everything that I notice.
I want to make sure I'm fully prepared if we ever come here again, so I should write something down in the Exploration Log.
Every experience can be described from a variety of perspectives. You're bound to discover something new every time you read through it!
I'm not especially interested in getting stronger, but I need to be able to defend myself while we're exploring dangerous areas.
I'm getting used to fighting, but I have to keep training to make sure I'm useful.
I've trained hard to improve my skills, but I need to learn to get even better...!
I've been recording all the monsters we've encountered--the more we understand their biology, the better we'll be at fighting them.
Our record is growing, but now that we're encountering even deadlier monsters, I have to make sure my notes are even more detailed.
I'm not sure what materials are good for what syntheses, but I need to keep a detailed record nonetheless.
There are so many things out here I've never seen on the island. It's so exciting!
Any items Ryza can make, we can use without any worries. So I should train with them a lot to make sure I can support everyone...!
I'm not good at fighting, but I think a lot about how to move around on the field. I should make a point of observing everyone else.
I had no idea our island was manmade! I need to investigate it more!
I'm starting to learn more about different items. Let's do a quick review on how to use Core Crystals.
Apparently there's a flower that's like the ultimate medicine. Ryza's alchemy might be good enough to make use of it now...
Father uses Gold Coins all the time when doing business with other merchants, but that doesn't seem to be so common here.
Father only has the highest quality goods, so he can't sell them for cheap. But trading them for Gold Coins seems like a sound business strategy.
Ryza, have you been going to the shop regularly? There's no point in hoarding things you don't need--go ahead and sell them off.
If you want the village to grow, you need to circulate money into the economy. I'm sure we can sell Ryza's creations for a nice profit.
There are many villagers in need, and we end up helping them without even realizing it. You've certainly noticed that, haven't you Ryza?
You shouldn't expect to receive anything in return, but of course it feels nice if you *do* get something.
I'm not fit to fight on the frontlines, but I'm happy to support you from behind.
I can watch everyone's movements from behind, so that's a great way for me to practice my teamwork.
I'll keep practicing so that I can move as one along with everyone else.
I heard there are lots of valuables hidden on the island. Is that something you're interested in, Ryza?
Kurken Island is full of mystery. And lots of treasure to go along with it, of course.
There's no way to know why people left behind their belongings long ago, but it's only right that we put them to good use.
Fighting monsters is kind of scary, but it's a necessary part of any adventure. I'll keep training so I don't drag down everyone else.
I think I'm getting used to fighting. But I want to keep getting better so I can help everyone else.
You can count on me to support you! ...Is something I'd like to be able to say someday. So for now, I'll keep on training.
Ryza, have you prepared plenty of goods to sell? Now might be a good time...
I'm tired of always being protected in battle. I'd like to be on the attacking end for once. Tao, Empel, will you help me?
Gathering is the first step of any synthesis. Find anything that might be useful for alchemy, then bring it back with you to study it.
The soil here is quite unique. Imagine what natural treasures are hidden beneath it...
Areas like this are few and far between. I have high hopes of finding the highest quality materials.
You continue to improve as an alchemist. I believe I'll have you make something specific...
Ryza, I'd like you to show me the true essence of your alchemy.
I still can't make quick movements. I suppose I'll just have to get used to it.
I've grown too accustomed to having Lila protect me. I need to learn to take care of myself again.
I'd like to assess the condition of my arm. Ryza, could I ask you to help me?
My arm is fine, for the most part. Now it's the rest of my body that can't keep up.
You can't always simply attack the enemy head-on. Your choice of items only becomes more important. Here, let me give it a try...
You must use your most powerful items wisely in battle. Ryza, I'll leave the synthesizing to you while I practice on my own.
I can tell just how much Ryza has grown as an alchemist simply by looking at the items she's created.
Even if my body can no longer make use of them, my experiences speak to me. Still, I need to exercise as much as I can to make sure I stay in shape.
Even at my age, I still have much to learn. I should increase my training.
Alchemy is about more than simply creating items. I'll show you what an alchemist can do...!
As your alchemy improves, you can better ascertain what materials you need. This is both the foundation and ultimate goal of gathering.
Ryza, don't you crave sweets when you're feeling tired? Creating food with alchemy is actually a very good practice activity.
He certainly fights differently than when I was protecting him. I need to learn how to fight with his back turned to me.
Most fights are decided by the total number of strikes. That's where I excel.
Having a favorite weapon is fine, but each one has its own benefits and drawbacks. Ryza, could I ask you to make a weapon?
I think our defenses could be improved. Ryza, could I ask you to make some armor?
Empel, how is your arm doing? I'm going to observe you as we take on the Philuscha.
They still have overwhelming numbers. Help me exterminate them.
You've been continuing your training, right Lent? A powerful enemy has been sighted, so let's go check it out together.
Another powerful enemy has been spotted. Lent, are you ready?
You can win against even the strongest enemy, if you employ the right tactics. Teamwork is the key to victory.
A strong defense isn't always enough--sometimes you must silence the enemy with a powerful strike.
We've received word of a powerful enemy. We're up, Lent.
Up until now, I've only had to worry about Empel so I've essentially been fighting solo. But now we're a large group, so I should observe for a while.
You must continually put your skills to use, or you'll get rusty. Do not neglect your daily training.
I've been fighting for a long time now, but I still enjoy discovering new things in the midst of battle. Constant practice is necessary so that everything you learn will stick with you.
This battle technique is very powerful, but it takes some time to recover. I need to practice it each and every day to make sure I use it at the right time.
A world created with the Gathering Synthesizer is inhabited by very powerful monsters. Ryza, could you prepare such a world?
The best way to silence a monster is to strike its weakpoint. This is a basic tactic in battle, so let's review it.

Talk to people in the Boden district, Old Town, and Kurken Port.
Talk to people in Kurken Port and the Rasen district, then talk to Fressher.
Talk to people in the Boden district and Kurken Port.
Talk to people in the Boden district, the Rasen district, and Kurken Port.
Daniel loves to travel, but he's finally back! Where did his adventures take him this time?
Bascila has an idea! She wants to use goat's milk to make a new dessert.
The goat's milk-based pudding is finished! I hope it can become an island specialty...
Barbara has chronic leg pain and can't move too well. Can I make a medicine to help her?
Pat wants some Fairystone fragments. It's too dangerous for him, so I'll take care of it!
Jonna wants to sew while she waits for her Prince Charming. Let's see if I can help...
Fressher usually picks up the goat's milk, but he's nowhere to be found. Bascila can't leave, so I'll make the delivery myself!
Bascila's so funny! She wants to find seeds to grow something "exciting." But is that even possible...?
The pudding's a huge hit! But now they're running low on sugar. Let's see if I can make more...
Peter's looking for his "next big scoop," but he missed his chance to catch a new type of bug. Now it's up to me to make some honey to lure it in...
That white animal in the forest! It seemed hungry, so I guess I should bring it some paper?
Peter's daughter Gina says her father's making her find something to write about. I think I can help by making some fishing bait.
Cynthia takes education VERY seriously, so I need to go out and gather some ore for her students.
Edward is the only doctor on the island, and he needs more medical supplies. I hope I can get some for him...
Romy's a traveling merchant, and now she's back! I'm gonna get her that wheat she's always wanted.
Rolf's handyman business isn't doing so well. I wonder why more people don't hire him...
Gather at the west side of the island.
See the True Power of Alchemy
A strange traveler has come to town! I wonder if we'll start getting more tourists...
Daniel loves to travel, but he's finally back! Where did his adventures take him this time?
Bascila has an idea! She wants to use goat's milk to make a new dessert.
The goat's milk-based pudding is finished! I hope it can become an island specialty...
Barbara has chronic leg pain and can't move too well. Can I make a medicine to help her?
Pat wants some Fairystone fragments. It's too dangerous for him, so I'll take care of it!
Jonna wants to sew while she waits for her Prince Charming. Let's see if I can help...
Fressher usually picks up the goat's milk, but he's nowhere to be found. Bascila can't leave, so I'll make the delivery myself!
Bascila's so funny! She wants to find seeds to grow something "exciting." But is that even possible...?
The pudding's a huge hit! But now they're running low on sugar. Let's see if I can make more...
Peter's looking for his "next big scoop," but he missed his chance to catch a new type of bug. Now it's up to me to make some honey to lure it in...
That white animal in the forest! It seemed hungry, so I guess I should bring it some paper?
Peter's daughter Gina says her father's making her find something to write about. I think I can help by making some fishing bait.
Cynthia takes education VERY seriously, so I need to go out and gather some ore for her students.
Edward is the only doctor on the island, and he needs more medical supplies. I hope I can get some for him...
Romy's a traveling merchant, and now she's back! I'm gonna get her that wheat she's always wanted.

Increased defense. If there is an ally in the same row: Front row; you'll be targeted more, and may take damage for another character. Back row; you'll take reduced damage.
Increased speed. Chance to gain extra AP when using normal attacks.
Increased attack and critical rate. If there is an ally in the same row, increased critical damage.
Increased defense. If there is an ally in the same row: Front row; you'll be targeted more, and may take damage for another character. Back row; you'll take reduced damage.
In addition to the Supporter effect, if there is an ally in the same row, your Quick Actions will cost less AP. If there is no ally nearby, you will not be attacked unless specifically targeted.

Increased attack, speed, and critical rate, but reduced defense. If there is an ally in the same row, the entire row will gain increased critical damage. If you are alone in your row, your speed will increase further.
In addition to the High Defender effect, you will have increased attack but reduced speed. If you are alone in your row, your defense will increase.
In addition to the High Supporter effect, you will have increased defense but reduced attack.
Increased attack, defense, and speed. Gain extra AP when using Core Items. If there is no ally nearby, the effect of items will increase.
Increased attack, defense, speed. Boosts the power of the Fatal Drive for allies within range. If there is an ally behind you, you'll be targeted more.

Increases ally stats during the daytime.
Slightly increases the amount of Cole obtained.
Weather is more likely to become sunny.
Weather is more likely to become rainy.
Slightly increases the power of ice and wind.
Slightly increases the power of fire and lightning.
Increases ally stats when the weather is sunny.
Reduces the time needed to gather from the garden.
Slightly increases Gold Coin drop rate.
Increases ally stats during the nighttime.
Increases ally stats when it's raining.
A book popular among prospectors. You'll probably find at least some useful in here.
Detailed information about the Traveler's Road. The variety of knowledge contained in this well researched book is sure to be of use.
It's important to adjust your gathering methods in order to obtain higher quality materials.^00^00Target: Taun

An elusive Uni of the highest quality--even a hundred years later, its quality remains unchanged. At least, that's what the collectors say... If you're an Uni lover, this is for you.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Uni<CLNR>^00Feature: High quality
A rare type of fuel said to burn forever. Handle with extreme care.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Eternal Fire<CLNR>

Sand that glitters like gold dust. Despite its appearance, it's not made of metal and in fact contains a significant amount of normal sand. High purity is extremely rare to find.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Shining Sand<CLNR>

A lovely flower that brings to mind the Sun. Nobody knows where they come from, and they're extremely difficult to grow in captivity. If you ever find one out in the wild, be sure to bring it back with you.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Flower of the Sun<CLNR>
A mysterious crystal that won't chip or crack no matter what you do to it. It's often given as a gift to signify the giver's undying emotion.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Eternal Crystal<CLNR>
The oil from this fruit can bring out a wood's natural luster and color. It might help modify the look of your atelier.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Soleil Fruit<CLNR>
A rough type of wood that's nonetheless easy to shape. It's quite a rarity on Kurken Island. It might help modify the look of your atelier.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Grizzly Wood<CLNR>

Sap collected from the fabled Akashia tree. It can be used to make a high quality paint that highlights the natural texture of whatever it's applied to. It might help modify the look of your atelier.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Akashia Sap<CLNR>
An extremely hydrophobic oil, which makes it popular as a waterproofing agent. It might help modify the look of your atelier.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Waterproof Oil<CLNR>
An old memo obtained from a firearms expert. It explains how to create bullets that harness the power of air and water.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Handheld Warheads<CLNR>
A book that examines the magical power of the moon. It's said that moonlight is the source of mana itself.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Moon Magic<CLNR>
A record of all of the major earthquakes throughout history. According to some experts, the information contained within would allow us to predict future quakes.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Rage of Gaia<CLNR>
A compilation of instructions for mixing medicine. It also has details on how to make a base for use with all the listed medicines.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Prayer for Health<CLNR>
An encyclopedia detailing the various cloths of the world. Combining the cloth listed within may well lead to the creation of a truly fantastical fabric.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Fantasy Cloth<CLNR>
A record of all of the world's greatest storms. According to some experts, the information contained within would allow us to predict future storms.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Book of Storms<CLNR>

A guidebook popular with ancient travelers. It's been out of print for years, but due to its quality and high demand, the rare surviving copy still circulates among collectors.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Travel Companions<CLNR>
An accessory once worn by a number of different famous adventurers. It's mostly valued as an antique, but may still provide some greater use.^00^00Trade: <CLGR>Equipment<CLNR>
